loans.name: Carmen

texts.en:
Carmen works hard to support her family. Carmen is married and has a buy and sell chickens business in the Philippines.

Carmen requested a PHP 29500 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her chickens.

Carmen has been in this business for 3 years now.

Carmen would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her chickens

loans.name: Nhóm 27 Minh Hợp Minh Lộc Group

texts.en:
Hời is 51 years old and she is married with three children. Hời is the group leader of the 27 Minh Hợp Minh Lộc solidarity group, which consists of five members. 

In 2009, Hời joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Hời has successfully repaid six loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

Hời is applying for a loan to purchase a fishing-net to catch fish. She operates a food stall/restaurant selling fish.

Hời has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that Hời faces in her business is the lack of capital.

In the future, Hời hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, to buy a motorbike, and for her children to find a good job.

loans.use: to purchase a fishing-net to catch fish

loans.name: 030804080003.thiệu Toán Group

texts.en:
Ms Hưng works in agriculture raising cattle. She is requesting a loan to purchase more baby cattle to raise and sell in future.

Hưng is 49 years old and she is single with 2 children.  She is the group leader of the 030804080003.Thiệu Toán solidarity group, which consists of 4 members and she lives and works in Thieu Hoa district, a  rural area in Thanh Hoa province, with 1 dependent.

In 2011, Hưng joined Thanh Hoa microfinance institution to improve her  business. Hưng has successfully repaid 2 loans from Thanh Hoa microfinance institution. Hưng has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.

The main hardship that Hưng faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Hưng hopes to make enough money to provide for her kids, for her business to do well and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase more baby cattle to raise and sell in future, so as to provide for her children

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es:
Ana, con la ayuda del préstamo anterior continúa elaborando tortillas para vender y tener los recursos económicos que tanto necesita para cubrir las necesidades primordiales de su familia, 
Como su negocio es prácticamente de subsistencia, nuevamente hace la solicitud de un financiamiento a Padecomsm y a los inversionistas Kiva para comprar maíz y leña, tendrá materia prima para preparar la venta de tortillas, de esta manera se mantendrá trabajando por una larga temporada.
texts.en:
With the help of her previous loan, Ana continues to make and sell tortillas and has the economic resources she needs so much to cover her family's basic necessities.

Since her business gives her just enough to survive, she is making a new request for a loan from Padecomsm and the Kiva investors in order to buy corn and firewood. Then she will have the raw materials to prepare tortillas for sale and in this way she will keep on working for a long time to come.

loans.use: to buy corn and firewood. Then she will have the raw materials to prepare tortillas for sale.

loans.name: Phoeut's Group

texts.en:
Originally from the village of Seim Reap province’s Srey Snom district, Phoeut is age 44 and is married with five dependent children, two of whom are in school.

For more than 24 years, she and her husband have been farming rice and raising pigs as their primary sources of income for the family and they can earn about KHR 26,000 a day and manage to save about 12,000 each day for the future needs.

Phoeut has just started working with VisionFund this cycle. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. Phoeut wants to buy a decent motorbike for her children to commute to school. She hopes to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy a decent motorbike for her children to commute to school

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Srey Snom district

loans.name: Jose

texts.en: Jose is known in his neighborhood area as being a hardworking father. He is engaged in farming activities as his primary source of income to provide for his family. He became a member of PMPC, and appreciates the various programs and services that the co-op offers. He hopes to live comfortably, with a decent house. For this reason, he applied for a loan of PHP 10,000 to purchase cement, sand and hollow blocks to complete his house for safe and comfortable living. Jose wishes to improve his business to continuously provide for his family.

loans.use: to purchase cement, sand and hollow blocks to complete his house for safe and comfortable living

location.town: Oroquieta-Lower Lamac, Oroquieta City, Misamis Occ

loans.name: Tojiniso

texts.en:
Tojiniso is a brave woman. She was born in the southern part of Tajikistan in 1960. She is living in a remote district with her family. She is a widow and has a child. 

Tojiniso has many years of practice doing business in the domestic market. She buys and sells textiles for sewing traditional women's dresses. After her husband's death, she was responsible to feed her child alone. She was used to working hard in order to feed her child. 

Tojiniso is asking for financial support from Kiva lenders to buy new additional textile goods for the upcoming season. She hopes to be supported by Kiva and IMON.

loans.use: to buy new additional textile goods for the upcoming season

loans.name: Marqueza

texts.en:
Marqueza is single and has a business selling ready-to-wear clothing in the Philippines.

Marqueza requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock of ready-to-wear to sell to her customers.

Marqueza has been in this business for five years now.

In the future, Marqueza would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of ready-to-wear to sell to her customers

loans.name: Ma. Linda

texts.en:
Ma. Linda is a married woman with nine children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Ma. Linda is 45 years old and has six children who are currently in school.

Ma. Linda has a fishing/fish vending business in the Philippines. Ma. Linda requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional materials for her business.

Ma. Linda has been in this business for 12 years. In the future, Ma. Linda would like to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional materials for her business

loans.name: Dilafruz

texts.en: Dilafruz is a generous woman. She was born in the southern part of Tajikistan in 1979. She is living in a village with her family. She is married and has two children. She has a business selling shoes, women's and men's bags. She has two stores for selling in the domestic market. She is attractive and communicative to her customers. She is well known among friends and sellers. She has regular clients every day. She does the business by herself and brings an income to the family budget. Her husband is a rental worker. The basic financial income for her family is from her business. She tries to ensure her children will have a better standard of living. She asked for a loan from Kiva lenders to buy shoes and bags in the upcoming new trends. She wishes to be supported.

loans.use: to buy shoes and bags in the upcoming new trends

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna is 38 years old and married with four children.

She runs an agricultural business, raising a pig in the Philippines. Edna is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pig.

Edna has been in this business for 10 years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies for raising her pig

loans.name: Margarita

texts.en:
Margarita works hard to support her family. Margarita is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Margarita requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell in her general store. Margarita has been in this business for 4 years now.

Margarita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Ma. Diara

texts.en:
Ma. Diara is 46 years old and married with three children.

She runs an agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Ma. Diara is borrowing PHP 5,000 through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Ma. Diara has been in this business for 10 years and also earns additional income from buying and selling coco lumber.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Ninfa

texts.en:
Ninfa is 59 years old and married with eleven children.

She runs an agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Ninfa is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pig.

Ninfa has been in this business for 3 years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies for raising her pig

loans.name: Marichu

texts.en:
Marichu is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing/fish vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy more materials for her fishing/fish vending business.

Marichu has been in this business for 6 years. Marichu earns more income from a general store.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Marichu has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure her family's future.

loans.use: to buy more materials for her fishing business

loans.name: Nargis Group

texts.en: Bushra is a 37-year-old woman, happily married with two daughters and two sons. Bushra is very a responsible lady and caters to all the problems coming forth very keenly. She is now worried about her husband who used to work for a contractor but then he started to drive a tricycle cart, so he had to work very hard. But now he has decided that he should buy a motorized rickshaw so that he can increase his efficiency and bring in more profit to meet the rising rate of inflation. Bushra is thankful to Kiva and its field partner BRAC.

loans.use: to buy a motorized rickshaw for her husband

loans.name: Claudia Arely

texts.es:
Claudia, está felizmente casada, vive con su grupo familiar integrado por su esposo y su hija de 9 años de edad, solo depende una apersona de ella; desde hace 6 años inicio a vender medicina natural y química entre otros productos para tener la oportunidad de generar ingresos económicos con los cuales apoya en los gastos de su hogar, el oficio lo heredo de su familia y por su experiencia en el negocio no representa dificultades en este momento.
Ha decidido solicitar un crédito para invertirlo en antibióticos, analgésicos, vitaminas, especias etc., de está manera presentara un mejor inventario a sus clientes, pretende dar un mejor servicio, aumentar su cartera de clientes y continuar generando ingresos para cubrir sus compromisos.
Sus aspiraciones son expandir su negocio en el mercado y que sus hijos tengan oportunidad de estudiar en la universidad para que tengan un mejor futuro.
texts.en:
Claudia is happily married.  She lives with her family group which is made up of her husband and her 9 year old daughter.  Only one person depends on her.  For the past six years she has been selling natural health products and medicines, among other items in order to have the chance to generate income and thus support household expenses.  She learned the job through her family and because of her experience in the field she is not experiencing difficulties at this time.  

She has decided to request a loan in order to invest in antibiotics, analgesics, vitamins, spices, etc and in this way she will have a better inventory for her customers.  She wants to provide the best service, increase her client base, and continue to generate income in order to cover her obligations. 

She hopes to expand her business into the local market and that her children will have the opportunity to study at the college level so that they can have a better future.

loans.use: to invest in antibiotics, analgesics, vitamins, spices, etc and in this way she will have a better inventory for her customers.

loans.name: Morena

texts.en:
Morena owns and operates a spare-parts store. She sells various motorcycle parts like aluminum sprockets, filters, chargers, brake shoes and many others. She is a 47-year-old married woman with two grown children. For almost two years now, Morena has been engaged in running this kind of business.

She has requested a loan to buy a compressor and other spare parts.  This will help improve the inventory of her store and enable her to attract more buyers. Thus, she could augment her income and be able to pay her obligations as well. In this way, she could now be able to expand her ongoing business.

She is determined to handle her source of income properly so that it will be sustainable in the years to come.

loans.use: to buy a compressor and other spare parts

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita is 44 years old and is married with one child.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 30,000 Philippines peso (PHP) loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, soap, milk, sugar, egg, noodles, etc.

Carmelita has borrowed and paid back 21 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns an income from food vending and farming rice.

She aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, soap, milk, sugar, egg, noodles, etc.

loans.name: Tamanno

texts.en:
Tamanno is a generous woman. She was born in the southern part of Tajikistan in 1985. She is a businesswoman and does her business in a big city. She is divorced and has a child. She has been working at a medical clinic as a nurse for more than five years. Her standard of living is normal. 

The weather is warm and her food at home is spoiling. She has no refrigerator at her house. Her salary and saved-up money are not enough to purchase a refrigerator. She appealed to IMON and Kiva asking for a loan to buy a refrigerator. She hopes to be supported by Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a married woman with one child who attends school. Fatuma owns a house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Fatuma has operated a charcoal-selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She mentioned competition as a major challenge in her business.
 
With the KES 50,000, she wants to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale

loans.name: Betty.

texts.en: Betty is a 23-year-old single lady living in Bundibugyo, Uganda. She sells new clothes to the people around her town and has been in business for four years. She is a hardworking woman looking forward to expanding her business but faces hardships of competition and limited capital to meet all her personal and business expectations. She is requesting a loan to buy more clothes to sell.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Abida Group

texts.en:
Abida is 45 years old. She is a responsible mother of three daughters. She is a housewife and looks after her family, which is comprised of six people. Her husband is a tailor by profession. He provides stitching services to people at his shop. He needs to purchase a juki (sewing) machine and a variety of stitching materials to enhance his work.

This is very important for him to continue his work efficiently and professionally. However, due to the lack of money, he finds it difficult. So Abida is requesting a loan from Kiva's field partner BRAC Pakistan. Abida is very thankful to Kiva's partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a juki (sewing) machine for sewing cloth by her husband.

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith is a married woman who has five children, all of whom attend school. Judith lives in a rental house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Judith has operated a charcoal-selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a stiff competition from other firewood operators in her business.
 
With the KES 50,000 she wants to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale

loans.name: Maxima

texts.en:
Maxima is a dealer of a Vita Plus products (a natural health drink) with various fruit flavors and supplements.  She is a 51-year-old married woman with four children from Talibon, Bohol. She has been engaged in this kind of business for a month now. She needs additional capital to finance her on-going business.

She is asking for a loan to buy additional Vita Pus products like juice and supplements. These will enable Maxima to cater to her respective customers' orders. Her income will slowly improve and she will be able to augment her income. In this way, she will now be able to rollover her capital and do some expansion

In the future, Maxima hopes that she will be able to properly handle her current business so it is sustainable.

loans.use: to buy additional Vita Plus products like juice and supplements

loans.name: Vivencia

texts.en:
Vivencia is 60 years old and runs a sari-sari (variety) store. She sells basic commodities like biscuits, canned goods, edible oil, coffee, sugar, noodles, soft drinks and toiletries.  She is a widowed woman with five grown dependents. She has been running a store for more than 10 years.

Vivencia  is asking for a loan in the amount of 25,000 PHP to buy assorted groceries, firewood and charcoal. These will fill her store and help her to attract buyers to purchase. Thus, Vivencia's income will improve and she will be able to balance her finances. She could now start to expand her sari-sari (variety) store. 
 
She is determined enough to improve her business and become successful in the years to come.

loans.use: to buy assorted groceries, firewood and charcoal

loans.name: Hurmatoi

texts.en: Hurmatoi is a wise woman. She was born in the southern part of Tajikistan in 1971. She is living in a remote district with her family. She is married and has a child. For more than five years, she has been working at the central medical clinic. She has gained good experience during these five years. She needs to prepare documents for her house. She appealed to IMON requesting a loan to prepare documents for her house. She wishes to be supported by Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to prepare documents for her house

loans.name: Michelle

texts.en:
Michelle is 24 years old and a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Michelle has a fishing/fish vending business in the Philippines. Michelle requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional fishing materials for her business.

Michelle has been in this business for seven years. In the future, Michelle would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional fishing materials for her business

loans.name: Solangie

texts.es: Solangie es una joven de 30 años de edad, madre de una niña y soltera. Vive en unión libre con el padre de su hija. Trabajadora y con visión empresarial. Una de sus metas es crecer en su actividad productiva. Ella inició su negocio con el objetivo de generar ingresos y ayudar a su compañero en el hogar aprovechando la oportunidad que se le presentaba,asi de igual manera sentirse con independencia económica. Se dedica al comercio ambulante de ropa fina de mujer y hombre, además de sandalias reef y roxy, desde hace cinco años y le va muy bien, gracias al buen trato y facilidad que le brinda a sus clientes. Cuenta con el apoyo de su familia cuando tiene que salir a vender o cobrar su mercadería. En sus créditos anteriores se ha caracterizado por su responsabilidad y puntualiadad. Ella solicita financiamiento para reforzar su negocio comprando más variedad de mercadería y además de comprar joyería en acero. Su meta es superarse y crecer tanto a nivel personal como de negocios, asi mejorar su calidad de vida junto con la de su familia.
texts.en:
Solangie is a young woman of 30 years. She is an unmarried mother with one daughter. She lives in a common-law relationship with her daughter's father. Hardworking and with an eye for business, one of her goals is to increase her productivity. She started her business with the objective of generating income and helping her partner at home. She took advantage of the opportunity that presented itself, also gaining in this way a sense of economic independence.

For five years she has been selling high-quality men's and women's clothing for a living, as well as Reef and Roxy sandals. This is going very well, thanks to her friendly and straightforward manner with her customers. Her family supports her when she has to go out and sell or receive payment for her goods.

Her previous loans have been distinguished by her responsibility and punctuality. She is requesting credit to strengthen her business by purchasing a greater variety of merchandise as well as steel jewellery. Her goal is to better herself and grow, both on a personal level and in her business, thus improving her and her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy women's and men's sandals.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph is a married man living in Bundibugyo, Uganda with his children. His major business is cocoa farming, but he is also a government worker and earns additional income in the form of a monthly salary as a teacher. He is a very hardworking man who loves his work and wants to educate his children, despite the challenge of his delayed salary payment. He used the previous loan to pay school fees. He started farming to earn a living and look after his family. Joseph has requested a loan to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his children

loans.name: Venavil

texts.es:
Venavil, es una persona que se dedica a elaborar y a comercializar piezas de loza, actividad que desarrolla desde hace 15 años, inicio su negocio con poco inventario y pocos clientes, con el paso del tiempo ha mejorado ambos aspectos, ya tiene mucho experiencia en su negocio, tiene un horario de trabajo de ocho de la mañana a cinco de la tarde, el oficio lo aprendió con la ayuda de su madre. Está casada, vive con su esposo, ambos son personas reconocidas por luchar para sobrevivir.
Comprará nacazcol, arcilla, barro crudo y leña, tendrá todo lo necesario para elaborar comales, sartenes, etc., espera producir mayor cantidad de piezas de barro para cubrir las demandas existentes y atraer a nuevos clientes para generar ingresos.
Las aspiraciones de Venail son tener un negocio más grande y tener mejor alimentación, vestuario y salud en su hogar.
texts.en:
Venavil is a person who makes a living by making and selling pottery. She has been in this line of work for 15 years. She started her business with little inventory and few customers. With the passing of time, both aspects have improved. She now has a lot of experience in her business. Her schedule is from 8:00 in the morning to 5:00 in the afternoon. She learned this business with the help of her mother. She is married and lives with her husband. Both of them are people who are known for fighting to survive.

She will buy black dye, clay, crude clay, and firewood. She will then have everything she needs to make hotplates, pans, etc. She hopes to produce a greater quantity of clay pieces to meet the existing demand and to attract new customers to generate income. 

Venavil’s dreams are to have a larger business, and to have better nutrition, wardrobes, and health in her home.

loans.use: to buy black dye, clay, crude clay, and firewood. She will then have everything she needs to make hotplates, pans, etc.

loans.name: Dary's Group

texts.en:
Dary is 42 years old and married with three children, all of whom are in school. To make a living, she has been growing rice and selling snacks in her village. The current business earns her about 77,000 KHR per day to support her family. 

Dary has been with VisionFund for one cycle. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan to buy seeds and fertilizers for her farmland. She hopes to timely grow her rice so as to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers for her farmland

location.town: Kampong Cham Province, Koh Sotin District

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy used energy savers (bulb) for her husband to repair and sell

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
As a married parent of 11 children, Rosalinda works hard to support her family.

She has a fish-vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending. Rosalinda is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase more fish to sell for her fish-vending business.

Rosalinda has been sustaining her business activities through her past eight loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie is 33 years old and has three children. Rosalie is married and one of her children is currently in school.

Rosalie is in the agricultural business, raising chickens in the Philippines. Rosalie requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her chickens.

Rosalie has been raising chickens for 10 years now, and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

Rosalie would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her chickens

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie is 43 years old and married with two children.

Rosemarie works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

Rosemarie has borrowed and paid three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 20 years and also earns an income from fish vending.

Rosemarie aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 49 years old and married with two children.

Teresita works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional groceries to sell in her general store.

Teresita has borrowed and paid five loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 30 years and also earns additional income from fruit vending and fish vending.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Teresita aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is 59 years old and a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Victoria has a fish/dried fish vending business in the Philippines. Victoria requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more fish and dried fish to sell.

Victoria has been in this business for 15 years. In the future, Victoria would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish and dried fish to sell

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en: Joyce is a single mother with two children, living in Bundibugyo, Uganda. She is hardworking, and therefore takes sole responsibility for looking after her children. All of them are in school. She deals in fresh foods, such as selling tomatoes, onions, cabbage, fresh beans, and ground nuts in markets around town. She hopes to expand her business to generate income and build a decent house. Her biggest challenge is the high level of perishability of her products. Joyce is requesting a loan to buy tomatoes, onions and beans to sell.

loans.use: to buy fresh foods like tomatoes, onions, cabbage, and beans to sell

loans.name: Mwanakombo

texts.en:
Mwanakombo is married with one child who is still too young to attend school. They live in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses is food. 

She has operated a khanga (women's wrap cloth) business, selling from home and door-to-door to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of competition in her business.

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase bales of khangas for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of khangas for resale

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is a resident of Kijuma, a rural area in Western Uganda. He is 36 years old and married with eight children. He is a bicycle mechanic and sells bicycle spare parts. He has a petro pump as side income. He is assured of clientele in that rural area though his challenge is limited capital to buy enough fuel to meet his supplies. 

He is taking a loan of UGX 4,000,000 to buy more fuel to sell. This will boost his business and he hopes it will raise enough profits to educate his children. His challenge is that there is still low profit on the sales since his main clients are villagers. He is hardworking and his goal is to expand his business and educate his children well.

loans.use: To buy petroleum to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a sewing machine for her brother's tailoring business

loans.name: Kwekwe

texts.en:
Kwekwe is a married woman who has no children. She lives in a rental house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

For the past one year, she has operated a clothes selling business, selling from door-to-door to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of competition in her business.

With the loan that she is requesting of Kes 20,000, she wants to purchase bales of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale

loans.name: Angelita

texts.en:
Angelita is a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Angelita is 49 years old and has four children who are in school.

Angelita has a food-vending business in the Philippines. Angelita requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food-production business.

Angelita has been in this business for seven years. In the future, Angelita would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food-production business

loans.name: Yervand

texts.en:
Yervand is 67 years old and lives with his wife and his smallest son’s family in Kapan city in the Syunik region. His two elder sons are also married and they live separately with their families. Yervand graduated from Yerevan State Agricultural Institute. Now Yervand is a skilled and clever farmer who for  many years has managed to have great success in bee keeping and honey production. He also has a nice orchard where he has apples, peaches, nuts and apricot trees. His vegetable garden is also rich; he gathers a harvest of potatoes, cabbage, beans, etc. 

He sells all of his land goods at the wholesale market in his city. Yervand sells his farm’s honey both in Kapan city and by sending his friends to Yerevan city to sell it there. Yervand greatly hopes that Kiva lenders will help him with the loan amount with which he wants to buy wax papers, frames, beehives and also a honey-squeezing machine.

loans.use: to buy wax papers, frames, beehives and also a honey-squeezing machine

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
Leonora is a married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Leonora is 36 years old and has two children who are currently in school.

Leonora has a buy-and-sell dried-fish business in the Philippines. Leonora requested a PHP 18,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of dried fish to sell to her customers.

Leonora has been in this business for five years. In the future, Leonora would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of dried fish to sell to her customers

loans.name: Annabelle

texts.en:
Annabelle is a married woman with six children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Annabelle is 45 years old and has three children who are presently in school.

Annabelle has a fishing business in the Philippines. Annabelle requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy materials for her fishing business like fish net, gasoline for her boat, bamboo, etc.

Annabelle has been in this business for 10 years. She would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy materials for her fishing business like fish net, gasoline for her boat, bamboo, etc

loans.name: Guram

texts.en: Guram is 46 years old. He lives in Khelvachauri district with his pensioner parents. Guram has mandarin trees and sells the harvest locally. This is the only source of income for his family. As the income is only seasonal, Guram decided to start working on an additional and stable income. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo enables him to get a loan of 2,500 USD. With the received credit, Guram will purchase a stock of fruits and vegetables from wholesalers and will resell them at a higher price. Guram will use his minibus to transport the fruits and vegetables. He is a very hardworking man and is very motivated to increase his income. Guram hopes that the business will be profitable. He awaits your support.

loans.use: to begin to trade fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Dalgis Del Carmen

texts.es: Dalgis es una microempresaria con diez años de experiencia en el expendio de licores, su suegro le cedió la administración del negocio en vista de su potencial para las ventas, labor que ha logrado con mucho compromiso y dedicación. Todos los días los residentes del municipio de Baranoa pueden llegar hasta su local a partir de 9 a.m. a 10 p.m. para calmar la sed con una cerveza o la bebida de su preferencia o simplemente para tener un momento de esparcimiento y diversión en compañía de amigos o familiares. En la actualidad está aplicando a su primer credikiva por intermedio de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, que invertirá en cajas de aguardiente.  Esta inversión hace más rentable su actividad puesto que al comprar por volúmenes permite obtener mayores ganancias.  Dalgis es madre de un hijo de 10 años, a quien desea continuarle brindando bienestar y una excelente educación, así mismo mejorar su condiciones de vida al adquirir una vivienda.
texts.en:
Dalgis is a small business person with ten years of experience in a liquor store. Her father in law left her in charge of the business because of her potential ability with sales, which she has undertaken with great commitment and dedication. 

Each day the residents of the municipality of Baranoa can come to her shop from 9a.m. until 10p.m. to quench their thirst with a beer or the drink of their choice, or simply to take a moment to relax and be entertained in the company of friends and family.

She is currently applying for her first Kiva loan through the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo which she will invest in boxes of aguardiente [typical Colombian spirits]. 

This investment will make her business more profitable because buying in bulk allows her to have better earnings. 

Dalgis is the mother of a ten year old son. She hopes to continue to offer him well-being and an excellent education, as well as to improve his living conditions by buying a home.

loans.use: to buy boxes of aguardiente.

loans.name: Kerlly Lilibeth

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Balsamaragua se reúne cada 15 días en el cantón Jaramijo, este lugar es conocido por sus hermosas playas, aquí la mayoría de los habitantes son muy trabajadores y dedicados a las faenas del mar.
En este lugar vive la señora Kerlly, tiene 22 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene dos hijos de 6 años  y un bebé de 10  meses de edad, el  mayor estudian en escuela. El marido es albañil.
Doña Kerlly se dedica al comercio, ella vende ropa interior, moños, lazos, entre otras cosas, su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta, sale en horas de la mañana ya que a esta hora es más fresco, actualmente sus ventas han aumentado mucho por la entrada a clases de los pequeños, razón por lo cual necesita del crédito para comprar mayor cantidad de prendas, lleva más de 3 años dedicada a este negocio el cual comenzó con el primer crédito.
Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más mercadería como: ropa, moños, lazos, entre otros productos que vende. Lleva 3 años en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos le permiten salir adelante. Sus sueños son tener un gran local.
texts.en:
The Balsamaragua Credit Group meets every 15 days in the Jaramijo canton. This place is known for its beautiful beaches. Here, the majority of the inhabitants are very hardworking and dedicated to maritime jobs. 

This is where Kerlly lives. She is 22 years old and has a domestic partnership, from which she has two 6-year-old children and a 10-month-old baby. The older ones study. Her husband is a carpenter.

Kerlly makes a living in commerce. She sells undergarments, ribbons, and bows, among other things. She sells door-to-door. She goes out in the morning hours, since it is cooler out then. Recently, her sales have increased a lot due to the start of the school year for the little ones. For this reason, she needs the loan to buy a larger quantity of garments. She has been in this business for more than 3 years, and she started it with her first loan. 

She will use this loan to buy more merchandise such as clothes, ribbons, and bows, among other products that she sells. She has been a part of the credit group for 3 years and she likes it because the loans help her get ahead. Her dream is to have a large shop.

loans.use: to buy clothes, ribbons, bows, etc.

loans.name: Adelaida

texts.en:
Adelaida is 53 years old and married with four children. Adelaida works very hard to provide for them.

Adelaida runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items like soft drinks, canned goods, detergent soap, candies, bread, and beer to sell.

Adelaida has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as soft drinks, canned goods, detergent soap, candies, bread, and beer.

Adelaida would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional items like soft drinks, canned goods, detergent soap, candies, bread, and beer to sell

loans.name: Rovelyn

texts.en:
Rovelyn is 21 years old and single with one child.

She runs an agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Rovelyn is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Rovelyn has been in this business for three years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy-and-sell jewelry business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell to her customers for her buy-and-sell jewelry business.

Imelda has been in this business for 20 years. Imelda earns more income from pig fattening.

Imelda has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell to her customers

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Anna, her husband, and their two children live all together. The family has worked in the agricultural sector for many years. Currently, Anna's husband is involved in selling agricultural harvest in the market.  So Anna is the only one who takes care of the farm and also has a lot of work to do in the household with the children. 

On the farm she cultivates potatoes, carrots, cabbage and beets. Anna has applied for this loan to purchase cabbage seeds and fertilizer and to hire workers for cultivation.

Because the region where their village is located is considered poor, and the unemployment rate here is very high, people face numerous difficulties in developing their businesses. Anna's loan has been approved within the joint initiative between SEF and Kiva, which provides loans to the underserved population of the Shirak region, to help them to access the market and earn a living.

Anna hopes to receive lenders' support and invest these funds in her agribusiness. She has plans to develop her farm and make it profitable so that her family has better living conditions.

loans.use: to pay for cabbage seeds and fertilizer and to hire workers for cultivation

loans.name: Marie

texts.en:
Marie is 50 years old and married with three children, one of whom is still in school. Marie works very hard to provide for them.

Marie runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,500 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, and drinks.

Marie has been in this business for nine years. 

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, and drinks

loans.name: Begaim

texts.ru: Бегаим, 48 лет, замужем, есть сын и дочь. Бегаим в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи занимается животноводством и полеводством, стартовав в 1995 году. Благодаря упорному труду Бегаим, на сегодняшний день у нее есть 3 коровы. На 2,0 Га земли выращивает экологичные пшеницу и рис. Ежемесячный доход составляет в среднем 4,500 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, она обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 20,000 сом (KGS) на обработку почвы и выращивание риса. Доходы от кредита Бегаим планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие своего бизнеса.
texts.en:
Begaim is 48 years old, married, and has a son and daughter. As the primary source of income for her family, Begaim raises animals and grows crops, which she has been doing since 1995. Thanks to Begaim's hard work, she now has 3 cows, and she raises organic wheat and rice on 2.0 hectares of land. Begaim's monthly income averages 4,500 som (KGS). 

In order to further expand her business, she has applied to Bai Tushum Bank CJSC for a loan of 20,000 som (KGS) to cultivate her land and grow rice. Begaim plans to use the proceeds from her loan to further expand her business.

loans.use: to cultivate her land to grow organic rice.

loans.name: Roxana Cecibel

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Balsamaragua se reúne cada 15 días en el cantón Jaramijo, este lugar es conocido por sus hermosas playas, aquí la mayoría de los habitantes son muy trabajadores y dedicados a las faenas del mar.
En este lugar vive la señora Roxana, tiene 25 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre y de esta relación tienen una hija de 7 años de edad la cual  estudia en escuela. Su esposo se dedica a la pesca.
Doña Roxana tiene una tienda de víveres en su casa, allí vende productos de primera necesidad, granos, detergentes, colas embutidos entre otros, son dos años que lleva con este negocio el cual cada vez que recibe un crédito lo va mejorando con mayor cantidad de productos ya que así gana más clientela, trabaja todos los días desde las 6h00 hasta las 20h00, le ayuda su marido cuando el no está en sus faenas de pesca.
Este crédito lo va a emplear en surtir más su tienda con . Lleva 4 años en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por los servicios que ofrece la institución. Sus sueños son mejorar su tienda y tener mayor variedad de productos.
texts.en:
The Balsamaragua communal bank meets every 15 days in the Jaramilo canton.  This place is known for its beautiful beaches.  Most of the inhabitants here are very hard-working and devote themselves to work having to do with the sea.

Roxana, age 25, lives in this place.  She is in a common-law-marriage, and they have a seven year old daughter, who goes to school.  Her husband is a fisherman.

Roxana has a grocery store at her house.  She sells basic needs products, grains, detergents, colas, cold cuts, and other products here.  She has been in this business for two years.

Each time she gets a loan, she is improving with a greater quantity of products because that is how she gains more customers.  She works every day from 6:00 a.m. until 8:00 p.m.  Her husband helps her when he is not doing his fishing work.

She will use this loan to stock her store with more basic needs items.  

She has been in her communal bank for four years.  She likes it for the services that the institution offers.  Her dream is to improve her store and to have a greater variety of products.

loans.use: to buy basic needs products.

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
Letecia is 45 years old and married with four children, one of whom is currently in school, Letecia works very hard to provide for them.

Letecia runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drinks, juice, and bread.

Letecia has been in this business for seven years. 

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drinks, juice, and bread

loans.name: Rovelyn

texts.en:
Rovelyn is a 25-year-old married woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Rovelyn has a buy-and-sell recycled materials business in the Philippines. Rovelyn requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional sacks of recycled materials to sell.

Rovelyn has been in this business for four years. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of recycled materials to sell

loans.name: Julie

texts.en:
Julie works hard to support her family. Julie is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Julie requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

Julie has been in this business for two years now.

In the future, Julie would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Tamara

texts.en:
Tamara is from the Horom village of the Shirak region. She lives with her husband and two children, a 13- year-old daughter and 10-year-old son. Her children attend a local school, and her husband works in a hospital, so Tamara is the only one who takes care of their family farm. She keeps their two piglets and some hens, and also cultivates wheat, barley and potatoes. 

To be able to enlarge her farm and get more income for her family, she would like to increase it. Tamara plans to purchase a cow, four pigs, and seeds for land cultivation (barley). 

Because the region where their village is located is considered poor, and the unemployment rate here is very high, people face numerous difficulties in developing their businesses. Tamara's loan has been approved within the joint initiative between SEF and Kiva, which provides loans to the underserved population of the Shirak region, to help them to access the market and earn a living. Please help this hardworking woman to invest funds in her farm and develop it.

loans.use: to pay for a cow, four pigs, and seeds for land cultivation (barley)

loans.name: Flordeliza

texts.en:
Flordeliza is 22 years old and a resident in the town of Talibon, Bohol. She operates a tricycle-transport (motorcycle with side car) service. She is a married woman with two young dependents.  She has been operating a tricycle-transportation service for three years now. 

She is asking for a loan to purchase a side car (a small, low vehicle attached to the side of a motorcycle for carrying passengers). With this, she could provide her passengers with comfort and safety during travel. This will enable her to augment her income and settle her obligations. 

Flordeliza is grateful for receiving the funds to support her livelihood and to be able to support the needs of her growing children.

loans.use: to purchase a side car

loans.name: Jissela Vanesa

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Balsamaragua se reúne cada 15 días en el cantón Jaramijo, este lugar es conocido por sus hermosas playas, aquí la mayoría de los habitantes son muy trabajadores y dedicados a las faenas del mar.
En este lugar vive la señora Jissela, tiene 22 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre y de esta relación tienen una hija de 2 años de edad. Su esposo trabaja en construcción de embarcaciones y también realiza transporte en una mototaxi.
Doña Jissela con la finalidad de contar con sus propios ingresos y así ayudar a su marido con los gastos se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, trabaja dos días más que todo en las horas de la mañana o en las noches ya que a esas horas le resulta más fácil realizar sus recorridos, también vende en su casa si sus clientes así lo quieren, ella les da facilidades de pago a sus clientes para vender mucho mas, lleva 2 años con esta actividad la cual empezó con uno de los créditos que recibió del grupo por lo cual está muy agradecida. 
Este crédito lo va a emplear en  que es lo que más se vende actualmente. Lleva 2 años en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque con los créditos ella empezó su negocio. Sus sueños es darles lo mejor a su familia.
texts.en:
The Balsamaragua communal bank meets every 15 days in the Jaramilo canton.  This place is known for its beautiful beaches.  Most of the inhabitants here are very hard-working and devote themselves to work having to do with the sea.

This is where Jissela, age 22, lives.  She is in a common-law marriage, and they have a two year old daughter.  Her husband works building boats, and he also provides transportation in his ‘mototaxi’ [three wheeled motorized vehicle].

In order to have her own earnings to use to help her husband with the expenses, Jissela sells all types of clothes.  She works two days, mostly in the mornings or in the evenings because these hours are easier for her to make her rounds.  She also sells at her house to those customers who want to purchase there.  She gives her customers payment plans in order to sell a lot more.  She has been engaged in this business activity for two years.  She started with one of the loans that she got from the group, for which she is very grateful.

She will use the loan for what she currently sells the most.  She has been in her communal bank for two years, and she likes it because she started her business with the loans. 

Her dream is to give the best to her family.

loans.use: to buy pants, shirts, and children's underwear.

loans.name: Ma. Elaine

texts.en:
Ma. Elaine is 27 years old, married, and has one child.

Ma. Elaine is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Ma. Elaine requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds, vaccines, vitamins and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Ma. Elaine has been in this business for three years now, and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vaccines, vitamins and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel is a 32-year-old single parent with one child.

Maricel is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Maricel requested a PHP 9,500 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Maricel has been in this business for six years now, and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Zamirna Luz

texts.es: Zamirna es una emprendedora mujer de 40 años de edad que diariamente ofrece una excelente asesoría a sus clientes en su negocio de venta de monturas oftálmicas y lentes formulados,  ella oferta una gran variedad de soluciones oftalmológicas dirigidas a cada segmento de la población residente en el municipio de Soledad, ofreciendo garantía y respaldo en su inversión para la salud visual. Su negocio inició con la venta de prendas de vestir y calzado, aún ejerce esta actividad, sin embargo le pareció una buena propuesta comprar unas vitrinas para exhibir monturas y ofrecer exámenes visuales, servicio de lentes medicados y  reparación de gafas averiadas.  En la actualidad tiene nueve años de experiencia y espera invertir en la compra de nuevo surtido de monturas, lentes y ropa en general, para ello realizo una solicitud para aplicar a su primer credikiva por intermedio de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo e incrementar sus inventarios.  Ella es madre de cuatro hijos a quienes ofrece bienestar y desea continuarles apoyando hasta que sean unos profesionales.  Su meta de negocio a largo plazo es tener una sucursal.
texts.en:
Zamirna is an entrepreneurial 40-year-old woman who, on a daily basis, offers an excellent service in her business where she sells ophthalmic frames and prescription lenses. She offers a large variety of ophthalmic solutions aimed at each segment of the population that lives in the Soledad municipality. This provides a guarantee and support for her investment in visual health. Her business started with clothing and shoe sales. She still does this. However, it seemed like a good idea to buy some cabinets to display frames and to offer vision exams, prescription lenses, and repairs for broken glasses.

Currently, she has nine years of experience and she hopes to invest in buying a new supply of frames, lenses, and clothing in general. For this, she completed an application to apply for her first Kiva loan through the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation. This will help her increase her inventory. She is the mother of four children, who she offers wellbeing, and she wants to continue supporting them until they become professionals. Her long-term business goal is to open another location.

loans.use: to buy a new supply of frames, lenses, and clothing in general.

loans.name: Ma. Juvy

texts.en: Ma. Juvy works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fruit-vending business in the Philippines. Ma. Juvy requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy more fruit to sell. She has been in this business for three years now.  Ma. Juvy would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more fruit to sell

loans.name: Ma. Fe

texts.en:
Ma. Fe is a 52-year-old married woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Ma. Fe has a buy-and-sell personal care products business in the Philippines. Ma. Fe requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional products like perfume, soap, shampoo, and body lotion.

Ma. Fe has been in this business for 20 years. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional products like perfume, soap, shampoo, and body lotion

loans.name: Marestela

texts.en:
Marestela is 31 years old and earns a living by having a pig-fattening business in the Philippines. Marestela is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Marestela has been in pig fattening for six years and also earns additional income from selling ready to wear.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Jetridah

texts.en:
Jetridah is a mother of two children, living in Bundibugyo, Uganda. She wants to see all of her children go to school and this makes her work hard at her fresh food stall for eight hours a day. She has realized that the business is improving her family's standard of living, and she dreams of expanding it and selling to big markets, though unpredictable weather changes and transport costs limit her plans. Jetridah is asking for a loan to buy tomatoes to sell.

The photo was taken from the market, making it hard to exclude other people who were in the market.

loans.use: to buy tomatoes to sell.

loans.name: Liberty

texts.en:
Liberty is a 53-year-old widowed woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Liberty has a candy-making business in the Philippines. Liberty requested a PHP 9,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food-production business.

Liberty has been in this business for 32 years. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food-production business

loans.name: Hyna

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Hyna works hard to support her family.

She has a fish-vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending. Hyna is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy more fish to sell.

Hyna has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell

loans.name: Donasco

texts.en:
Donasco is 46 years old and married with six children, four of whom are still in school. Donasco works very hard to provide for them.

Donasco runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, eggs, drinks, juices, and spices.

Donasco has been in this business for 26 years. 

She would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, eggs, drinks, juices, and spices

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is 43 years old and has six children. Irene is married and has two children who are still in school.

Irene is in the agricultural business, farming bananas in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Irene has been in this business for 10 years now, and has borrowed 8 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan works hard to support her family. Susan is married with four children and has a buy-and-sell ready-to-wear business in the Philippines.

Susan requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to buy stocks of ready to wear to sell like pants, shorts, slippers, shoes, dresses, and bags.

Susan has been in this business for 20 years now.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy stocks of ready to wear to sell like pants, shorts, slippers, shoes, dresses, and bags

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna is a married woman with five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Edna is 54 years old and has one child still in school.

Edna has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Edna requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy more fish to sell to her customers.

Edna has been in this business for 10 years. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell to her customers

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy is 52 years old and married with three children.

She earns a living by having a pig-fattening business in the Philippines. Mercy is borrowing PHP 16,000 through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Mercy has been in pig fattening for three years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Zara

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Zara works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store.  Zara is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF to  buy additional materials for her business like fish net, bamboo, gasoline for her boat and other materials.

Zara has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional materials for her business like fish net, bamboo, gasoline for her boat and other materials

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
Zenaida is 56 years old and has four children. Zenaida is married and has one child who is still in school.

Zenaida is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Zenaida requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Zenaida has been in pig fattening for 28 years now, and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Zenaida would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Epifania

texts.en: Epifania works hard to support her family. Epifania is single and has a buy-and-sell breads business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional bread to sell to her customers. Epifania has been in this business for one year now, and also earns additional income from buy-and-sell vegetables. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional bread to sell to her customers

loans.name: Lyn

texts.en:
Lyn is 44 years old and married with four children.

Lyn works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks of groceries to sell.

Lyn has borrowed and paid two loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 12 years and also earns an income from rice retailing.

Lyn aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of groceries to sell

loans.name: Fanny Lucia

texts.es: Lucia tiene 51 años de edad, ella tiene 6 hijos de los cuales 3 viven con ella, sus 2 hijos menores están estudiando y la de 19 años estuvo inscrita a la universidad pero por motivo de que Lucia estuvo enferma ya no tuvieron el dinero suficiente para que la joven se vaya a la universidad, Lucia vive en el campo y comenta que sus ingresos los obtiene de la crianza de animales menores, Lucia va a invertir el crédito en la compra de una vaca para incrementar su negocio al que se dedica 16 años, su aspiración es lograr que su hija entre a la universidad y saque su título profesional  y sigue luchando por el bienestar de familia.
texts.en: Lucia is 51 years old. She has six children and three of them live with her. Her two youngest go to school and her 19-year-old daughter was enrolled in college. Because Lucia was sick, she no longer had enough money to pay for her daughter to go to college. Lucia lives in the countryside and says that she obtains her income from raising small animals. Lucia is going to use this loan to buy a cow in order to increase her business, which she has had for 16 years. Her aspirations are to make sure that her daughter goes to college and gets her degree and to keep striving for the well-being of her family.

loans.use: to buy a cow.

loans.name: Het's Group

texts.en:
Het is 35 years old and married. She lives with her family in a rural area located in the Tbaung Khmum district of Kampong Cham province. She has two dependent children to take care of and right now they are too young for school. Rice farming and cassava growing are the primary sources of her family’s income and she has been in this business for 17 years. With the current business, she can earn approximately 40,000 KHR per day and save about 20,000 KHR each day for future needs. 

This is the fifth micro loan for Het with VisionFund. Now leading her group to apply for a loan, Het will use her portion to buy rice seeds for her cassava. She hopes to increase her current business so as to earn a larger income to make a better living and keep her children in school.

loans.use: to buy rice seeds for her cassava

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Gloria Amparo

texts.es: Gloria esta casada, su esposo trabaja al jornal y a sembrar  pequeños huertos de papas y mas productos que se dan en la tierra en la que reside, Gloria tiene  4 hijos , Gloia vive con 2 hijos y una nieta,los hijos de Gloria ya son independientes ya que trabajan al jornal. Gloria se dedica  desde hace unos 20 años atrás a su negocio que es una tienda, también comenta que se dedica a la venta de comidas rapidas. Gloria solicita el dinero del credito para comprar mercadería en productos de tienda en general.  Gloria desea seguir mejorando su negocio ponerlo mas lleno para variar sus productos, mejorar sus ventas y de esta manera seguir apoyando a sus hijos y su nieta.
texts.en:
Gloria is married. Her husband works as a day laborer and plants small plots of potatoes and other products that grow well in the area where he lives. Gloria has 4 children and lives with 2 of them and a granddaughter. Gloria’s children are all economically independent and work as day laborers. 

Gloria has been working for 20 years in her business, which is a store. She explains that she also sells fast foods. Gloria is requesting a loan to buy merchandise and products for her store. Gloria wishes to continue improving her business and have more stock to vary her products, improve her sales, and thereby continue helping out her children and granddaughter.

loans.use: to buy products for her store.

loans.name: Lucille

texts.en:
Lucille is 55 years old, widowed, and has two children.

Lucille is in the agricultural business, raising cattle in the Philippines. Lucille requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds, vaccines, vitamins and other supplies to raise her cattle.

Lucille has been in this business for 30 years now, and has borrowed eight times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vaccines, vitamins and other supplies to raise her cattle

loans.name: Ximena Alexan

texts.es: Ximena esta en su corta edad de 21 años, Ximena se dedica a sembrar a medias con su padre que también se dedica a la agricultura y al jornal de trabajos del campo. Ximena solicita el dinero del crédito para invertirlo en la compra de abono y fungicidas para mantener sus cultivos en buen estado. Ximena vive con su madre y con 3 hermanos, Ximena también se dedica a atrabajar en un centro de computo. Ximena tiene la aspiración de seguir en su negocio y progresar para a futuro no tener demasiadas necesidades.
texts.en: Ximena is 21 years old. She works as a farmer with her father, who also works as an agricultural day laborer. Ximena is requesting a loan to buy manure and fungicides to maintain her crop in good health. Ximena lives with her mother and with 3 brothers. She also works at a computer business. Ximena hopes to continue with her business and work so that in the future there won’t be many unmet necessities.

loans.use: to buy manure and fungicides.

loans.name: Sebastiana

texts.en:
Sebastiana is 53 years old and married with eight children.

Sebastiana works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell in her general store.

Sebastiana has borrowed and paid eight loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for three years and also earns an income from pig fattening.

Sebastiana aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Luz Madi

texts.es: Muchos son los clientes que salen engalanados y felices del salón de belleza de Luz Madi una joven de 22 años, que ofrece sus servicios desde su local ubicado en un barrio del municipio de Barranquilla, los residentes del sector que deseen cortar su cabello, cepillarlo o realizar algún tratamiento capilar pueden acceder todos los días a partir de las 8 a.m. hasta las 9 p.m.  Esta carismática mujer decidió ejercer esta profesión porque desde niña fue su sueño, hoy en día tiene tres años de estar funcionando con excelentes resultados.  En la actualidad está aplicando a su primer credikiva por intermedio de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, que invertirá  en la compra de productos necesarios para la prestación de sus servicios; shampoo, masajes, tintes y demás.  Esta inversión le permite tener mejores resultados y ganancias adicionales puesto que les ofrecerá productos capilares a  sus clientes.  Su meta a largo plazo es comprar una casa y tener su local propio.
texts.en:
Many are the customers who leave Luz Madi's beauty salon feeling happy and more attractive. This young 22-year-old woman offers her services from a shop in a neighbourhood in the city of Barranquilla. People living here who want a hair cut, styling or other hair-care treatment can come to her between 8 a.m. and 9 p.m. This charismatic woman decided to go into this profession because it had been her dream ever since she was a girl. She has now been doing this work for three years, and the results have been excellent.

Luz Madi is now asking for her first Kiva loan through the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. She will invest the loan into buying necessary products for the services she provides - this includes items such as shampoo, massage oil and hair dye. The investment will allow her to improve her results and make more profit, because she will be able to offer hair-care products to her customers. Her long-term goal is to buy a house and have her own shop.

loans.use: to buy products such as shampoo, massage oil and hair dye, which are necessary for the services she provides.

loans.name: Fredy Arley

texts.es: Fredy  es un joven trabajador de 22 años de edad, él se dedica desde que tenía 13 años a trabajar  al jornal de trabajos de agricultura y de ahí es que aprendió a manejar los cultivos. Fredy  es un joven que se traslado de Colombia  hacia Ecuador en busca de fuentes de empleo y comenta que si encontró trabajo de jornalero. Fredy comenta que le esta yendo bien en la agricultura y que el dinero del crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de semilla para sembrar un pequeño cultivo de papas, Fredy  tiene la aspiración de que le siga yendo muy bien en sus cultivos y lograr convertirse en un gran agricultor y que asi haya mas trabajo para las personas jornaleras y ayudarse entre todos.
texts.en: Fredy is a 22 year-old, hardworking young man. Since the age of 13 years old, he has been working as an agricultural day laborer and that’s where he learned to manage crops. Freddy is a young man who moved from Colombia to Ecuador seeking work and he explains that he found it as a day laborer. Fredy explains that things are going well for him in agriculture and that he will use the money from the loan to buy seed for a small plot of potatoes. He has the hope that things will continue going well for him with his crops and that he will become a big farmer, so that there will be more work for laborers and they can all help one another.

loans.use: to buy seed potatoes.

loans.name: Martha Marisol

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Madres Emprendedoras se reúne cada 15 días en el barrio Córdova en  la ciudad de Manta,  ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año, por su gastronomía y por ser una ciudad con muchos atractivos turísticos.
En este lugar vive la señora Martha, tiene 50 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos, dos mayores de edad y uno de 17 años el cual estudia en colegio y aún viven en su casa. Su esposo es comerciante.
Doñas Martha es una mujer que le ha gustado trabajar para ayudarle a su marido con los gastos del hogar y la educación de sus hijos, ella tiene una tienda de víveres en su casa, allí vende todo tipo de productos como granos, detergentes, carnes, legumbres, entre productos de primera necesidad, trabaja todos los días y su hijo le ayuda cuando él puede pero es ella la que siempre está en su local, tiene más de 10 años con el negocio el cual le permite ganar lo propio y así mejorar su calidad de vida.
Este crédito lo va a invertir en comprar víveres para surtir su tienda. Lleva 2 años  en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos son rápidos y de mucha ayuda. Sus sueños son darles lo mejor a su familia.
texts.en:
The “Entrepreneurial Mothers” loan group meets every 15 days in the Córdova neighborhood in the city of Manta. The city is known for its beautiful beaches, which receive many visitors all year long. It’s also known for its wonderful food and for being a city with many tourist attractions.

This is where Martha lives. She is married and from that relationship has three children, two of whom are grown and one who is 17 years old and who in high school and still lives with her. Her husband is a merchant. 

Martha has always liked to work in order to help her husband with the household expenses and their children’s education. She has a small grocery store in her home. There she sells all sorts of products, such as grains, detergents, meats, vegetables, and other items of daily need. She works every day and her son helps her when he can, but she is always in her store. She has had this business for more than 10 years. It allows her to earn her own money and improve her quality of life. 

She will use this loan to buy stock for her store. She has been in the loan group for 2 years and she likes it because the loans are quick and very helpful. Her dream is to give the best to her family.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Jose Cristobal

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Balsamaragua se reúne cada 15 días en el cantón Jaramijo, este lugar es conocido por sus hermosas playas, aquí la mayoría de los habitantes son muy trabajadores y dedicados a las faenas del mar.
En este lugar vive don José, tiene 52 años de edad, es casado y de esta relación tienen cinco hijos de 20, 18, 16, 13  y 1  año de edad, dos de ellos estudian en colegio y todos viven en su casa aun. Su esposa trabaja en una fábrica de la localidad.
El señor José es un hombre muy trabajador que realiza cualquier actividad para sacar adelante a su familia de una forma honrada, el junto a sus hijos mayores se dedican a la pesca en una pequeña embarcación de remos, ellos salen todos los días en la mañana y regresan con el producto del mar el mismo que luego entregan a comerciantes que llegan hasta el lugar a comprar a pescadores como él, son más de 20 años que lleva en esta actividad la cual le ha permitido salir adelante.
Este crédito es para comprar redes piolas, anzuelos, carnadas y otros materiales de pesca. Lleva 4 ciclos en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos son de mucha ayuda. Sus sueños son tener una lancha con motor para realizar mejor su actividad.
texts.en:
The 'Balsamaragua' communal bank meets every 15 days in the Jaramijo canton. This place is known for its beautiful beaches. The majority of the residents here are very hardworking and work in jobs related to the sea.

José, 52, lives in this area. He is married and has five children from this relationship who are ages 20, 18, 16, 13, and 1. Two of them go to school and all of them still live at home. His wife works at a local factory.

José is a very hardworking individual who does any job in order to support his family in an honest way. He and his older children work in fishing and have a small rowboat. They go out every day in the morning and return with fish which they then deliver to merchants who come to the area to buy from fishermen like him. It's been more than 20 years since he's been doing this activity and it has enabled him to get ahead.

José is requesting this loan to buy string nets, hooks, bait, and other fishing equipment. José has been a member of his communal bank for 4 loan cycles and he likes it because the loans help him a lot. His dream is to have a motorboat in order to do his job better.

loans.use: to buy string nets, hooks, bait, and other fishing equipment.

loans.name: Manuel Lisardo

texts.es: A sus 48 años de edad Manuel tiene 5 hijos, de 11,13, 17, 18 y 21 años de edad. Manuel se dedica  a trabajar al jornal de actividades de agricultura y hace 6 meses emprendió con su negocio de sembrar papas y otros productos. Manuel solicita el dinero del crédito para invertirlo en la compra de fungicidas para tener sus cultivos sanos, Manuel  espera que le vaya bien para asi obtener los ingresos  para darles bienestar a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Manuel is 48 years old and has five children, ages 11, 13, 17, 18, and 21.

He works in agriculture as a day laborer, and six months ago he started a business cultivating potatoes and other produce. He is applying for this loan to buy fungicides in order to maintain the health of his crops. 

Manuel hopes to do well so that he can earn the income needed for the wellbeing of his chidren.

loans.use: to buy fungicides.

loans.name: Alexandra Elizabeth

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Balsamaragua se reúne cada 15 días en el cantón Jaramijo, este lugar es conocido por sus hermosas playas, aquí la mayoría de los habitantes son muy trabajadores y dedicados a las faenas del mar.
