En este lugar vive la señora Alexandra, tiene 32 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene tres hijos de 14, 9 y 5 años de edad, todos estudian en colegio y escuela. Su esposo se dedica a la pesca.
Doña Alexandra es una mujer que le gusta ganarse lo suyo y con esto contribuir con los gastos que demandan la educación de sus hijos y los del hogar, ella  vende ropa de todo tipo y  productos de Avon (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Su forma de venta es puerta a puerta y también vende en su casa cuando sus clientes quieren algo,  ella sale a recorrer en las mañanas mientras sus hijos estudian, deja sus productos a  crédito y cobra cada ocho o quince días. Lleva más de 4 años que se dedica a esta actividad con la cual se gana lo suyo para el bien de su familia.
Este crédito es para comprar ropa, perfumes, cremas, cosméticos y todo lo que ella vende. Lleva más de 12 años en  el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque gracias a los créditos ella empezó su negocio. Sus sueños son darles la mejor educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
The Balsamaragua credit group meets every 15 days in the village of Jaramijo, which is known for its beautiful beaches. Here, the majority of residents are hardworking and make a living fishing. 

Mrs. Alexandra lives here. She is 32 years old, married and from this relationship has three children who are 14, nine and five years old. They are all studying in middle and elementary school. Her husband is a fisherman.  

Mrs. Alexandra is a woman who likes to earn her own living and contribute to the household expenses and those required for her children’s education. She sells all types of clothing and Avon beauty products including cosmetics, perfumes and women’s accessories.   

She sells door to door as well as at her house when her customers want something. She goes out to make rounds in the morning while her children are in school. She allows her customers to pay by credit and charges them every eight or 15 days. She has more than four years of experience making a living with this business, which she does for the wellbeing of her family.  

This loan is in order to buy clothing, perfumes, creams, cosmetics and other items that she sells. The credit group has existed for more than 12 years, and she likes it because thanks to the loans she started her business. Her dream is to be able to give her children a better education.

loans.use: to buy clothing, perfumes, creams, cosmetics, etc.

loans.name: Mercedes Argentina

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Madres Emprendedoras se reúne cada 15 días en el barrio Córdova en  la ciudad de Manta,  ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año, por su gastronomía y por ser una ciudad con muchos atractivos turísticos.
En este lugar vive la señora Mercedes, tiene 65 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen cuatro hijos mayores de edad, dos de ellos aun viven en su casa pero de forma independiente. Su esposo es jubilado.
Doña Mercedes es una mujer que le gusta trabajar para ganarse lo suyo y con sus ingresos salir adelante y más ahora que su marido está jubilado, ella tiene un bazar en su casa, allí ella vende ropa de todo tipo, zapatos, productos de bazar, bisutería además de productos Oriflames, Lebel, Avon (artículos de belleza, cosméticos perfumería y accesorios para damas), trabaja todos los días desde las 08h00  hasta las 18h00, en ocasiones le acompaña su marido. Tiene más de 30 años su negocio el cual lo mejora cada vez más  con los créditos.
Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más mercadería como ropa, zapatos, bisutería perfumes entre otras cosas que vende. Está en el Grupo De Crédito desde hace más de 8 años  y le gusta porque con los créditos ella ha podido salir adelante.  Sus sueños son seguir en su negocio y tener salud.
texts.en:
The “Entrepreneurial Mothers” loan group meets every 15 days in the Córdova neighborhood in the city of Manta. The city is known for its beautiful beaches, which receive many visitors all year long. It’s also known for its wonderful food and for being a city with many tourist attractions.

This is where Mercedes lives. She is 65 years old. She is married and from this relationship she has four grown children. Two of them still live with her, but they are economically independent. Her husband is retired.

Mercedes is a woman who likes to work in order to earn her own money and use her funds to get ahead, especially now that her husband is retired. She has a variety store in her home. There she sells clothing of all kinds, shoes, and variety store types of products, like costume jewelry and products from Oriflames, Lebel, and Avon (beauty items, cosmetics, perfumes, and women’s accessories). She works every day from 8:00am until 6:00pm. Sometimes her husband helps her out. She has been in this business for more than 30 years and it gets better with each loan.

She will use this loan to buy more merchandise, like clothing, shoes, costume jewelry, and perfumes, among other things that she sells. She has been in the loan group for more than 8 years and she likes it because the loans have helped her make progress. Her dreams are to continue with her business and to be healthy.

loans.use: to buy clothing, shoes, costume jewelry, and perfumes, etc.

loans.name: María De Jesús

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Madres Emprendedoras se reúne cada 15 días en el barrio Córdova en  la ciudad de Manta,  ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año, por su gastronomía y por ser una ciudad con muchos atractivos turísticos.
En este lugar vive la señora María, tiene 54 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen dos  hijos mayores de edad e independientes. Su esposo es chofer.
Doña María es una mujer que le gusta ganarse lo suyo y salir adelante junto a su querido esposo, ella se dedica al comercio,  vende ropa, productos Yanbal, Avon (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas), también vende productos naturales, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, deja a créditos y cobra cada ocho o quince días. Lleva más de 15 años con este negocio el cual le permite salir adelante.
Este crédito es para comprar productos naturales,  ropa, perfumes y todo de lo que ella vende. Lleva 7 años en  el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos son de mucha ayuda. Sus sueños son seguir aumentando sus ventas.
texts.en:
The Madres Emprendedoras (Enterprising Mothers) loan group meets every other week in the neighborhood of Córdova, in the city of Manta. The city is known for its beautiful beaches that are very popular all year long for the gastronomy and many tourist attractions. 
María lives in this city. She is 54 years old, married and has two older children who live on their own. Her husband is a chauffeur. María likes to make her own living and get ahead alongside her beloved husband. She works in business, selling clothing, Yanbal and Avon products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfume and women's accessories) and also natural products. Her sales form is door-to-door. She makes credit sales and collects payments every eight or fifteen days. She has been in this business for more than 15 years, which allows her to get ahead. 
This loan is to buy natural products, clothing, perfume and everything that she sells. She has been in the loan group for 7 years and she likes it because the loans are a big help. Her dreams are to continue to increase her sales.

loans.use: to buy natural products, clothing, perfume, etc.

loans.name: Jenny Esther

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Madres Emprendedoras se reúne cada 15 días en el barrio Córdova en  la ciudad de Manta,  ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año, por su gastronomía y por ser una ciudad con muchos atractivos turísticos.
En este lugar vive la señora Jenny, tiene 52 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen cinco  hijos mayores de edad, dos de ellos  aún viven en su casa. Su esposo es chofer.
Doña Jenny se dedica a la venta de ropa, zapatos y productos Avon (artículos de belleza, cosméticos perfumería y accesorios para damas), su forma de venta es puerta a puerta en los ratos que esta mas desocupada, deja a crédito y cobra por semanas lo cual le ayuda ya que cuando cobra ella logra realizar nuevas ventas, lleva más de 10 años en su negocio el cual le permite ganar algo por ella misma y así sentirse independiente. 
Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar ropa de todo tipo, zapatos perfumes, cremas y bisuterías. Lleva 4 años  en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque la institución les brinda muy buenos  servicios. Sus sueños son seguir mejorando su vida.
texts.en:
The Madres Emprendedoras (Enterprising Mothers) loan group gets together every fortnight in the neighborhood of Córdova, in the city of Manta. The city is known for its beautiful beaches that are very popular all year long because of the gastronomy and the many tourist attractions. 
Jenny lives in this city. She is 52 years old, married and has five older children. Two of them still live in her house. Her husband is a chauffeur. Jenny makes a living selling clothing, shoes, and Avon products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes and women's accessories). Her sales form is door-to-door when she has the time. Her customers pay with credit and she collects the payments weekly which helps her because when she collects the payments, she makes new sales. She has been in this business for more than 10 years, which allows her to earn something for herself and feel independent.
This loan is going to be used to buy clothing of all types, shoes, perfume, lotions and imitation jewelry. She has been in the loan group for 4 years and she likes it because the institution gives them good services. Her dreams are to continue improving her life.

loans.use: to buy clothing, shoes, perfume, lotions and imitation jewelry.

loans.name: María Teresa

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Madres Emprendedoras se reúne cada 15 días en el barrio Córdova en  la ciudad de Manta,  ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año, por su gastronomía y por ser una ciudad con muchos atractivos turísticos.
En este lugar vive la señora María, tiene 64 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen cinco  hijos mayores de edad e independientes. Su esposo es jubilado.
Doña María desde hace mas de 18 años atrás adecuó un local en su casa el  cual instalo un bazar, allí ella vende ropa de todo tipo, zapatos, cosas para regalos, arreglos florales, perfumes, bisutería, entre otra gran variedad de productos, trabaja todos los días desde las 08h00  hasta las 20h00. Este negocio le encanta ya que además de ganarse la vida se entretiene.
Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más mercadería como ropa, zapatos, bisutería perfumes entre otras cosas que vende. Está desde el inicio en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos son muy necesarios para ella.  Sus sueños tener salud para ella y los suyos.
texts.en: The credit group Entreprising Mothers meets every two weeks in the Cordova neighborhood of the city of Manta, a city known for its beautiful beaches that are popular year round, for its food and for being a city with many tourist attractions. Señora Maria lives in this city; she is 64 years old, is married and has five grown and independent children from this relationship. Her husband has retired. More than 18 years ago, doña Maria fixed up an area in her house in which she opened shop where she sells clothing of all kinds, shoes, gift items, floral arrangements, perfumes, costume jewelry, among other items. She works every day from 8 am to 10 pm. She loves this business because in addition to earning a living, she enjoys herself. She will use this loan to buy more merchandise, such as clothing, shoes, and costume jewelry along with other things that she sells. She has been with this credit group since its beginning and she likes it because loans are very necessary. Her hopes are to have good health for herself and her loved ones.

loans.use: to buy clothing, shoes, costume jewelry, perfumes and similar items.

loans.name: Irina

texts.en: Irina is from the village of Shahumyan in the Lori region.  She is a pedagogue in higher education and already has many years of work experience in this field. At the school she works as a teacher of physics. She is a respected and beloved teacher, who likes her profession and does any work connected with it seriously and with responsibility.  Irina also gives paid private courses of physics at her house to a group of pupils who are going to take entrance exams. In order to gain awareness of all the innovations in teaching methodologies, Irina asks for a loan of 250,000 Armenian drams (AMD) to buy a computer, which for her will be a source of information that she needs now. Irina is married and she has two school-aged sons.

loans.use: to buy a computer, which for her will be a source of information that she needs now

loans.name: Mayra María

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Jaime Roldos se reúne cada 15 días en el cantón Jaramijo este lugar es conocido por sus hermosas playas, la mayoría de los habitantes son muy trabajadores y dedicados a las faenas del mar.
En este lugar vive la señora Mayra, tiene 25 años de edad, está casada  y de esta relación tienen dos hijos de 7 y 3 años de edad, el mayor  estudia en escuela. Su marido  se dedica a la pesca. Ella estudia enfermería en la universidad en Manta.
Doña Mayra  se dedica a la venta de zapatos por catálogos, ella también tiene un local en su  casa en la cual todas las noches prepara pollos asados, los mismos que acompaña con patacones y arroz con menestra lo cual es de mucho agrado de sus clientes que a diario llegan a su local, una tía le ayuda en este negocio en los días que  a ella le toca estudiar. En cuanto a las ventas de zapatos los realiza en sus ratos desocupados, lleva más de 8 años con su negocio el cual le permite ganar lo suyo y así salir adelante.
Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar zapatos, pollos, colas y otros víveres que necesita en su negocio. Lleva 4 ciclos en el  Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque con los créditos se ayudan para salir adelante. Sus sueños se darles lo mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en:
The Jaime Roldos loan group meets every other week in the section of Jaramijo. This place is known for its beautiful beaches. The majority of the people who live here are very hard-working and make a living with jobs out at sea. 
Mayra lives here. She is 25 years old, married and has two children who are 7 and 3 years old. The older one is in school. Her husband makes a living in fishing. She studies nursing at the University of Manta. Mayra makes a living selling shoes from a catalog. She also has a store in her house where she sells roast chickens every night. The chicken comes with plantains and rice stew, which really pleases the clients that come to her store every day. Her aunt helps her with the business on the days that she has to study. As far as shoe sales, she does this in her free time. She has been in her business for more than 8 years, which has allowed her to make her own living and get ahead. 
She will use this loan to buy shoes, chickens, glues and other supplies that she needs in her business. She has been in the loan group for 4 cycles and she likes it because the loans help her to get ahead. Her dream is to give her children the best life.

loans.use: to buy shoes, chicken, glues and other supplies.

loans.name: Ángela Gladia

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Jaime Roldos se reúne cada 15 días en el cantón Jaramijo este lugar es conocido por sus hermosas playas, la mayoría de los habitantes son muy trabajadores y dedicados a las faenas del mar.
En este lugar vive la señora Ángela, tiene 50 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen siete hijos, cinco mayores  de edad y dos de 15 y 12 años que estudian en colegio y aun viven con ella. Su esposo se dedica a la pesca.
Doña Ángela se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo y  productos naturales de la marca Garden  lo cual lo realiza puerta a puerta, ella sale en las mañanas o noches ofreciendo sus productos aunque la mayoría ya son solo para entregar ya que cuenta con muy buena clientela que siempre le piden sus productos, son más de 10 años  que se dedica a esta actividad  la cual comenzó con los créditos y ahora le permiten ganarse la vida.
Este crédito es para comprar ropa y productos Garden. Lleva 10 años en el Grupo De Crédito le gusta por la ayuda que le brindan los créditos. Sus sueños son seguir mejorando su negocio.
texts.en:
The Jaime Roldos Credit Group meets every two weeks in the Jaramijo district [state of Manabi, Ecuador]. Jaramijo is known for its beautiful beaches; the majority of its inhabitants are very hardworking and dedicated to earning a living from the sea.  

Señora Ángela lives in this place. She is 50 years old, married and has seven children: five are grown up and two, 15 and 12 years old, study at school and still live with her. Her husband earns his living in fishing. Doña Ángela works in the sale of clothing of all types and the Garden brand of natural products. She carries out her work from door to door. She goes out in the mornings or the evenings selling her products even though the majority of her visits are only to make deliveries since she now has a very steady clientele that always ask for her products. She has been doing this kind of work for more than 10 years; she began it with loans and now she can earn a living with it. This loan will be used to buy clothing and Garden products. Ángela has been in the Credit Group for 10 years and she appreciates the help that loans give her. He dreams are to continue improving her business,

loans.use: to buy clothing and items of the Garden product line.

loans.name: Rosa Mercedes

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Madres Emprendedoras se reúne cada 15 días en el barrio Córdova en  la ciudad de Manta,  ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año, por su gastronomía y por ser una ciudad con muchos atractivos turísticos.
En este lugar vive la señora Rosa, tiene 30 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre y de esta  relación tiene  una hija de 6 años que estudia en escuela. El marido es comerciante. Hace varios años  ella aprendió belleza en una Academia artesanal de la ciudad
Doña Rosa es una mujer muy trabajadora que le gusta realizar lo que sea para  obtener sus propios ingresos, ella tiene un centro de belleza en su  casa, allí realiza diversidad de trabajos como tinturados, cortes de cabellos, pintado de uñas entre  otras cosas, trabaja todos los días desde las 8h00 hasta las 20h00 y a veces hasta más tarde si sus clientes requieren de sus servicios. 	Otra actividad que le fascina es la cocina razón por lo cual está pensando en poco tiempo instalar una cevicheria y vender este delicioso plato que es muy apetecido por las personas en esta ciudad, está haciendo lo posible para adecuar su local y vender este delicioso alimento.
Este crédito lo va a emplear para comprar sillas y mesas para empezar a vender los alimentos así como también materiales de belleza para sus trabajos. Lleva 4 ciclos en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque con los créditos ella mejora su vida. Su sueño es darles lo mejor a su familia.
texts.en:
The Entrepreneurial Mothers Credit Group meets every 15 days in the Córdova neighborhood in the city of Manta, which is known for its beautiful beaches that are visited throughout the year for their gastronomy and many tourist attractions.  

Mrs. Rosa lives here. She is 30 years old and in a common-law marriage and from this relationship has a six-year-old daughter that is in school. Her husband is a businessman. Several years ago she received beauty training at a local academy in the city. 

Mrs. Rosa is a very hardworking woman that likes to do what she can to make her own income. She runs a beauty business out of her home where she performs a variety of jobs such as hair dying, haircuts, manicures/pedicures, among other things. She works every day from 8:00 AM until 8:00 PM and sometimes later if her customers require her services. 

Another business that interests her is cooking because she has been considering installing a ceviche shop and selling this delicious meal that is very popular in the city. She is doing what she can to adjust to local customs and sell this delicious food. 

This loan will be used to buy chairs and tables in order to start selling her food as well as beauty supplies for her business. She has been through four cycles with the credit group and likes it because she is improving her life with the loans. Her dream is to give her family the best.

loans.use: to buy chairs, tables and beauty supplies.

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Lilian works hard to support her family.

She has a business raising pigs in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from meat vending. Lilian is borrowing 17,000 PHP through NWTF to buy feed, vitamins, vaccine, and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Lilian has been sustaining her business activities through her past 9 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream, to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins, vaccine, and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Florami

texts.en:
Florami is a 39-year-old married woman, with one child.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Florami is borrowing 10,000 PHP through NWTF, to purchase feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Florami has been raising pigs for 3 years, and also earns additional income from buying and selling firewood.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream, to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase feed and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Iliana Regina

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Madres Emprendedoras se reúne cada 15 días en el barrio Córdova en  la ciudad de Manta,  ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año, por su gastronomía y por ser una ciudad con muchos atractivos turísticos.
En este lugar vive la señora Iliana, tiene 48 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos mayores de edad, uno de ellos  aún viven en su casa. Su esposo se dedica a la pesca.
Doña Iliana hace muchos años construyó una casa en la cual la adecuo departamentos para alquiler, cuenta con cuatro departamentos los mismos que tiene arrendado y mensualmente recibe el pago por dichos arriendos, ella tiene que invertir en arreglos y adecuaciones que requieren los departamentos para brindar un ambiente más adecuado para sus inquilinos, actualmente ella necesita cambiar unas baterías sanitarias y pintar los departamentos, razón por lo cual solicita este crédito ya que así sus inquilinos están más cómodos y pagan puntualmente los arriendos que le sirven a ella para salir adelante.
Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar pinturas, baterías sanitarias y para el pago de mano de obra. Lleva 7 años  en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos son rápidos y con intereses cómodos.  Sus sueños son tener más departamentos.
texts.en:
The Group Credit Mothers Entrepreneurs meets every 15 days in the Cordova neighborhood in the city of Manta, known for its beautiful beaches that are visited at any time of year, for its gastronomy and for being a city with many tourist attractions.
Here lives Mrs. Iliana, 48 years old, and married. From this relationship they have three adult children, one of them still lives at home. Her husband is fisherman.
Many years ago, Mrs. Iliana built a house which she adapted for rental apartments. It has four apartments which she rents and from which she recieves monthly payment. She has to invest in repairs and adaptations that the apartments require to provide more suitable environment for its occupants. She now needs to change some restroom stalls and paint the apartments, for which she requests this loan because if tenants are more comfortable and promptly pay the rent that she will use to move foward.
She will use this loan to buy paint, restroom stalls and for the payment of labor.  She has been in Group Credit for seven years and likes it because the loans are fast and with afordable interests. Her dream is to have more apartments.

loans.use: to buy paint, bathroom stalls, and pay labor

loans.name: Elisita

texts.en:
Elisita works hard to support her family. She is married, and has a business buying and selling ready-to-wear goods in the Philippines.

Elisita requested a loan of 12,000 PHP through NWTF, to buy stock of ready-to-wear goods to sell, such as bags, underwear, shirts, pants, etc. She has been in this business for 20 years.

Elisita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy stock of ready-to-wear goods to sell, such as bags, underwear, shirts pants, etc.

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet is a 31-year-old married woman, with three children, one of whom is currently in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Juliet has a business buying and selling dried fish in the Philippines. Juliet has requested a loan of 13,000 PHP through NWTF, to purchase more dried fish to sell.

Juliet has been in this business for 2 years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more dried fish to sell

loans.name: Bernadita

texts.en:
Bernadita is a hard-working entrepreneur, who has a vegetables vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 28.000 PHP through NWTF, to buy more vegetables to sell in her business.

Bernadita has been in this business for 10 years. She also earns additional income from her general store.

Bernadita has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to sell

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is a widowed woman with six children, three of whom go to school. She also takes care of two additional family members . 

Margaret sells goats from her home on a retail basis. She has been in this business for 15 years. Margaret works seven days a week. She gets additional income from rental houses. 

Margaret has applied for a loan from MCDT-SACCO to buy more goats. Her major business challenges include seasonality and diseases, which affect her animals. She aspires to buy more land for farming. Margaret resides in her own house, and the family has access to electricity, but does not have access to piped water. Her monthly expenses includes school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more goats.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is a hardworking, married woman with two children. She lives in Bundibugyo, Uganda. Her business is mainly buying and selling cocoa, on top of cocoa growing for supplementary income. She is in need of a loan to pay school fees for her child.

She has a great desire to accumulate more capital and becoming a prominent businesswoman, but she complains of the difficulty of high transport costs, unpredictable weather changes, and limited capital.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her child.

loans.name: Juana Teresa

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Jaime Roldos se reúne cada 15 días en el cantón Jaramijo este lugar es conocido por sus hermosas playas, la mayoría de los habitantes son muy trabajadores y dedicados a las faenas del mar.
En este lugar vive la señora Juana, tiene 59 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos, dos mayores de edad y uno de 16 años, dos de ellos estudian en Universidad y colegio y aun viven con ella. Su esposo se dedica a la pesca.
Doña Juana  al ver que su marido no gana mucho y que en ocasiones no puede salir a pescar por los fenómenos naturales que cada vez son más frecuentes  hace mas de 25  años surtió en su casa una pequeña tienda de viveras, allí empezó a vender solo  productos como arroz, azúcar, aceites, detergentes, entre otros víveres primarios, y después con la ayuda de los créditos ella ha ido aumentando la variedad de productos, ahora también vende artículos de bazar y papelería, con esto ha ganado más clientela con lo cual le quedan mejores ingresos que ella los invierte para ir mejorando su negocio y para las cosas necesarias en su hogar y estudios  de sus hijos.
Este crédito lo va a emplear en surtir mas su tienda, va a comprar arroz, azúcar, aceite, detergentes, útiles escolares y cosas de bazar. Lleva más de 18 años en el Grupo Crédito y le gusta porque con los  créditos mejora su negocio. Sus metas son seguir aumentando su tienda cada día más.
texts.en:
The Jaime Roldos Credit Group meets every 15 days in the village of Jaramijo, which is known for its beautiful beaches. The majority of residents are hardworking and make a living fishing. 

Mrs. Juana lives here. She is 59 years old, is married and from this relationship has three children – two of which are grown and one who is 16 years old. Two of them are studying in college and high school and still live with her. Her husband makes a living as a fisherman. 

More than 25 years ago, Mrs. Juana started a small goods store in her house after seeing that her husband did not earn much and occasionally could not go out to fish due to natural disasters that each time occurred more frequently. 

There she began to sell products such as rice, sugar, oils and detergent, among other primary household items. After the help she received with loans, she has been able to expand her variety of products. 

Now, she is also selling craft items and stationary, which has earned her more customers and a better income that she has invested to improve her business and to pay for necessary things in the house and her children’s education. 

This loan will be used to supply her store as she is going to buy rice, sugar, oil, detergent, school supplies and craft items. The credit group has existed for more than 18 years, and she likes it because she has improved her business with the loans. Her goal is to continue improving her store every day.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, oil, detergent, school supplies and craft items.

loans.name: Jorge Ruben

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Jaime Roldos se reúne cada 15 días en el cantón Jaramijo este lugar es conocido por sus hermosas playas, la mayoría de los habitantes son muy trabajadores y dedicados a las faenas del mar.
En este lugar vive el señor Jorge, tiene 23 años de edad, está casado y de esta relación tiene 1 hijo de 6 meses de edad. Su esposa es ama de casa y estudia en un colegio de la localidad, el también además de trabajar estudia contabilidad y auditoría en una universidad.
Don Jorge es un joven que le gusta trabajar para así irse forjando un mejor porvenir para él y su familia, el junto a sus padres desde hace varios años se dedican a la compra de mariscos, el junto a su papá todos los días se desplaza hasta la playa local y compran pescado, camarón y otros mariscos los mismos que luego venden por libras por el lugar y ciudades cercanas, también entregan al por mayor a otros comerciantes y fabricas en la ciudad de Manta, de esta forma el logra ganarse el sustento diario y seguir con sus estudios que para él es muy importante.
Este crédito es para comprar pescado, camarón y otros mariscos. Lleva 2 ciclos  en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos son rápidos y de mucha ayuda. Sus sueños son tener su título y ser un profesional.
texts.en:
The "Jaime Roldos" communal bank meets every fortnight in the canton of Jaramijo , a place known for it's beautiful beaches. The majority of it's inhabitants are very hard-working and work at sea.

Jorge lives in this place. He is 23 years old, married and from this relationship has a 6 month old son. His wife is a housewife and studies at a local college. Besides his work he also is studying accounting and auditing at a university.

Jorge is a youth who likes to work in order to create a better future for him and his family. Together with his parents he has been working selling seafood for a number of years. With his father he goes everyday to the local beach and buys fish, shrimp and other seafood and sells them by weight in the community and nearby cities. They also distribute them wholesale to other businesses and factories in the city of Manta. In this way he manages to earn his daily sustenance and continue his studies which is very important to him.

This loan is to buy fish, shrimp and other seafood. He has been a member of the communal bank for two loan cycles and he likes it as the loan are awarded rapidly and are of great help. His dream is to get his degree and be a professional.

loans.use: to buy fish, shrimp and other seafood.

loans.name: Rinki

texts.en:
Rinki is a very active lady of 28 years. She lives with her husband in the small village of Bhutanirghat in Falakata, West Bengal. She had the opportunity to study until 12th grade in her younger age.  Now she is a homemaker.

To make a living for the family, Rinki's husband has been farming paddy and other vegetables on their own plot of land. He has been doing this for many years, and he is the only breadwinner in the family. Rinki helps her husband in the agricultural work after managing her household work. They work arduously to get ahead. They sell the produce from their agribusiness to the local markets. This agribusiness supplies them with the necessary finances to provide themselves with clothing, food, medicine, etc. 

Now they want to expand their business by cultivating more paddies. Being a staple food of West Bengal, paddy rice is in great favor in their locality and is widely used in India. Rinki has taken a loan from Kiva's partner BJS to purchase good quality seeds, fertilizers and agricultural inputs that will help her to have a smooth cultivation of the crop.

Her goal is to continue increasing the cultivation of the product and strengthening her family's economy. 

Her full thanks go to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and fertilizers for cultivating paddy.

loans.name: Salem

texts.en:
Twenty-four-year-old Salem lives in a village named Mukuldanga in Falakata, West Bengal. She lives with her husband and three sons. Two of her sons are receiving an education and one is a preschooler.  Salem and her husband received an elementary education. 

Salem's husband is a farmer. To take care of the family's needs, he is extensively engaged in agriculture and in the cultivation of paddy. He sells the agricultural products in the local market, which is the main source of income for the family, but it has become very difficult for him to support a five-member family with his small income.

In order to continue developing their agribusiness in a sustainable way and at the same time cultivate paddy on their farmland, Salem needs to make some investments. She has taken out a loan from BJS. She will use the loan to purchase paddy seeds and fertilizers. 

Salem dreams this business will enable her to earn extra profit, which will give financial support to her family to fulfill their basic needs and educate the children properly. In the future, Salem desires to purchase more agricultural land with the profit.

Salem sincerely thanks BJS and Kiva for the financial support.

loans.use: To purchase paddy seeds and fertilizers for farming good quality paddies.

loans.name: Maliam

texts.en:
Maliam deals in selling food, such as cassava flour, rice, beans, and tomatoes. She supplements her income farming cocoa. Maliam started farming in 1999 to raise income to support the family’s increasing demands. 

Maliam's family's desire is to buy more land, and expand her food selling business. She has requested a loan to buy food, such as tomatoes and onions, to sell. Her business is affected by unpredictable changes in weather, and high labor costs, which hinder her returns.

loans.use: to buy food, such as tomatoes and onions, to sell.

loans.name: Umedjon

texts.en:
Umedjon is an honest man. He was born in the northern part of Tajikistan in 1985, and lives in rural area with his family. He is married and has two children.

Umedjon has had a good business in agriculture for more than ten years. He has land where he plants vegetables and cereals. He cares for his land and his planting to get a good harvest. This year he planted vegetables, and he must fertilize and use natural chemicals so that pests do not destroy his harvest. Umedjon has asked for a loan to buy fertilizer and natural chemicals. He hopes to be supported by KIVA lenders, because this activity is the only source of income that he earns to feed his family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and natural chemicals

loans.name: Wilber Antonio

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Jaime Roldos se reúne cada 15 días en el cantón Jaramijo este lugar es conocido por sus hermosas playas, la mayoría de los habitantes son muy trabajadores y dedicados a las faenas del mar.
En este lugar vive don Wilber, tiene 40 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre  y de esta relación tiene 4 hijas de 16, 14, 12 y 10 años, las 3 mayores estudian en colegio y la menor en escuela. Su esposa es comerciante y artesana.
Don Wilber es un hombre  muy trabajador que hace lo posible para darles lo mejor a su familia, el se dedica al comercio, vende  pescado por libras y enteros si sus clientes así lo prefieren, el todos los días en la madrugada se van hasta las playas de la localidad a comprar  a los pescadores que llegan hasta el lugar y luego se va por la localidad vendiendo el pescado a personas del lugar, comerciantes y turistas que llegan a la ciudad. El también ciertos días de la semana se va a otros lugares a comprar queso el mismo que luego vende también por la ciudad el cual se vende muy rápido en su zona y le deja muy buenos ingresos.
Este crédito es para comprar pescado y queso. Lleva 3 años  en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos le permiten salir adelante. Sus sueños es darles lo necesario a sus hijas.
texts.en:
The "Jaime Roldos" coomunal bank meets every fortnight in the canton of Jaramijo, a place known for it's beautiful beaches. It's inhabitants are very hard-working and work at sea.

Wilber lives in this place. He is 40 years old and in a common-law relationship and from this relationship has four daughters aged 16, 14, 12 and 10 years old. The three oldest study in Secondary school and the youngest in Primary school. His wife is a businesswoman and a crafts-person.

Wilber is a very hard-working man who does everything possible to provide the best for his family. He works in business, selling fish by weight or whole to his clients as they prefer. Everyday early he sets out to the beaches of the community to buy from the fisherman that come there and after goes around the community selling fish to locals, businesses and tourists. Certain days of the week he also buys cheese which he sells in the community. The cheese sells very rapidly in the area and leaves him with good profits.

This loan is to buy fish and cheese. He has been in the communal bank for three years and he likes it as the loans allow him to get ahead. His dream is to provide what is necessary for his daughters.

loans.use: to buy fish and cheese.

loans.name: Emmabel

texts.en:
Emmabel is 31 years old and a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Emmabel has an eggs and dried fish vending business in the Philippines. Emmabel requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional trays of eggs and dried fish to sell.

Emmabel has been in this business for two years. In the future, Emmabel would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional trays of eggs and dried fish to sell

loans.name: Gayane

texts.en:
This is Gayane's second loan. She obtained a previous loan from a local financial institution. Unfortunately, that first loan was very difficult for her to pay back, and Gayane faced some difficulties. However, thanks to her hard work during more recent times, she and her husband have been able to run their agribusiness in a sustainable way, ensuring that they will be able to cover the monthly payments. 

So, Gayane has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. This second-chance loan program provides loans to people who have a bad credit history and have no access to credit products.

Gayane lives in Goris town with her husband and two children. They are specialized in beekeeping. Currently keeping 80 colonies of bees gives them an opportunity to get high quality honey and sell it. Gayane applied for this loan to purchase 25 colonies of bees and forage for the livestock. By enlarging beekeeping, Gayane and her family hope to get more income and better living conditions.

loans.use: to pay for 25 colonies of bees and forage for her livestock

loans.name: Leonila

texts.en:
Leonila is a native from the town of Getafe, Bohol. She runs a sari-sari (variety) store, selling various commodities such as noodles, canned goods, biscuits, beverages, and toiletries. She is  married with three children, ages 2,3, and 6. In addition to operating a sari-sari store, Leonila engages in fishing. She sells fresh fish for additional income.

Leonila is in need of capital to finance her livelihood. She  is asking for a loan to purchase assorted groceries and fishing materials, such as fishing nets.  These resources are essential for the improvement of her businesses, and will increase the her daily catch, as well as enhancing the stock in her store. This will increase her earnings, and enable her to settle her obligation.

In the future, Leonila would like to expand her business to make it productive and profitable, to be able to finance the schooling of her growing children.

loans.use: to purchase assorted groceries and fishing materials, such as fishing nets

loans.name: Gor

texts.en:
Gor is from the Shirak region, where he lives with his parents, wife, and two young sons. 

Gor is farmer, with many years of experience. He has four cows, calves, a pig, and seven hens. Gor also cultivates potatoes and cabbage in the farm yard near their house.
 
Gor has applied for this loan to purchase fertilizer, potatoes, and cabbage, and to renovate his agro machine. 

Because the region where Gor's village is located is considered poor, and the unemployment rate is very high, people face numerous difficulties in developing their businesses. Gor's loan has been approved by the joint initiative between SEF and Kiva, which provides loans to the underserved population of the Shirak region to help them to access the market and earn a living.

loans.use: to pay for fertilizer, potatoes, and cabbage seeds, and to pay for the renovation of his agro machine

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia works hard to support her family. Cecilia is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

Cecilia requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients like peanuts, butter, sugar, etc. for her food production business.

Cecilia has been in this business for 5 years now.

Cecilia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like peanuts, butter, and sugar for her food production business.

loans.name: Aliya

texts.en: Aliya is a married woman with three children in Bundibugyo-Uganda. She is a cocoa trader mainly buying cocoa to resell. She started her business in 2010 with an aim of taking care of her family needs and gets additional income from her retail shop situated on a busy street in town. She requests a loan to buy merchandise like soap, sugar, sodas and bread to sell and raise school fees for her children. Her family dream is educating her children to university level and her business dream is expanding her cocoa business to new markets.

loans.use: to buy merchandise like soap, sugar, sodas and bread to sell.

loans.name: Sumana

texts.en:
Sumana, 21 years old, is a young entrepreneur who lives with her husband and one small daughter in the village of Mukuldanga in Falakata. Sumana received a limited education (up to grade 7) due to her family's poor economic resources. She is married to 28-year-old Dilip who is a mason by profession. Sumana is engaged in animal husbandry. 

As her husband has a very inconsistent income, their small family survives on the income brought in by Sumana's dairy business. She raises cows and sells the milk in her neighborhood. She also sells cow dung for additional income, which is widely used as farm manure in her locality. Sumana diligently saves a little amount and sets it aside for her child’s education. The rest is spent for the family's household expenses. But realistically, she is aware that the amount she must save should be much more, if she has to provide a complete education for her daughter and improve her family’s living standards. 

So, Sumana plans to build on her milk business by buying an extra cow. The extra milk from the cow will bring in an extra income per month. It will be a key step towards Sumana's goal of earning more, saving better, and achieving the financial independence to provide a good future for her daughter. So she is seeking a loan from BJS to buy the cow. 

She appreciates her lenders' support.

loans.use: To buy a cow for her milk-supplying business.

loans.name: Manasa

texts.en:
Manasa is a resident of Muniguda village of Rayagada district, Odisha, India. She is 32 years old. She has a small family with her husband and only one son. She and her husband are engaged with the occupation of a fast food center at the nearest marketplace. No doubt she has everything as per the requirement of basic necessities of life, like a small but permanent income, a two-wheeler, a good shop, and other allied items to manage her family. Still, her family members are not happy. Why? Due to no availability of a good RCC (reinforced concrete) house that they own.

It doesn’t means that they are staying at an open place or thatched house. But, they are staying at a rented house with a high rate of rent charged by the house owner. The rented house is made from mud and roofed with asbestos, which creates a very critical situation during the rainy season. It is also very critical to stay during the winter period. The most important cause of apprehension is that the house is not completely secure and safe.

In this situation, she decided to construct a RCC house for a good standard. She has already started the construction, but the funds are insufficient to complete it. So, she decided to borrow a loan from any bank or other financial institution.

At this moment, Manasa came to Mahashakti Foundation to learn about house loan details. Mahashakti Foundation has decided to disburse a loan for house construction.

She is very happy to know that her house will be complete within a few months, and she will be proud to be a house owner in the society.

loans.use: to construct a house.

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
This is Lorna and she's requesting again a loan amounting PHP 20,000 to continue the operations of her corn business.

She knows that you are the right persons to ask because she has proven once that you're reliable. She hopes for good outcome from this, since it has always been her dream to widen the range of her business and earn enough for her three kids' schooling. She doesn't want them to ignore their studies and leave them unfinished with their courses. That's why she's really eager to work diligently.

She will use this new loan to buy supplies of raw corn that she will cook and sell within her community. Today, this is her only source of income. And it depends on you whether she continues managing this. Now is your time to help a mother like her.

Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy supplies of raw corn that she will cook and sell within her community.

loans.name: Jemma

texts.en:
Jemma is married with four children and is a member of Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc.  
 
Jemma supports the family through her general store business in the Philippines.

She took an educational loan for her daughter Ninia Angela, who is 19 years old and the first of four children in the family. She is studying for her Bachelor of Science in Accountancy and is currently in the fourth year of this four-year course.

Jemma is borrowing 9,200 PHP to pay for tuition fees for her daughter Ninia Angela for the first semester of the school year 2015-2016.

Ninia Angela plans, when she graduates, to help her parents earn an income to send her brother and sister to college.

loans.use: to pay for tuition fees for her daughter

loans.name: Tutu

texts.en:
Tutu is a resident of Muniguda village of Rayagada district, Odisha, India. She is 45 years old. She has a small family with her husband and two sons. She and her husband are engaged with the occupation of a pan shop and a transport business. She has everything as per the requirements of the basic necessities of life: permanent monthly income from established businesses, a two-wheeler, and allied items to manage her family. Still, her family members are not happy due to non-availability of a good RCC (reinforced concrete) house that they own.

They are staying at a rented house with a high rate of rent and without sufficient facilities. It is very difficult to leave during the rainy season. It is also very critical to stay during summer and winter season. In this situation, she decided to construct a house with a good standard. She has already started to construct the house, but she does not have sufficient funds to complete it. So, she decided to borrow a loan from any bank or other financial institution.

At this moment, Tutu came to Mahashakti Foundation to learn about house loan details. Mahashakti Foundation has decided to disburse a loan to Tutu for house construction.

She is very happy to know that her house will be completed within a few months. It not only reduces the financial burden, but also helps Tutu to feel proud to be a house owner in the society.

loans.use: to construct a house.

loans.name: Zaina

texts.ru: Зайна, 55 лет, замужем, 4 детей. Образование у Зайны среднее. Успешно занимаясь животноводством, она добилась очень хороших результатов, у нее есть 2 коровы,3 лошади, 70 овец. Ее прибыль составляет 13,000 сом (KGS). Для дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Зайна обратилась в Банк «Бай - Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 80,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота. На прибыль от кредита она планирует увеличить своё хозяйство.
texts.en:
Zaina is 55 years old, married, with four kids. She has completed secondary education. Good skills in breeding livestock enabled Zaina to achieve great results represented in two cows, three horses and 70 sheep that are in her household. She turns a profit of 13,000 som (KGS). 

To further develop her business, Zaina turned to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 80,000 som (KGS) to purchase livestock. She is planning to expand the business with the borrowed money.

loans.use: to buy more livestock to increase the herd

loans.name: Ritah

texts.en:
Ritah lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with four children, and all go to school. She operates a beauty salon at the market on a retail basis. She has been in this business for the last eight years. She works seven days a week and gets additional income from providing outside catering.

She has requested a loan from MCDT – SACCO to buy hair relaxers, treatments, hair oils, weaves and braids. Her major challenge includes seasonality and transportation. Her goal and aspiration is to educate her children to the university level. She lives in her own house and the family has access to piped water and electricity. Her major monthly expenses include food and school fees.

loans.use: to buy hair relaxers, treatments, hair oils, and weaves for her beauty salon.

loans.name: Benkaditon Group

texts.fr:
SALIMATA, la Dame qui a sa main dans le sac de riz  sur la photo, est une malienne non scolarisé, âgée de 48 ans, mariée et mère de 6 enfants, âgée de 08 à 28 ans dont 2 fréquentent l’école coranique. Son mari est un cultivateur.
Elle fait le commerce de riz depuis plus de 10 ans. Elle s’approvisionne dans les marchés environnant et revend  dans les mêmes marchés. Le profit qu’elle réalise la permet d’aider son mari pour subvenir aux besoins de la famille.
Elle emprunte de l’argent auprès de RMCR pour  acheter baucoup.
Ayant souvent confronté au problème de rabaissement du prix de ses produits sur le marché lors des ventes, SALIMATA souhaite  devenir une grande commençante  de céréale dans le  future.
texts.en:
Salimata, the woman who has her hand in the bag of rice in the photo, is an uneducated Malian. She is 48 years old, married, and the mother of 6 children: ages 8 to 28 years old, of which 2 frequent Koranic school. Her husband is a farmer. 

She has been conducting business in rice for more than 10 years. She stocks up at the neighboring markets and resells at the same markets. The profit that she realizes, allow her to help her husband meet the needs of the family. 

She borrows money with RMCR in order to buy a lot. Having often confronted the problem of lowering the price of her products at the market during sales, Slimata hopes to become a big trader of grains in the future.

loans.use: to buy bags of grains to resell

loans.name: Lidia Argentina

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Balsamaragua se reúne cada 15 días en el cantón Jaramijo, este lugar es conocido por sus hermosas playas, aquí la mayoría de los habitantes son muy trabajadores y dedicados a las faenas del mar.
En este lugar vive la señora Lidia, tiene 54 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen seis hijos mayores de edad, dos de ellos aun viven en su casa y estudian en universidad. Su esposo se dedica a la pesca.
Doña Lidia es una gran ama de casa que realiza el crédito para que su esposo tenga los recursos necesarios para poder realizar un gran trabajo, su esposo se dedica a la pesca, el junto a sus hijos  se van a alta mar en su pequeña embarcación a realizar sus faenas de pesca, ellos salen en la mañana y regresan en la tarde con los productos que le mar les da, una vez en la playa entregan los productos a comerciantes que llegan  hasta el lugar a comprar a los pescadores de la zona. Llevan más de 20  años  dedicados a esta dura labor con la cual el saca a su familia adelante.
Este crédito es para comprar redes, piolas combustibles y otros materiales de pesca. Esta desde el inicio en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por la ayuda que recibe con los créditos. Sus sueños son tener un gran barco para que su esposo realice sus faenas de pesca.
texts.en:
The lending group Balsamaragua meets every 15 days in the canton of Jaramijo, an area known for its beautiful beaches. Most of the inhabitants here are very hardworking and make their living from the sea.

Here we meet Lidia, 54, who is married and has 6 grown children, two of whom still live at home and are in university. Lidia is a wonderful housewife who is asking for this loan for her husband. Her husband is a fisherman who, together with his children, goes out onto the high seas in his small boat in order to fish. They leave in the morning and come back in the afternoon with the gifts of the sea. Once they are on land, they deliver the products to merchants who come to buy from the fishermen.

He has more than 20 years doing this work, which is how he helps his family to get ahead. This credit will be used to buy nets, tethers, gas, and other fishing materials. Lidia has been in this lending group since the beginning and likes it because of the assistance that she gets with the loans. Their dream is to have a big boat for her husband to fish with.

loans.use: to buy nets, tethers, gas and other materials for fishing.

loans.name: Kijitonyama Group

texts.en:
Halima, who is in her early 30s, is single with one son who is still in school.  She has been running two projects, a pub and food vending, for eight years now.  She works from 9am to midnight daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.  

This will be Halima's fifth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loans to increase the pub drinks and to start selling food. She is happy with the loan and appreciates Kiva for the support of their group.  She used the profit to pay school fees, to repay her loan and to cover household expenses. She will use this loan to put up a canopy at her pub and to buy fast-moving drinks to meet her customers' demands. She dreams of owning a nice house.

Halima will share this loan with her loan group, Kijitonyama, which consists of two members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to put up a canopy at her pub and to buy fast-moving drinks to meet her customers'  demands.

loans.name: Analy

texts.en:
Analy is 40 years old and married with five children.

Analy works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 24,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional groceries to sell in her general store.

Analy has borrowed and repaid 13 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns an income from her internet cafe.

Analy aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Charito

texts.en:
As a married parent, Charito works hard to support her family.

Charito has a food vending business in the Philippines, and she also earns additional income from a general store. 

Charito is borrowing PHP 17,000 through NWTF to purchase ingredients for her food production business such as meat, spices, seasonings, etc. She successfully repaid her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Charito has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for her food production business such as meat, spices, seasonings, etc.

loans.name: Gulmira

texts.ru: Гулмира, 47 лет, замужем. Образование-среднее, занимается животноводством. Благодаря упорному труду и терпеливому характеру Гулмиры, на сегодняшний день она имеет хорошее хозяйство: 2 коровы и 15 овец. Ежемесячная прибыль Гулмиры составляет 30,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, она обратилась в Банк «Бай-Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку овец. Доходы от кредита Гулмира планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение количества скота.
texts.en:
Gulmira is 47 years old, married. She has completed secondary education and breeds livestock. Thanks to her hard work and patience, Gulmira’s household now includes two cows and 15 sheep. Gulmira’s monthly profit totals 30,000 som (KGS). 

To further develop her business, Gulmira turned to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 100,000 som (KGS) to purchase sheep. She is planning to invest the borrowed money to increase the livestock headcount.

loans.use: to buy more sheep for fattening and resale

loans.name: Rosa Ginger

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Balsamaragua se reúne cada 15 días en el cantón Jaramijo, este lugar es conocido por sus hermosas playas, aquí la mayoría de los habitantes son muy trabajadores y dedicados a las faenas del mar.
En este lugar vive la señora Rosa, tiene 28 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos de 9, 8 y 6 años de edad, todos de ellos estudian en escuela. Su esposo se dedica a la pesca.
Doña Rosa solicita el credito para que su esposo los utilice en su labor, el  se dedica a la pesca, el junto a otra persona o solo sale todas las mañanas en una pequeña embarcación de remos que tiene, el solo pesca cerca de la playa ya que con ese bote a remos no puede adentrarse mucho en el mar ya que sería muy peligroso, pesca lo que puede en esta parte del mar y aunque son peces pequeños igual se venden muy bien y esto les deja lo necesario para salir adelante.
Este crédito es para comprar carnadas, anzuelos, redes y otros materiales de pesca. Ella lleva 4 ciclos en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque así ella ayuda a su marido con los  créditos. Sus sueños son tener una lancha a motor para que su marido realice su labor mucho mejor.
texts.en:
The lending group Balsamaragua meets every 15 days in the canton of Jaramijo, a place known for its beautiful beaches. Most of the inhabitants here are very hardworking and earn their living from the sea.

Here we meet Rosa, 28, who is married and has three children, ages 9, 8 and 6 years old. They are all in school. Her husband is a fisherman. Rosa is asking for a loan for his husband to use for his work. Alone or with a partner, he goes out every morning in a small rowboat. He only fishes close to the beach because it would be very dangerous to go out too far in his rowboat. He gets what he can from this part of the sea, and although the fish are small they sell well. His work provides them with what they need to get ahead.

This loan will be used to buy bait, hooks, nets and other materials for fishing. Rosa has 4 cycles with the lending group and likes it because she can help her husband through the loans. Her dream is to have a boat with a motor so that her husband can do his work better.

loans.use: to buy bait, hooks, nets and other fishing materials.

loans.name: Jerlie

texts.en:
Thanks to Jerlie lenders as she started improving her direct selling business lately through your granted loan worth PHP 50,000. Because of your wide and helping hands, Jerlie was able to increase her profit from her enterprise, thus help her family to have a little better daily living condition than usual.

She wants to continue the work, so she is asking for a new loan worth PHP 50,000 that she would use to purchase more quantity of direct-selling products like cosmetics and other personal care products. This can be a good opportunity for her as she explores different avenues to success. She prays that your unwavering support for her won't vanish.

With a vision in mind to help her children to finish schooling, she does everything she can to support them all the way. She dreams of having their own house and lot in the future; and to a woman who is determined to win, nothing is a failure, but a delayed success.

She meets up weekly with her fellowship* co-members to share stories of her work and draw strength and inspiration from studying the Word of God.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners who gather to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to purchase more quantity of direct-selling products like cosmetics and other personal care products.

loans.name: Jacquiline

texts.en:
Good day lenders! This is Jacquiline. She is only 26 years old now and has three children. Flinging herself into managing her current sari-sari (variety) store business, she is hopeful that in no time, she will be able to finally grow her business. But as of now, she is working persistently to provide for the daily needs of her household.

Sari-sari stores are often seen everywhere in the Philippines, most especially along the sidewalks and streets. It is most likely a convenience store, but quite smaller than the usual and offers only limited products which are commonly needed such as toiletries, food, instants, beverages and other commodities. Unlike grocery stores, sari-sari stores offer products at low-cost and on a retail basis, which is really an advantage for the customers.

Making headways to improve her sales, Jacquiline would like to ask for help from you. She wishes to take a loan worth PHP 20,000 that she would use to purchase additional products and merchandise items for her store. With this, she expects to grow her sales and provide a better remedy for their family’s daily living conditions. And today, you can be a big part of her life. 

She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to purchase additional products and merchandise items for her store.

loans.name: Rabilla

texts.ru: Рабилла, 32 года, замужем, мать 5 детей. На протяжении 8 лет занимается животноводством и полеводством, мастер в своем деле. У Рабиллы высшее образование. Она достигла больших успехов в своем бизнесе. В хозяйстве имеет 2 коровы, 2 лошади. Также есть земельный надел, 1,0 ГА арендованной и 0,23 ГА собственной земли, где она выращивает ячмень для реализации. Совокупная прибыль Рабиллы составляет около 25,000 сом (KGS). Рабилла обратилась в Банк «Бай-Тушум» за кредитом, в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку лошади для отгона на пастбище. Это позволит Рабилле развить бизнес и увеличить доход от бизнес деятельности.
texts.en:
Rabilla is 32 years old, married, a mother of five kids. For eight years she has been breeding livestock and cultivating plants. She has become a professional in her field. She also has an advanced degree. 

Rabilla has achieved great heights in her business. She has two cows and two horses. She has a land lot of 1.0 ha that she leases and 0.23 ha that she owns. On the land, Rabilla cultivates barley for sale. Overall, she turns a profit of about 25,000 som (KGS). Rabilla turned to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 100,000 som (KGS) to buy a horse to depasture which will enable her to promote the business and increase her earnings.

loans.use: to buy a horse to depasture

loans.name: Jiguiseme Group

texts.fr:
N’gnafilè est l’homme  tenant dans sa main la puisette.
N’gnafilè est un maraicher non alphabétisé  résident au MALI ,marié père de 05 enfants tous âgés de 21 à 1 ans dont actuellement 02 fréquentes l’école ,sa femme fait le ménage à la maison , il fait le jardinage de choux, tomates, oignons depuis 20 ans .Dans l’évolution de son jardinage , N’gnafilè a eu des soucis  de semences et intrants : le manque de moyens pour l’amélioration de son entreprise ,il fait recourt à l’IMF pour obtenir plus de fonds pour acheter plus de semences améliorées et  d’intrants( tomates ,choux , oignons  et de produits  et d’ insecticides) en vue de pouvoir amélioré sa production.
Il fait son approvisionnement dans le marché local et après avoir fait l’entretien de son jardin il les vend au marché local  à des prix qui  lui rapportent plus de profits grâce à sa maitrise du marché tout en réalisant un bénéfice moyenne de 900000fcfa par cycle et ce bénéfice  lui permet d’envoyer ses enfants à l’école et de couvrir les soins médicaux, il rêve dans l’avenir d’être indépendant du prêt.
texts.en:
N’gnafilè is the man holding the bucket in his hand. N’gnafilè is an illiterate market gardener. He is resident of Mali, married, and the father of 5 children, all ages from 1 to 21 years old of which 2 currently frequent school. His wife does the housework at home. He has been growing cabbage, tomatoes, and onions in his garden for 20 years. In the evolution of his gardening, N’gnafilè has had problems with seeds and inputs: the lack of means to improve his business. He resorts to IMF to obtain more funds to buy better seeds and inputs (tomatoes, cabbage, onions, produce, and insecticide) with the aim of improving his production. 

He buys his supplies at the local market and, after having done the maintenance of his garden, he sells them at the local market at prices that return more profits to him thanks to his command of the entire market. He realizes an average profit of 900,000 cfa francs per cycle and this profit allows him to send his children to school and to cover medical care. He dreams of being independent of loans in the future.

loans.use: to buy better seeds to cultivate his garden

loans.name: Flordeliza

texts.en:
Hi there lenders! 

Thanks for being a part of Flordeliza's journey. With your previous financial support, she did establish her frozen food product sales business, resulting into a more profitable source of income. You are such a blessing! 

For now, she's been so dedicated and passionate toward cultivating her business. Though the fact is that her everyday journey with this is not as smooth-sailing as she dreams, her perspective and will to change her family's state makes her attitude towards the goal flip. 

She's been looking forward to more opportunities to grow her inventories. Once more, she would like to ask for your help. She's borrowing a 17,000 PHP loan that would enable her to buy enough quantities of frozen meats like chicken and pork and beef. She prays that you'll help her with this. 

She has proven once that she's faithful in repaying. And she hopes that you trust her once again. With hope and faith, she believes that through this business, she'll be able to earn well for her children's education. She wants to finish school for future security. She also wants to build more businesses for more sources of income.

As of today, she's active in attending a weekly fellowship that enables her to draw strength and inspiration to push towards the goal through the word of God that she studies with her colleagues. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy additional frozen products and merchandise to resell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy some chicks and food to practice poultry farming

loans.name: Micheal

texts.en: Micheal is a very hard working married man with 3 children with ages ranging from 1 to 7 years old. Only one of his children attends school in Hoima Uganda. He runs a depot mainly selling beers, sodas and other items. He dreams of expanding and growing his business and feels only limited by adequate capital. He is seeking a loan to buy more stock like beers and sodas to sell.

loans.use: to buy more stock such as beers and sodas to sell.

loans.name: Kalpana

texts.en:
Kalpana is a resident of Muniguda village of Rayagada district, Odisha, India. She is 42 years old. She has a small family with her husband and two children. She and her husband are engaged with the occupation of a milk business, goat transport, and auto service center for the customers of nearby villages. No doubt she has everything as per the requirements of the basic necessities of life, different activities with a permanent income, a three-wheeler, a good shop, and other allied items to manage her family. Still, her family members are not so happy due to the non-availability of a good RCC (reinforced concrete) house that they own.

It doesn’t mean that they are staying at a thatched house; rather, they are staying at a rented house with a high rate of rent. The rented house is made from mud and roofed with asbestos, which creates a very critical situation during the rainy season. The most important cause of apprehension is that the house is not completely secure and safe.

In this situation, she decided to construct a small, but standard house with all possible facilities. She has already started to construct the house, but she does not have sufficient funds to complete it. So, she decided to borrow a loan from any bank or other financial institution.

At this moment, Kalpana came to Mahashakti Foundation to learn about house loan details. Mahashakti Foundation has decided to disburse a loan for house construction. With the loan, Kalpana will complete the door, windows, plastering, flooring, and coloring the house. She will also complete the wiring with an electricity connection.

She is very happy to know that her house will be completed within a few months. It not only reduces the financial burden, but also help Kalpana to feel proud be a house owner in the society.

loans.use: to complete the door, windows, plastering, flooring, and coloring the house; also complete the wiring with an electricity connection.

loans.name: Baktygul

texts.ru: Бактыгул, 50 лет, вдова, есть 3 детей. Бактыгул в качестве основного источника дохода для своей семьи на протяжении 20 лет занимается разведением скота и полеводством. Благодаря упорному труду на сегодняшний день Бактыгул имеет в хозяйстве 6 коров, 15 овец. На участке мерою 2,50 Га арендованной земли, выращивает картофель и люцерну. Вся деятельность приносит ежемесячную прибыль в сумме до 21,000 сом (KGS), этих средств не хватает на достойную жизнь Бактыгул и ее деток. Сделав вывод, что сельскохозяйственный бизнес рентабелен, Бактыгул обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 150,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота. Доходы от кредита Бактыгул планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение хозяйства, улучшение материального благосостояния семьи.
texts.en:
Baktygul is 50 years old, widowed, with three kids. As her main source of income, for 20 years she has been breeding livestock and cultivating plants. Thanks to her hard work, Baktygul now has six cows and 15 sheep. On the leased land lot of 2.5 ha she cultivates potatoes and lucerne. All of the activities provide a monthly profit of 21,000 som (KGS) which is not enough for her and the kids. 

Expecting a high profitability of agricultural activities, Baktygul turned to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 150,000 som (KGS) to buy livestock. She plans to invest the borrowed money to increase the livestock and improve her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: for buy more livestock in order to increase her income

loans.name: Selime

texts.en:
Selime is a widow and a mother of three. After her husband died, she was left without any money, so she had to sell lingerie in order to make a living. She made visits to her neighbours and sold it. Later on, the number of her customers increased. She learned how to make needle lace from one of her neighbours, and she also made and sold it. Her children grew up and married. Selime does not want to be a burden on her children, so she still makes towels with needle lace and sells them. With the help of this loan, she is planning to buy towels in bulk. Selime says that she can produce various kinds of towels this way. She wants to live a life without being a burden to anybody.

Translated from Turkish by Maya staff
_____________________________

Selime Hanım dul, üç çocuk annesi.  Eşi ölünce çocukları ile yalnız kalan Selime hanım çocuklarına bakabilmek (Eşinden maaş kalmamış)için işe çamaşır satmakla başlamış.  Dolaşarak çevresine tanıdıklara satmış.  Daha sonraları müşterileri artmış.  Bir komşusundan iğne oyası yapmayı öğrenmiş ve kazancını arttırabilmek için iğne oyasından çeyizlik eşyalar yapıp satmaya başlamış.  Çocukları büyüyüp hayatlarını kurmuşlar.  Yalnız yaşayan Selime Hanım çocuklarını yük olmamak için hala iğne oyası havlu kenarları yapıp satıyor.  Aldığı kredi ile toplu olarak havlu alacak.  Elinde havluları olursa müşteri beğenisine suna bileceğini vurguladı.  Kimseye muhtaç olmadan hayatını sürdürmeyi  istiyor.

loans.use: to buy towels in bulk

loans.name: Sumitra

texts.en:
Sumitra is a 51-year-old woman who lives in Falakata, West Bengal.  She did not receive a formal education in her young age due to a lack of money, but she can sign her name. She is married to Anil and he is engaged in agricultural activities.  Sumitra's daughter is married and her son earns his pocket money by rendering private teaching to the local children.

Their principal occupation is the cultivation of paddy rice and they depend upon this to generate income to cover their family’s various basic necessities. The harvest is sold in their region. Sumitra's husband is involved in the daily care and protection of the product. Sumitra also helps her husband in this business.

Sumitra is requesting a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) in order to purchase supplies such as fertilizer, compost and good quality paddy seeds. She will use them to provide the necessary care for their agribusiness.

Her goals are to be able to increase their production so that each season it will be greater than it had been in the previous one, and to improve her income day by day. 

She thanks her generous lenders.

loans.use: To purchase agricultural supplies for cultivating paddy rice.

loans.name: London Group

texts.en:
Veronika is in her early 30s, and is married with four children who are still in school. She has been running several businesses -- selling charcoal, running a salon, and running a retail shop -- for seven years now.  She works from 8am to 10pm daily and is able to make a very good monthly profit.

This will be Veronika's first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She will use this loan to buy sacks of charcoal for resale, salon products for her salon and to increase the retail shop inventory. She dreams of extending her businesses to be really big.

Veronika will share this loan with her loan group London, which consists of two people who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy sacks of charcoal for resale, salon products for her salon and to increase the retail shop inventory.

loans.name: Johnny Agustin

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Jaime Roldos se reúne cada 15 días en el cantón Jaramijo este lugar es conocido por sus hermosas playas, la mayoría de los habitantes son muy trabajadores y dedicados a las faenas del mar.
En este lugar vive don Johnny,  tiene 32 años de edad, es padre soltero de dos hijos de 13 y 11 años  de edad, ambos estudian en colegio, el vive con familiares.
El señor Johnny es carpintero naval y trabaja en una empresa que construye embarcaciones, él tiene que llevar sus propias herramientas razón por lo cual necesita de los créditos ya que así va comprando lo que necesita, el espera en un tiempo instalar su propio taller para construir dichas embarcaciones, también realiza arreglos por su cuenta lo cual le deja buenos ingresos aparte de su sueldo mensual.
Este crédito lo va utilizar en comprar herramientas para su trabajo. Lleva 3 ciclos en el Grupo de Crédito y le gusta porque con los créditos el puede sacar adelante su negocio. Sus sueños son tener un gran taller.
texts.en:
