Leslie es una mujer emprendedora, llena de ganas de superación, que ha luchado por salir adelante como comerciante, ella inicio como vendedora ambulante de ropa y zapatos, ha logrado surtirse de mercadería y poner en su casa de habitación una tienda, ella está muy agradecida por esa oportunidad que se le dio y con la cual pudo tener un negocio estable. 
En estos momentos, es una temporada de gran demanda de mercadería como ropa, zapatos y accesorios es por eso que Leslie ha recurrido a Kiva y MiCrédito para que se le brinde un financiamiento que le permita adquirir nueva y variada mercadería. Ella pretende seguir trabajando con préstamos para ir creciendo como comerciante, su sueño es tener una tienda en un centro comercial.
texts.en:
Leslie is an enterprising woman who is filled with a desire to do better. She has fought to get ahead as a trader. She started off as a street vendor, selling clothes and shoes. She has managed to stock up with more merchandise and open a shop in her home. She is very grateful for this loan opportunity, which allows her to stabilise her business.

This is currently the season for high demand for items such as clothes, shoes and accessories. Leslie has therefore come to Kiva and MiCrédito in order to take out a loan. She will use it to buy new and varied stock. Leslie plans to continue working with loans in order to expand her trade. Leslie’s dream is to own a shop in a shopping centre.

loans.use: to buy new and varied stock.

loans.name: Fanta's Group

texts.fr:
Créé le 22 Janvier 2003, ce banc villageois est composé de femmes qui habitent le même le village .Elles ont comme activité le petit commerce et sont très solidaires entre elles.

Madame Fanta, âgée de 31 ans (debout à l’extrême  droite avec une main levée), est l’emprunteuse vedette du groupe. Elle est mariée et mère de 02 filles et 01 garçon. Elle s’active dans la vente de chaussures et d’habillements.

Avec son nouveau prêt, elle compte acheter des habits d’une valeur de 200 000f et des chaussures d’une valeur de 250 000 pour le revendre en détails et payer un transport de 5000f.

Avec les bénéfices, elle compte faire de l’embouche ovine, s’occuper de ses enfants ‘habillements, scolarités nourriture……..)
texts.en:
This 'Banc Villageois' was created on 22nd January 2003 and its members all live in the same village.  They work in retail and are mutually very supportive.

Fanta (on the far right in the photo, with her hand raised) is thirty-one years old and the group representative.  She is married and has two daughters and one son.  She sells clothing and shoes.  Her loan will be used to buy 200,000 francs CFA of clothing and 250,000 francs CFA of shoes.  She will also need to pay 5,000 francs CFA for transportation.

Fanta plans to use her profits to start rearing sheep.  She will also pay for clothing, education and food for her children.

loans.use: to buy clothing and shoes, and pay for transport.

loans.name: Dienabou Karimou's Group

texts.fr:
Créé le 22 Janvier 2003, ce banc villageois est composé de femmes qui habitent le même le village .Elles ont comme activité le petit commerce et sont très solidaires entre elles.

Madame Diénabou, âgée de 42 ans (assise à l’extrême  droite avec une main levée), est l’emprunteuse vedette du groupe. Elle est mariée et mère de 03 filles et 04 garçons. Elle s’active dans la  restauration.

Avec son nouveau prêt, elle compte acheter 04 sacs de riz à 39000f, de l’huile raffinée à 12500f du café et du sucre d’un montant de 70 000f pour après préparation le revendre en détails.

Avec les bénéfices, elle compte assurer la scolarité de ses enfants et renforcer ses épargnes.
texts.en:
The 'Banc Villageois' was created on 22nd January 2003 and is made up of women who all live in the same village.  They all work in retail and are mutually very supportive.

Diénabou (sitting on the far right in the photo with her hand raised) is forty-two years old and represents the group.  She is married and has three daughters and four sons.  She runs a restaurant business.  Her loan will buy four sacks of rice for 39,000 francs CFA, refined oil for 12,500 francs CFA, and coffee and sugar for 70,000 francs CFA.  After preparation, she sells her food through her restaurant business.

Diénabou will use her profits to provide for her children's education and increase her savings.

loans.use: to buy rice, refined oil, coffee and sugar for her restaurant business.

loans.name: Fatoumata Manden's Group

texts.fr:
Créé le 22 Janvier 2003, ce banc villageois est composé de femmes qui habitent le même le village .Elles ont comme activité le petit commerce et sont très solidaires entre elles.

Madame Fatoumata, âgée de 35 ans (assise à l’extrême  droite avec une main levée), est l’emprunteuse vedette du groupe. Elle est mariée et mère de 02 fille et 03 garçon. Elle s’active dans la vente de patte d’arachide qu’elle revend en détails à Diarra

Avec son nouveau prêt, elle compte acheter 03 sacs d’arachide à 21000f le sac et payer un transport de 10 000f pour le revendre en détail après transformation

Avec les bénéfices, elle compte assurer la scolarité de ses enfants.
texts.en:
The 'Banc Villageois' was created on 22nd January 2003 and is made up of women who all live in the same village.  They all work in retail and are mutually very supportive.

Fatoumata (sitting on the far right in the photo with her hand raised) is thirty-five years old and represents the group.  She is married and has two daughters and three sons.  She sells peanut paste in Diarra.  Her loan will buy three sacks of peanuts for 21,000 francs CFA a sack, and pay 10,000 francs CFA for transport.  She will then process them and retail the paste.

Fatoumata will use her profits to provide for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy peanuts and pay for transport.

loans.name: Maria Del Transito

texts.es: Doña Maria de 56 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus dos hijos, ella se dedica al cultivo de granos básicos (maíz y frijol) desde hace 15 años, comercializa sus productos en los alrededores de la zona donde ella reside, la clienta  está solicitando un crédito para la compra de abono, herbicida, insecticidas y semillas y asi continuar con su trabajo ya que esa es su única fuente de ingresos y así darle a su familia una mejo calidad de vida.
texts.en: Maria, 56, lives in her own house with her husband and two children.  She grows basic grains (corn and beans) and has worked in agriculture for 15 years.  She sells her produce to neighboring communities.  The loan she is requesting is to buy fertilizer, herbicide, insecticides and seeds to continue her work since it is her ownly source of income.  Maria wants to give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, herbicide, insectides and seeds.

loans.name: Roberto De Jesus

texts.es: Don Roberto de 64 años de edad vive en casa propia con su compañera de vida, él se dedica al cultivo de granos básico y jocotes tiene 20 años de experiencia en la actividad agrícola, vende sus productos en los pueblos aledaños y con las ventas que realiza logra cubrir algunos gastos de su hogar, el cliente está solicitando un crédito para la compra de abono, herbicida, insecticidas, semillas, etc. para poder tener un buen cultivo y darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Roberto, 64, lives in his own house with his life partner.  He grows basic grains and plums, and has 20 years' experience in agriculture.  He sells his produce in neighboring villages and uses the income from sales to cover some of the household expenses. 

Roberto is requesting a loan to buy fertilizer, herbicide, insecticides, seeds, etc. to obtain a good crop and give his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, herbicide, insecticides, seeds, etc.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es: Margarita de 45 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus dos hijos, ella se dedica al cultivo de granos básicos y a la crianza de ganado lechero desde hace 15 años, cultiva en la época de invierno y vende sus productos en los alrededores de la zona donde ella reside, la clienta está solicitando un crédito para la compra de abono, herbicida, insecticidas, semillas, etc. y así poder tener mejores ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
Margarita, 45, lives in her own house with her husband and two children.  She has worked in agriculture for 15 years, growing basic grains and raising dairy cattle.  Her agricultural activity takes place in the winter and she sells her produce in neighboring communities.  

Margarita is requesting a loan to buy fertilizer, herbicide, insecticide, seeds, etc. to improve her income.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, herbicide, insecticides, seeds, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: El joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 22 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo,se dedica al cultivo de maíz desde hace 4 años, con las ventas que realiza logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, el joven vive en casa propia con su compañera de vida y su hijo de 3 mesas, el está solicitando un crédito para la compra de abono, herbicida, insecticidas, entre otros insumos para poder continuar con el cultivo ya que esa es su única fuente de trabajo e ingresos.
texts.en:
This young man's face is blurred because he is 22 years old and lives in a high risk area.  For four years he has been growing corn and using income from sales to cover some of his household expenses.  He lives in his own house with his life partner and three-month-old son.

He is requesting a loan to buy fertilizer, herbicide, insecticides and other supplies to continue his crop activity since it is his only source of income.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, herbicide, insecticides and other supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy metal sheets, bars, bricks and nails to continue building her house.

loans.name: Romulo

texts.pt:
Senhor Rómulo tem 40 anos de idade, vive maritalmente com a sua esposa, pai de 3 filhas, a mais velha frequentando ensino primário, e as últimas são gémeas e ainda não tem idade escolar, trabalha como sinalizador de via numa empresa ferro portuária, vive em casa própria em construção com a sua família a qual ele sustenta.
O montante financiado será aplicado para a compra de chapas, cimento, portas, para dar a continuidade a construção da sua casa.
No futuro pretende concluir a construção da sua casa e oficializar o casamento, e continuar com os estudos.
O seu maior desafio e da exiguidade de fundos dai que fará sempre empréstimos na hluvuku adsema de modo a realizar de forma célere os seus projectos.
texts.en:
Rómulo is 40 years old. He lives in a common-law marriage and has three daughters. The eldest one goes to primary school. The remaining two are twin sisters and are not of school age yet. He works as a signal operator for a railway company. He lives with his family, which he maintains, in a house he owns and that is still under construction.

The requested amount will be used to buy metal sheets, cement and doors in order to continue building his house.

In the future, he plans to finish building his house, make his marriage official, and continue with his studies.

His biggest challenge is the lack of funding, so he will always apply for loans from Hluvuku Adsema in order to realize all his projects in a prompt manner.

loans.use: to buy metal sheets, cement and doors to finish building his house.

loans.name: Jose Rodolfo

texts.es:
José es un joven de veinte y siete años de edad, que se ha abierto paso en la vida trabajando duro, al lado de su esposa y de su pequeño hijo de cinco años. Él se graduó de la carrera de contabilidad, en la actualidad trabaja como supervisor en una procesadora de café. A él le encanta ahorrar, gracias a sus ahorros ha logrado obtener una casa propia, la cual ha ido mejorando poco a poco. 
En estos momentos, necesita de la ayuda de Kiva junto a MiCrédito para comprar materiales y pagar la mano de obra de la construcción de un baño higiénico, dado que en su casa de habitación actualmente usan todavía letrina y esto contamina el suelo, además de afectar la salud de los sere humanos. Su gran sueño es poder ver a su hijo con una calidad de vida mejor a la que él tuvo de pequeño.
texts.en:
27-year-old José is a young man who has made headway by working hard, supported by his wife and his 5-year-old son. He received a degree in Accounting and is currently working as a supervisor for a company that processes coffee. He loves to save money, and thanks to his savings, he was able to buy his own house, which he has improved little by little.

He needs now help from Kiva and MiCrédito to buy materials and pay for labor to build a bathroom, since his family is still using a latrine, which pollutes the ground and has a negative impact on human health.

His biggest dream is to see his son enjoying better living conditions than the ones he experienced when he was a little boy.

loans.use: to buy materials and pay for labor to build a bathroom.

loans.name: Los Geranios Group

texts.es: “LOS GERANIOS”  es un grupo conformado por mujeres emprendedoras. Crecencia tiene 39 años de edad es conviviente con 02 hijos dependiente. Ella se dedica a la venta de gaseosas en su kiosco hace 10 años. Años atrás se dedicaba a la venta de frutas y sándwich. De esa manera puede apoyar a su esposo con los gastos de educación y alimentación. El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de una exhibidora. El grupo agradece a los inversionistas KIVA por el crédito brindado. Crecencia es la primera del lado derecho.
texts.en: 'Los Geranios' is a group made up of entrepreneurial women. Crecencia is 39 years old, is married and has 2 dependent children. For ten years she has been earning a living selling fizzy drinks in a kiosk. Years ago she sold fruits and sandwiches. In this way she can support her husband with the costs of education and food. The loan will be spent on buying a display case. The group is grateful to the Kiva investors for the loan given. Creencia is the first on the right.

loans.use: to buy a display case.

loans.name: Grupo Xojola Nuevo Group

texts.es:
Juana es una mujer de 41 años de edad, es feliz mente casada y tiene dos hijos de las edades entre 6 y 12 años, esta humilde familia vive en una comunidad de Nahualá.
Juana (la segunda del lado izquierdo de la fotografía) para poder adquirir sus ingresos para el sostenimiento de su amada familia se dedica a la venta de café, ella tiene diez años de realizar esta actividad.
Juana en estos días ya tiene unas parcelas de café cultivada que ahora ya necesitan de su mantenimiento, pero una de las dificultades que Juana tiene es que no cuenta con el capital suficiente para poder  comprar sus fertilizantes y pago de mano de obra, por tal razón solicita un préstamo junto a un grupo de personas que tiene las mismas necesidades.
Juana anhela poder comprar diez cuerdas de terreno para poder incrementar su cultivo.
texts.en:
Juana is a 41 year old woman. She is happily married and has two children aged between 6 and 12. This modest family lives in a community in Nahualá.
Juana (the second on the left of the photograph) makes a living selling coffee to be able to obtain the income to maintain her beloved family. She has been doing this for ten years.
These days Juana has some plots of land on which she grows coffee that now needs to be maintained, but one of the difficulties that Juana has is that she does not have enough money to buy fertilisers and to pay for labour. For this reason she is asking for a loan along with a group of people who have the same needs.
Juana hopes to be able to buy ten plots of land to be able to grow more.

loans.use: to buy fertiliser and pay for labour.

loans.name: Vuslat

texts.en:
Vuslat started having a stand by the sea 11 years ago because of financial problems. She is planning to continue this season. For eleven years she has spent all her money for her daughters' education. She thinks that now is the time to do some things for herself. She is planning to sell her handmade jewelry as well as ready made ones. 
Translated from Turkish by Maya staff

Vuslat Hanım on bir yıl önce  maddi sıkıntılarını aşmak için başladığı işine bu sezonda sahilde tezgah açarak devam edecek.On bir yıl içinde bu işten kazandığı ile kızlarını büyütüp okuttuğunu artık kendi için bir şeyler yapma zamanı geldiğini düşünüyor.Bu yılda hazır takıların yanında kendi yaptığı el işi takılarının da satışını yapacak.

loans.use: to buy more materials to make different types of jewelry.

loans.name: Pacanal L B, 1 Group

texts.es:
Santos (es el primero del lado derecho de la fotografía de camisa color rojo) es un humilde hombre de 60 años de edad, es soltero tiene dos hijos de las edades entre 16 y 19 años, ellos viven en una comunidad de Nahualá.
Para santos su familia es muy importante y para darles lo mejor se dedica a la venta de hojas de maxan que se utilizan para envolver alimentos en su país, este negocio lo tiene el desde hace 20 años.
Santos tiene la oportunidad de poder cultivar cosechar, y vender las hojas de maxan, por lo que para el esto representa la mayor parte de sus ingresos es por ello que ahora está solicitando un préstamo que lo invertirá en la compra de fertilizantes y pago de mano de obra para el mantenimiento de maxan.
El gran sueño de santos es poder incrementar su cultivo de maxan para mejorar us ingresos.
texts.en:
Santos (the first on the right on the photograph in the red top) is a modest man who is 60 years old. He is single and has two children between the ages of 16 and 19. They live in a community in Nahualá.
His family is very important to Santos and to give them the best he makes a living selling maxan leaves which are used to wrap food in his country. He has been doing this for 20 years.
Santos has the opportunity to be able to grow, collect and sell the maxan leaves and this represents the majority of his income. This is why he is now asking for a loan to buy fertiliser and to pay for labour to maintain the maxan.
His big dream is to be able to grow more maxan and improve his income.

loans.use: to buy fertiliser and to pay for labour.

loans.name: Reyes Elias

texts.es: Don Reyes de 49 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa y su hijo, se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y frijol desde hace 20 años, comercializa sus productos en los diferentes mercados que se encuentran cerca de su casa, con las ventas que realiza logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, el cliente está solicitando un crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, etc. y mejorar el terreno que muestra en la fotografía para poder continuar con su trabajo y tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en: Reyes is 49 years old and lives in his own home with his wife and child. For 20 years he has earned a living in agriculture, sewing corn and bean seeds. He sells his produce in the different markets close to his home. With his sales he manages to pay for some household expenses. He is asking for a loan to buy seeds, fertiliser, manure, pest control, etc. and to improve the land seen in this photograph to be able to continue his work and to have a better income.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilisers, manure, pest control, etc. and to improve.

loans.name: Francis

texts.en: Francis is a 38-year-old married man with three children aged 7 to 12 years. He lives in Masindi-Uganda where he operates a hardware shop as his main business. Francis does farming to generate supplementary income. He started the business to cater for the family's well-being. He hopes to educate his children to university and have a stable income. However, inadequate capital affects his business. Francis intends to use the loan facility to buy hardware materials like iron bars and iron sheets to sell.

loans.use: to buy hardware materials like iron bars and iron sheets to sell.

loans.name: Señor De La Misericordia De Surco Group

texts.es: El grupo “SEÑOR DE LA MISERICORDIA DE SURCO” es un grupo conformado por socios dedicados a la agricultura y comercio minorista. Efraín tiene 54 años de edad es casado con hijos independientes. El se dedica al cultivo de frutas y flores  desde joven. Y a la vez presta servicios de obrero. El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de fertilizantes para mujer la producción de sus frutas y verduras. El grupo agradece a los inversionistas KIVA por el crédito brindado. Efraín es la quinta persona del lado izquierdo viste camisa negra.
texts.en:
The group Señor de la Misericordia de Surco is formed by members who are dedicated to agriculture and retail trade. 

Efraín is 54 old and married with independent children. He has worked in growing fruits and flowers since he was young. He also works as a laborer. He will use this loan to buy fertilizers to improve the production of his fruits and vegetables. 

The group would like to thank the KIVA lenders for the loan they have provided. Efraín is the fifth person from the left in the black shirt.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes is a married woman. She has three children. She operates a farm where she grows rice. Her business is located in a fertile area. She describes her biggest business challenge to be fluctuating prices and high cost of farm inputs. She will use the KES 40,000 loan to buy fertilizer and pay labor costs. She hopes that in the future she will have a larger farm. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pay labor costs.

loans.name: Salihu Isyaka

texts.en:
Salihu Isyaka is a Babban Gona maize farmer from Dangashi Village. Salihu Isyaka joined Babban Gona to create a better life for his children. 

In the past, Salihu Isyaka suffered from poor yields that crippled his ability to purchase better inputs to improve his yield. Through Babban Gona’s input loan, Salihu Isyaka will have access to the best farm inputs in the market, such as fertilizers, herbicides, and improved seeds, which will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize per hectare, double the Nigerian national average of 14 bags. This will see him increase his household income considerably. 

Thanks to Babban Gona's support, Salihu Isyaka now has the opportunity to increase his yields and income and use his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to purchase improved farm inputs that will increase farmer’s yields.

loans.name: Şengül

texts.en:
Şengül is married and a mother of three. She was selling her homemade pasta in order to help her retired husband with the school expenses of their children. Last year she opened a stand by the sea. She says that this made her very happy, although she had been working till late hours at night. This also helped her become more socialized. 

This season she will be selling jewellery and ornaments. She also plans to make pasta and sell it to cafes to increase her income. With the help of the loan she is is planning to buy gifts and ornaments for her stand. 

Her dream is that her children have good educations.


Translated from Turkish by Maya staff
Şengül Hanım evli üç çocuk annesi. Emekli eşine destek olmak çocuklarını sıkıntı çekmeden okutabilmek için evde hamur işleri yaparak başladığı işine geçen yıl sahilde tezgah açarak devam etti. Bu işinin daha güzel olduğunu gece geç saatlere kadar çalışsa da kendisini mutlu ettiğini sosyalleştiğini söylüyor. Bu sezon da takı, hediyelik eşya satışı yaptığı tezgahının başında olacak. Aynı zaman da börek, poğaça ve çiğ börek yaparak çay bahçelerine verip gelirini arttırmayı düşünüyor. Aldığı kredi ile de tezgahına hediyelik eşyalar alacak. Hayali çocuklarının eğitimlerini tamamlaması.

loans.use: to buy gifts and ornaments for her stand.

loans.name: Baby Jean

texts.en:
Baby Jean runs a sari-sari (variety) store selling commodities like biscuits, canned goods, noodles, beverages, and toiletries. She is married with two young children. She has been running a store for a quite a few years now. 

Her husband earns a living by being a tricycle driver,and she needs additional funds to support her ongoing business. 

She is asking for a loan to buy assorted goods and gasoline. These will help boost the variety of stock so she can attract more buyers to her store. Thus, it will improve her income and help her be able to handle her finances. This will help her to feed her children and provide better shelter. 

Baby Jean is thankful for availing the loan and she is determined to manage it successfully for the welfare of her growing children.

loans.use: to buy assorted goods and gasoline.

loans.name: Peninah

texts.en:
Peninah is a married woman. She has one child. She describes herself as ambitious. 

Peninah operates a retail business where she sells shoes and cosmetics. She has been involved in this business for 3 years. Her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be less business premise. 

She will use the 40,000 KES loan to buy more stocks of shoes and cosmetics for the store. Her business goal is to have a wholesale shop within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will educate her children and expand her business to other towns. 

This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of shoes and cosmetics for her store.

loans.name: Hussaini

texts.en:
Hussaini is a Babban Gona maize farmer from Danjuma Village. Hussaini joined Babban Gona to create a better life for his children. 

In the past, Hussaini suffered from poor yields that crippled his ability to purchase better inputs to improve his yield. Through Babban Gona’s input loan, Hussaini will have access to the best farm inputs in the market, such as fertilizers, herbicides, and improved seeds, which will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize per hectare, double the Nigerian national average of 14 bags. This will see him increase his household income considerably. 

Thanks to Babban Gona's support, Hussaini now has the opportunity to increase his yields and income and use his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to purchase improved farm inputs that will increase his yields.

loans.name: Elmer Antonio

texts.es: Elmer vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, el se dedica al cultivo de maíz y maicillo desde hace 10 años y vende sus productos en los alrededores de la zona ya tiene clientes establecidos por su buen producto, con las ganancias que obtiene puede salir adelante, el está solicitando un crédito para la compra de insumos agrícolas como: abono, herbicida, insecticidas y semillas, para poder tener un buen cultivo y darle a su familia una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en: Elmer lives in his own house with his family. He has worked growing corn and sorghum for the past 10 years and sells his products in the nearby areas in the zone. He has established customers because of his good product. With the earnings that he gets, he can get ahead. He is asking for a loan to purchase agricultural supplies such as manure, herbicide, insecticide, and seeds, to be able to have a good crop and give his family better economic stability.

loans.use: to purchase manure, herbicide, insecticide and seeds.

loans.name: Domingo

texts.es: Domingo de 60 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa y su dos hijos, él se dedica al cultivo de maíz y maicillo desde hace 20 años, vende sus productos en los alrededores de la zona donde el reside y ya tiene clientes establecidos, el está solicitando un crédito para la compra de abono, herbicida, insecticidas,  controles de plagas para poder tener una buena cosecha y así poder tener mejores ingresos económicos.
texts.en: Domingo, 60 years old, lives in his own house with his wife and their two children. He has worked growing corn and sorghum for 20 years. He sells his products in the areas near where he lives and he has established customers. He is asking for a loan to purchase manure, herbicides, insecticides, and pesticides to have a good harvest and, in this way, be able to have more income.

loans.use: to purchase manure, herbicides, insecticides, and pesticides.

loans.name: Yoxaja 2 Group

texts.es:
Micaela (la primera del lado derecho de la fotografía) es una mujer de 28 años de edad, es soltera tiene una linda familia de dos hijos de las edades entre 2 y  8 años, esta humilde familia vive en una comunidad de Nahuala.
Micaela con el afán de generar sus ingresos y sacar adelante a su familia, se dedica  a la venta de café, esta labor lo realiza ella desde hace seis años.
A Micaela es estos días le preocupa mucho  su cultivo de café, pues hasta estos días ella no ha logrado comprar sus fertilizantes y pagar la mano de obra, por tal razón se unió a un grupo de señoras para poder solicitar juntas un préstamo que los ayude a cubrir sus necesidades.
El gran sueño de Micaela es poder incrementar su cultivo de café para mejorar sus ingresos y así   darles una buena calidad de vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Micaela (the first on the right in the photo) is a 28-year-old woman; she is single and has a lovely family of two children, ages 2 and 8. This humble family lives in a community of Nahuala.

Micaela, with the desire to earn income and get her family ahead, works selling coffee. She has done this work for the past six years. These days, Micaela is very worried about her coffee crop, since she hasn't been able to purchase her fertilizers and pay labor costs. So, she joined a group of women to be able to ask for a loan together that will help them cover their needs.

Micaela's great dream is to be able to increase her coffee production to increase her income and in this way give her children a good quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and pay labor costs.

loans.name: Eduardo Antonio

texts.es: Eduardo de 32 años de edad vive en casa propia con su tres hijos, el se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y frijol desde hace mas de 20 años, gracias a su trabajo es como el ha podido salir adelante con su familia, el esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de los insumos necesarios para tener una buena cosecha como: fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, herbicidas, entre otras cosas ya que esa es su única fuente de trabajo e ingresos.
texts.en: Eduardo, 32 years old, lives in his own house with his three children. He has worked in agriculture, growing corn and beans for more than 20 years. Thanks to his work, he has been able to get ahead with his family. He is asking for a loan to purchase the necessary supplies to have a good harvest, such as fertilizers, manure, pesticides, herbicides, and other things, since it is his only source of work and income.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, manure, pesticides, herbicides, and more.

loans.name: Reyna Del Rosario

texts.es: Reyna de 33 años de edad vive en casa propia con sus cinco hijos,  ella se dedica al cultivo de maíz y frijol, tiene 8 años de experiencia en la agricultura e inicio con capital propio, con lo que obtiene de sus ganancias logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de abono, herbicida, insecticidas, semillas, etc. y así poder tener mejores ingresos económicos.
texts.en: Reyna, 33 years old, lives in her own house with her five children. She works growing corn and beans. She has 8 years of experience in agriculture and began with her own capital. With what she gets with her earnings, she manages to cover some of the household expenses. She is asking for a loan to purchase manure, herbicides, insecticides, seeds, etc. and, so, to be able to have more income.

loans.use: to purchase manure, herbicides, insecticides, seeds, etc.

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel is a 33-year-old married man with 4 children living in Masindi, Uganda. He is a hardworking man who buys produce such as maize,beans and groundnuts among others and sells them in order to get income. 

He runs a retail shop that sells general merchandise like sugar, soap, salt to get extra income. He hopes to educate his children to university though he faces a challenges of fluctuation of prices and seasonality issues. 

He is requesting a loan facility to buy produce such as maize and beans to sell.

loans.use: to buy produce such as maize and beans to sell.

loans.name: Julio

texts.es:
Julio es un hombre amable  y generosos tiene 30 años de edad, es soltero tiene un hijo de ocho años, ellos viven en una comunidad de Xojola.
Julio para darle lo mejor a su familia se dedica dese hace seis años a la venta de banano, gracias a esta labor él ha sacado adelante a su familia. 
Julio desde hace algunos días se apuesto a ver las necesidades primordiales de su familia, y se ha dado cuenta que una de las necesidades  es la compra de una cuerda de terreno donde el pudiera cultivar, es por ello que ahora ha considerado que es una  buena oportunidad poder comprar una cuerda de terreno con cultivo de banano que le están ofreciendo, pero una de las dificultades que él tiene es que no cuenta con el resto de capital por tal razón solicita un préstamo para poder ajustar el dinero y realizar la compra.
El gran sueño de Julio es poder construir otra casa de block, para darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Julio is a friendly and generous man, 30 years old. He is single and has an eight-year-old child. They live in a community of Xojola. Julio, to give his family the best, has worked for the past six years selling bananas. Thanks to this work, he has gotten his family ahead.

Julio, a few days ago, challenged himself to see his family's basic needs, and has realized that one of the needs is the purchase of a plot of land he can cultivate. For this, he now has considered that it a good opportunity to be able to purchase a plot of land with banana plants that is being offered, but one of the difficulties that he has is that he doesn't have the rest of the capital, so he has asked for a loan to be able to combine with his money and make the purchase.

Julio's big dream is to be able to build another concrete-block house, to give his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase a plot of land with banana plants.

loans.name: Astrid Beatriz

texts.es: Astrid de 40 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus dos hijos, ella se dedica al cultivo de maíz y maicillo tiene 20 años de dedicarse a esa actividad con la cual ha podido solventar los gastos que se le han presentando, ya que esa es su única fuente de trabajo ha tomado la decisión de solicitar un crédito para la compra de los insumos necesarios e invertir en sus cultivos comprando semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, entre otros y así poder tener mejores ganancias para una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Astrid, 40 years old, lives in her own house with her husband and their two children. She works growing corn and sorghum and has done this work for 20 years. With this, she has been able to cover the expenses that have come up, since it is her only source of work. She has decided to ask for a loan to purchase the necessary supplies and invest in her crops, buying seeds, fertilizers, manure, and more, and in this way be able to have better earnings for a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizer, manure, and more.

loans.name: Juan Pablino

texts.es: Don Juan de 71 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa y sus dos hijos, el se dedica al cultivo de maíz y frijol, desde muy joven aprendió ese trabajo y es así como ha podido salir adelante, tiene 40 años de trabajar en la tierra con sus cultivos, comercializa en los pueblos aledaños y ya tiene clientes establecidos, el está solicitando un crédito para la compra de abono, herbicida, insecticidas y semillas etc. Y así tener una mejor calidad de vida para su familia.
texts.en: Juan, 71 years old, lives in his own house with his wife and their two children. He works growing corn and beans. He learned this work when he was very young and this is how he has managed to get ahead. He has been working the land with his crops for 40 years. He sells them in the nearby towns and has established customers. He is asking for a loan to purchase manure, herbicides, insecticides, and seeds, etc. and, so, to have a better quality of life for his family.

loans.use: to purchase manure, herbicides, insecticides, seeds, etc.

loans.name: Karambu

texts.en:
Karambu is a married woman. She has 4 children. She describes herself as motivated. She operates a retail business where she sells cereals. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be changes in prices. 

She will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy more stock of cereals. Her business goal is to be a distributor of cereals to schools around her area within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will give her children the best education using profits from the business. 

This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of cereals.

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es: Don Francisco de 64 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa y sus dos hijas,  él se dedica al cultivo de granos básicos y jocotes desde hace 40 años, su esposa y su hija mayor le ayudan en el trabajo agrícola, vende sus productos en los alrededores de la zona donde reside, gracias a sus ventas logar solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, el está solicitando un crédito para la compra de abono, herbicida, insecticidas, semillas etc. para tener un buen cultivo y así tener mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en: Francisco, 64 years old, lives in his own house with his wife and their two daughters. He has worked growing basic grains and jocote fruit for the past 40 years. His wife and older daughter help him with the agricultural work. He sells his products in the areas near where he lives. Thanks to his sales, he manages to cover some of the household expenses. He is asking for a loan to purchase manure, herbicides, insecticides, seeds, etc. to have good crops and, in this way, have better living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase manure, herbicides, insecticides, seeds, etc.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles runs a retail shop in the town of Masindi, Uganda. He is responsible for taking care of 3 children. 

He started the business to have a source of income that can enable him look after his family with ease. He wishes to educate his children at good schools. However inadequate capital is a great challenge to his dream. 

He is requesting a loan to buy general merchandise to sell like salt, soap and sugar among other items.

loans.use: to buy general merchandise like salt, soap and sugar to sell.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is single with 5 children and three attend school. She takes care of one additional family member. 

She operates a boutique selling second hand clothes. She has been in this business for the last 13 years. She gets additional income from rental houses. She works six days a week. 

She has requested a loan from MCDT – SACCO to buy bales of used clothes. Her major challenge includes seasonality of used clothes. Her goal and aspiration is to build more rental houses. 

She lives in her own house and the family has access to piped water and electricity. Her major monthly expenses include school fees, feeding the family and medication.

loans.use: To buy bales of used clothes.

loans.name: Aliyu	Alhaji

texts.en:
Aliyu	Alhaji  is a Babban Gona maize farmer from Ahmadu Village. Aliyu Alhaji joined Babban Gona to create a better life for his children. 

In the past, Aliyu Alhaji suffered from poor yields that crippled his ability to purchase better inputs to improve his yield. Through Babban Gona’s input loan, Aliyu Alhaji will have access to the best farm inputs in the market such as fertilizers, herbicides and improved seeds that will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize/ hectare, double the Nigerian national average of 14 bags. This will see him increase his household income considerably. 

Thanks to Babban Gona's support, Aliyu Alhaji now has the opportunity to increase his yields and income and use his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: To purchase improved farm inputs that will increase his yields.

loans.name: Eti

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! This is Eti, one of Ruma's agents. Eti lives in  Cianjur, located in West Java, around 2 hours and 30 minutes from Jakarta, the capital city of Indonesia. Eti's husband passed away few years ago and her child is already married, so right now, Eti lives alone by herself. 

Eti is a tailor and right now she is also selling mobile airtime credits to her community. She decided to join Ruma because she wants to expand her business in technology. Her community sees her as an informative, kind and trusted mobile provider. 

As the business grows, Eti needs additional capital and is seeking a working capital loan from Kiva. She will use the capital to provide more mobile airtime credits to her community. Eti’s goal towards Ruma in the near future is to serve as an e-commerce business for her community, Ruma’s latest product called Mapan, so later on her community can have access to high quality products with lower prices. 

Eti is the one who is seen in the photo. She is thankful for your kind support.

loans.use: to give her village community members better access to communication service by selling mobile airtime credits.

loans.name: Sadiye

texts.en:
Sadiye is married and a mother of three. All her  children are educated. In order to use her time, she bought a stand last season and sold ornaments and gifts. She is planning to continue with it because she says that working keeps her alive and she does not want to stay at home doing nothing. She says that she likes working  by the sea because the seaside is very lively in summers and also she feels good making her own money. 

With the help of the third loan she is planning to purchase materials as gifts.


Translated from Turkish by Maya staff
Sadiye hanım evli üç çocuk annesi. Çocuklarını okutmuş. Boş durmamak için geçen sezon sahilde hediyelik eşya satışına başlamıştı. Bu sezon da aynı işine devam edecek. Çalışmanın kendisini zinde tuttuğunu, boş durmayı sevmediğini söylüyor. Sahilde bulunmaktan da zevk alıyor yaz ayları daha renkli geçtiğini, kendi parasını kazanmanın çok güzel olduğunu vurguladı. Aldığı üçüncü kredi ile hediyelik eşya hazır takılar alıp satacak.

loans.use: to buy materials and gifts to sell.

loans.name: Iliya

texts.en:
Iliya is a Babban Gona maize farmer from Bamiyayi Village. Iliya joined Babban Gona to create a better life for his children. 

In the past, Iliya suffered from poor yields that crippled his ability to feed his family and children. Through Babban Gona’s input loan, Iliya will have access to the best farm inputs in the market such as fertilizers, herbicides and improved seeds that will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize/ hectare, double the Nigerian national average of 14 bags. This will see him increase his household income considerably. 

Thanks to Babban Gona's support, Iliya now has the opportunity to increase his yields and income and use his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: To purchase improved farm inputs that will increase his yields

loans.name: Samaila

texts.en:
Samaila is a Babban Gona farmer from Yalwan Pegi Village. Samaila joined Babban Gona to become a better farmer. 

Through Babban Gona’s input loan, Samaila will have access to top-of-the-range farm inputs such as fertilizers, herbicides, and improved seeds. This loan will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize per hectare, double the 14 bags per hectare earned by the average Nigerian smallholder maize farmer. 

With the opportunity to earn high yields and increase his net income, Samaila would like to use his extra earnings to ensure that all his children get a post secondary education.

loans.use: To purchase improved farm inputs that will increase his yields.

loans.name: Samaila Nigger

texts.en:
Samaila Nigger is a Babban Gona maize farmer from Gangarida Village. Samaila Nigger joined Babban Gona to expand his farm and grow his agricultural business. 

Through Babban Gona’s input loan, Samaila Nigger will have access to the best farm inputs in the market such as fertilisers, herbicides and improved seeds that will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize/ hectare, double the Nigerian national average of 14 bags. This will see him increase his household income considerably. 

Thanks to Babban Gona's support, Samaila Nigger now has the opportunity to increase his yields and income and use his extra earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: To purchase improved farm inputs that will increase his yields.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase different types of hair styles for her business.

loans.name: Cornelio

texts.en:
Cornelio is a fisherman. He is a 41-year-old married man with eight children from Talibon, Bohol. His oldest child is 19 and the youngest is 1 year old. He has been fishing for more than 10 years now.  

He has requested a loan in the amount of 17,000 PHP to buy materials like a flashlight, battery, and fuel for the motor boat. These would help improve the ongoing catch and enable him to sell more fish. This would allow him to provide his family with nutritious meals and continue to send his children to school. 

Cornelio hopes to improve his fishing livelihood to improve his status of living.

loans.use: to buy materials like a flash light, battery, and fuel for the motorboat.

loans.name: Aynur

texts.en:
Aynur is retired, divorced and living with her daughter. After her divorce she moved to a new neighbourhood and started making  jewelry in order to help her daughter with her education. She has been selling her jewellery on stands near the sea for the last 12 years. Although winter sales are low, she makes good money in  summers. She works until late at night but she does not complain. She says that after boring winters she feels lively in summer.

With the help of her third loan she is planning to buy materials for her jewelry.

Translated from Turkish by Maya staff
Aynur hanım emekli, eşinden ayrıldıktan sonra yerleştiği semtte kızını okutabilmek için takı işine başlamış. On iki yıldır sahilde tezgah açarak takı yapıp satıyor. Kışın az satış yaptığını ama sezon boyunca çok iyi kazandığını söylüyor. Gece geç saatlere kadar tezgahında çalışıyor. Şikayetçi olmadığını sıkıcı geçen kış aylarından sonra hayatının renklendiğini söylüyor. Aldığı üçüncü kredi ile takı malzemeleri alacak.

loans.use: to buy materials to make jewelry to sell.

loans.name: Doris

texts.en:
Doris is a married woman. She has two children. She describes herself as joyful. 

She operates a retail business where she sells cereals. She has been involved in this business for four years. Her primary customers are locals. 

She describes her biggest business challenge as insufficient working capital. She will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy more stock of cereals. She will use the profits to pay school fees for her children. 

Her business goal is to have a big cereals store within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will educate her children. 

This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of cereals.

loans.name: Inusa

texts.en:
Inusa is a Babban Gona farmer from  Bamiyayi Village. Inusa joined Babban Gona to become a better farmer. 

Through Babban Gona’s input loan, Inusa will have access to top-of-the-range farm inputs such as fertilizers, herbicides, and improved seeds. This loan will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize per hectare, double the 14 bags per hectare earned by the average Nigerian smallholder maize farmer. 

With the opportunity to earn high yields and increase his net income, Inusa would like to use his extra earnings to ensure that all his children get a post secondary education.

loans.use: To purchase improved farm inputs that will increase farm yields.

loans.name: Nevin

texts.en:
Nevin is married and a mother of two. 

In order to make money on her own and to help the family budget, she started  to sell tülbent (a fine muslin, also called cheesecloth), which is highly used in her region. She also became a representative of Biobellinda, selling cleaning products.  

With the help of her loan she is planning to buy tülbent. She will sell her cleaning products from the catalog. Her dream is to own a stand in the bazaar. She wants to support her children with the money she makes.
 
Translated from Turkish by Maya staff
Nevin Hanım evli, iki çocuk annesi. Ailesine maddi katkı sağlamak ve kendi parasını kazanmak için bir şeyler yapmaya karar vermiş. Çevresini de göz önüne alarak tülbent satmaya ve Biobellinda temizlik ürünleri  pazarlamaya karar vermiş. Aldığı kredi  ile Tülbent alacak. Temizlik ürünlerini de katologdan sipariş üzerine satacak. Hayali ileride pazarda tezgah açmak. Kendi parasını kazanırsa çocuklarına destek olabileceğini düşünüyor.

loans.use: to buy tülbent.

loans.name: Abduholik

texts.ru:
Абдухолик мужчина 40 лет, женат, счастливый отец троих детей. Он родился в сельской местности, с детства приучен к труду. У Абдухолика было 5 сестер, он был самым старшим, поэтому должен был помогать отцу зарабатывать и содержать семью. Абдухолик в 20 лет женился, сейчас у него трое прекрасных детей. Он живет с родителями, ухаживает за ними. Он занимается животноводством, у него в стаде 4 коровы и 7 баранов. Молоко, полученное от коров, жена Абдухолика продает на рынке. Баранов же Абдухолик  после откормки продает. К тому же Абдухолик подрабатывает и сантехником, устанавливает раковины и нагревателя воды в ванных помещениях.
Абдухолик обратился в МДО Арванд за получением кредита. Он хочет установить пластиковые окна дома. Вот уже который год зима очень холодная. В этом году его мать и дети сильно заболели, на лечение ушло много денег. Поэтому Абдухолик решил установить пластиковые окна, которые будут защищать его дом и семью от жары и холода. Абдухолик надеется, что он получит кредит и сможет осуществить свою мечту. Он благодарит за поддержку и доверие.
texts.en:
Abduholik is 40 and married and the happy father of three children. He was born in a rural region and taught to work from a young age. He had five sisters and was the oldest, therefore he had to help his father earn a living to support his family. He got married when he was 20 and now has three wonderful children. He lives with his parents and takes care of them. He works in animal husbandry and currently has four cows and seven rams. His wife sells the milk from the cows at the market, and the rams he fattens then resells. He also works a bit as a plumber, installing sinks and water heaters in bathrooms.

Abduholik has approached Arvand for a loan because he wants to install plastic windows in his house. The past winter was very cold and his mother and children got very sick, and it cost a lot of money to pay for their medical care. Therefore he has decided to install plastic windows, which will protect his home and family from the heat and cold. He hopes that he will receive this loan and will be able to achieve his goal. He thanks you for your support and trust.

loans.use: to buy plastic windows

loans.name: Gulchehra

texts.en:
Gulchehra is a generous woman. She was born in the northern part of Tajikistan in 1970. She is living in small city with her family. She is married and has children. 

She is an agrarian. She plants vegetables and cereal at her yard. This year she planted potatoes and carrots and awaits a good harvest. She needs to buy fertilizer and natural chemicals to take care of her land and plantings. She requests a loan from Kiva and IMON to buy fertilizer and natural chemicals. 

She hopes to be supported by Kiva lenders. This business is her source of income that provides her family with food and clothing.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and natural chemicals to take care of her land and plantings.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a married woman. She has give children. She operates a farm where she grows rice. Her primary customers are locals. 

She describes her biggest business challenge to be price fluctuations. She will use the Kes 40,000 loan to buy farm inputs. She hopes that in the future, she will improve her living standards and pay school fees for her children. 

This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs

loans.name: Haseena

texts.en:
Haseena has successfully built her business of animal sales with the support of Kashf Foundation and Kiva. By now she has attained a good number of customers and makes a good amount of income to contribute in the family income. 

Previously, with the help of Kiva, she was able to expand her business. Now she has applied for a loan of 35,000 PKR to purchase more animals to increase her sales to gain more profits.

loans.use: to purchase more animals to increase her sales to gain more profits.

loans.name: Sobia

texts.en:
Sobia  is a 36-year-old married woman. She does the work of hand embroidery along with her husband, who is also shown in the photo. She makes beautiful patterns for the people of her community. Her designs are much in demand and she has managed to consolidate a clientele that allows her to contribute to the expenses of her home. 

To help her to continue her operations, she has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR  to buy spools of threads in different colors and packs of beads, sequins and stones for embellishment. This will allow her to cater to more customers consistently. 

She is hopeful to increase in her income by targeting more customers. She dreams for her bright future and desires to build her own house.

loans.use: to buy spools of threads in different colors and packs of beads, sequins and stones for  embellishment.

loans.name: Gulnaz

texts.en:
Gulnaz is a happily married woman. Some years ago, she decided to support her family by starting a business of tailoring at her home as her husband's income was barely enough to meet their day-to-day expenses. 

Gulnaz is popularly known in her area for her skill in stitching. However, due to a shortage of raw materials, she is facing difficulty in meeting daily expenses related to her business. Therefore, she has requested for a loan of PKR 450,00. With the requested loan, she wants  to purchase stitching materials, such as threads of different colors, laces, zippers, and cloth to stitch up more dresses on time to generate a healthy income for her family.

loans.use: to purchase stitching materials, such as threads of different colors, laces, zippers, and cloth to stitch up more dresses on time

loans.name: Garba

texts.en: Garba is a Babban Gona farmer from Yalwan Pegi Vilage. Garba joined Babban Gona to become a better farmer. Through Babban Gona’s input loan, Garba will have access to top-of-the-range farm inputs such as fertilizers, herbicides, and improved seeds. This loan will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize per hectare, double the 14 bags per hectare earned by the average Nigerian smallholder maize farmer. With the opportunity to earn high yields and increase his net income, Garba would like to use his extra earnings to ensure that all his children get a post-secondary education.

loans.use: to purchase improved farm inputs that will increase his yields

loans.name: Asmat

texts.en:
Asmat is a hard-working woman who has four children. She has been providing the service of stitching clothes in her locality. She is quite popular for her skills in stitching. 

Asmat’s work brought the family out of a financial crisis that they were facing when she started working. Over the years, she has established a good clientele. Asmat has requested for a loan amount of 50,000 PKR. She intends to use this loan to purchase a new stitching machine with some spools of threads and laces for meeting the demands of her customers consistently. She aspires to save money for their prosperous future.

loans.use: to purchase a new stitching machine with some spools of threads and laces for meeting the demands of her customers consistently.

loans.name: Aamina

texts.en:
Aamina is a vigorous 51-year-old lady and a mother of three children. She provides tents and associated services on special occasions such as weddings.  She assists her clients by providing arrangements for chairs, tents, and crockery. 

To help her continue operating her business, she is requesting a loan of 45,000 Pakistani rupees (PKR) to purchase more tents and chairs so she can serve more customers. In addition to repaying the loan, she will use part of the revenues to deal with personal expenses and increase her business capital.

loans.use: to purchase more tents and chairs so she can serve more customers.

loans.name: San Martin Group

texts.es: El grupo “SAN MARTIN” está conformada por clientes dedicados al comercio minorista. Siveria tiene 48 años de edad es casada con 03 hijos independientes. Ella se dedica a la venta de comida hace 20 años. El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de nuevos utensilios olla vajillas y cubiertos para su negocio. El grupo agradece a los inversionistas KIVA por el crédito brindado. Siveria es la que viste chompa de color beige con cuellos camisero
texts.en:
The San Martin group is made up of members who work in retail commerce. Siveria, 48 years old, is married and has three children who are independent. 

For twenty years now, Siveria  has been selling meals that she prepares. She will use this loan to buy new utensils, pots and pans, dishes and cutlery for her business.

The group is grateful to Kiva lenders for the loan assistance. In the photo, Siveria is wearing a brown, v-neck pullover.

loans.use: to buy new utensils for food preparation.

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida is a 47-year-old married mother of four children. Five months ago, she decided to start her small business inside her house with the aim of developing it in the future to become a wide convenience store.

Aida sells diversified products in small quantities. She sells chips, juice, biscuits, shampoo, soap, and cleaning detergents. She took this step in order to help her husband in covering their family's increasing living needs, and is working hard to develop it as much as she can.

Unfortunately, Aida started her current business with a very small capital. Developing her business is very hard for her, especially since her income combined with her husband's is barely enough to cover their family's increasing living needs. For this reason, Aida is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua, to increase her business merchandise with summer beverages and special offer products.

She hopes that in the future she can make her dream of expanding and developing her business come true.

loans.use: to increase her business merchandise with summer beverages and special offer products.

loans.name: Señor De Los Milagros De Ate Group

texts.es: Son 6 personas responsables de distintas actividades comerciales  todos ellos residen en el distrito de  ATE. Así son los integrantes del grupo comunal “SEÑOR DE LOS MILAGROS DE ATE” una de ellas es la Sra. Raquel de 53 años de edad con un hijo, la Sra. Raquel se dedica ya hace 8  años al negocio de costura, en su propio domicilio todos los días,  la Sra. Raquel  nos cuenta que ha llegado a fidelizar a sus clientes lo cual a generado ingresos  para cubrir los gastos de su casa,  En el futuro le gustaría ampliar más su negocio para poder confeccionar sus propios productos y ofrecerlo a sus clientes y así tener mayores ingresos económicos. Con el préstamo otorgado lo invertirá  en comprar más materiales de costura y poder tener más ingresos. La Sra. Raquel  es la primera del lado izquierdo se le distingue por su polo de color rosado con diseños de color negro y una cartera azul. A la vez se despide con un abraso a Kiva y   diciéndoles que cumplirá todas su metas propuestas.
texts.en:
The “SEÑOR DE LOS MILAGROS DE ATE” communal bank is made up of six people who have different occupations. They all live in the ATE district.

One of the members is Raquel who is 53 years old and has one son. For the past eight years Raquel has been working as a seamstress every day out of her own home. She tells us that she has been able to gain a steady clientele which has generated income to cover her household expenses. In the future she would like to expand her business by creating her own products for her clients thereby increasing her income. 

She will invest the proceeds from the loan in buying more sewing materials so she can increase her income.

Raquel is the first one on the left and is wearing a pink polo shirt with black designs and is carrying a blue purse. She sends Kiva a hug and says that she promises to make all of her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy sewing materials.

loans.name: Gülcan

texts.en:
Gülcan is married and has three daughters. After primary school, her parents did not send her to school so she started working in a hair saloon. Now she owns her own saloon. 

With the help of her second loan she is planning to buy necessary utensils for her saloon.  She wants her utensils and materials ready before a busy summer. 

Her dream is that her daughters successfully complete their education and that she opens a beauty saloon on her own.

Translated from Turkish by Maya staff
Gülcan Hanım evli üç kız annesi. İlkokuldan sonra ailesi tarafından okula gönderilmeyince bir kuaförün yanında başladığı mesleğine kendine ait dükkanın da devam ediyor. Aldığı ikinci kredi ile kuaför malzemeleri alacak. Yaz sezonu yoğun geçtiğinden elinde toplu malzemeleri olsun istiyor. Kızlarının eğitimlerini tamamlamasını ve kendine bir güzellik salonu açmak istiyor.

loans.use: to buy necessary utensils for her saloon

loans.name: Ika

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! This is Ika, one of Ruma's agents. Ika lives in Cianjur, located in West Java, around 2 hours and 30 minutes from Jakarta, the capital city of Indonesia. She lives there with her husband and her only child. Ika owns a stall that sells mobile airtime credits to her community. She decided to join Ruma because she already heard before that Ruma has the best service and system. Her community sees her as an informative and trusted mobile provider. 

As the business grows, Ika needs additional capital and is seeking a working capital loan from Kiva. She will use the capital to provide more mobile airtime credits to her community. 

Ika’s goal with Ruma in the near future is to serve as an e-commerce business for her community, with Ruma’s latest product called Mapan, so later on, her community can have access to better products with lower prices. 

As seen in the photo, Ika is the one who is sitting in her own stall, holding her child. She is thankful for your kind support.

loans.use: to process more prepaid mobile airtime purchases for members of her village community.

loans.name: Zareena

texts.en:
Zareena has successfully built her business of animal sales with the support of Kashf Foundation and Kiva. Now she has attained a good number of customers and makes a good amount of income to contribute in the family income. She is motivated to provide her family with a better standard of living. 

Previously, with the help of Kiva, she was able to expand her business. 

Now she has applied a loan of 30,000 PKR to purchase more animals to increase her sales to earn a good amount of income.

loans.use: to purchase more animals to increase her sales to earn a good amount of income.

loans.name: Evi

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! We’d like you to meet one of Ruma's agents, Evi. Evi lives in East Bandung, located in West Java, about three hours drive from Jakarta, the capital city of Indonesia. Evi is a young woman who owns a stall that sells daily consumer products and mobile airtime credits for her community. Her community sees Evi as a friendly and informative mobile service provider.

As the business grows, Evi needs additional capital and is seeking a working capital loan from Kiva. She will use the capital to provide more mobile airtime credits to her community, so her community can stay connected with their loved ones, no matter how far they are apart. Evi’s goal towards Ruma in the near future is to serve as an e-commerce business for her community, via Ruma’s latest product called Mapan, so her community later can have access to better products with better prices. Evi is the one who is sitting in her own stall. She is thankful for your kind support.

loans.use: to process more prepaid mobile airtime purchases and electricity bill payments for members of her local community.

loans.name: Annet

texts.en:
Annet is a permanent resident of Kawempe. She is a married woman with three children. She operates a cosmetics and salon business within her area of residence. This business is her main source of income in providing for her family needs and paying school fees for the children.

Annet wants to expand and boost her business by borrowing UGX 2,000,000 to buy weaves, hair oil and cosmetics. She is a first time borrower. She has got high a number of customers, and she needs more commodities to meet their demands.

Annet's future is promising and she appreciates Ugafode for their support.

loans.use: to buy weaves, hair oil and cosmetics.

loans.name: Manzoora

texts.en:
Manzoora  is 47 years old, a married woman. She is a mother of three children. 

She has been doing a business of animal purchase and sales for many years. She wants to earns a good amount of income for meeting her household activities.  

Now she has requested a loan of 50,000 PKR. She wants to use this loan amount  to purchase more cattle for reselling in the market. 

She desires of improving her standard of living thorough all her efforts.

loans.use: to purchase more cattle for reselling in the market

loans.name: Dayyabu

texts.en:
Dayyabu is a Babban Gona maize farmer from Bamiyayi Village. Dayyabu joined Babban Gona to expand his farm and grow his agricultural business. 

Through Babban Gona’s input loan, Dayyabu will have access to the best farm inputs in the market such as fertilizer, herbicides and improved seeds that will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize/ hectare, double the Nigerian national average of 14 bags. This will see him increase his household income considerably. 

Thanks to Babban Gona's support, Dayyabu now has the opportunity to increase his yields and income and use his extra earnings to ensure that all his children get a post-secondary education.

loans.use: To purchase improved farm inputs that will increase the farmer’s yields

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy cooking ingredients like two bags of rice and five gallons of palm oil.

loans.name: Zeinab

texts.en:
Zeinab is a 19-year-old single Palestinian refugee who began working in 2013 as a hairdresser from her house to improve her living and make sure she can have the necessary standards of living.

Zeinab is working hard to develop her business, but her income isn't enough to help her open a separate business outside her parent's house. Thus, for this reason she is acquiring a youth loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to open her own separate beauty salon, and provide her customers with requested privacy.

She hopes that in the future she can turn her small beauty salon into a beauty center and provide her customers with several updated beauty techniques.

loans.use: to open her own separate beauty salon

loans.name: Güner

texts.en:
Güner is married and a mother of three. She started working as a tailor working from home. In time, she bought materials to sew trousseaux and sold them. 

When the orders she had received increased a lot, she opened her own store of home textiles. She moved her store to another city when they moved there. She has been serving her customers from this store for six years.  

With the help of the loan, she is planning to purchase materials for trousseaux.

Translated from Turkish by Maya staff

Güner hanım evli, üç çocuk annesi. Mesleğine ilk olarak evinde terzi olarak başlamış. Zaman içerisinde çeyizlik malzemeler dikip satmaya başlamış. İşleri çoğalınca kendine ev tekstili adı altında bir dükkan açmış. Taşınınca da dükkanını buraya taşımış. Altı yıldır yeni yerinde müşterilerine hizmet veriyor. Aldığı kredi ile çeyizlik malzemeler alacak. Bundan sonra sağlıklı olup işinin başında olmak istiyor.

loans.use: to buy materials for trousseaux

loans.name: Ismael Antonio

texts.es:
Ismael, es padre de 2 hijas, estudió hasta segundo grado, tuvo que trabajar desde muy joven, para ayudarles a sus padres, está casado y su esposa es empleada doméstica, actualmente en su casa viven sus 2 hijas que están estudiando y su esposa que le ayuda en los trabajos agrícolas.

Ismael, se dedica a la siembra de granos básicos como maíz y frijol desde que estaba pequeño, sus padres le enseñaron este trabajo, ya que era la única forma de trabajo que ellos conocían para mantener a su familia, además de trabajar sus propio cultivos, también hace trabaja como jornalero para otras personas, para ir hasta donde están sus cultivos, tiene que caminar 2 kilómetros desde su vivienda y sus hijas y esposa le ayudan en esta labor.

El préstamo sera utilizado para comprar abono, semilla y pesticidas para su cultivo de maíz y frijol, con esta ayuda mejoraran sus cultivos, porque podrá darles el tratamiento a tiempo y además que este año pudo obtener más tierras para arrendar y así aumentar la producción de granos básicos.

Ismael, desea seguir cultivando la tierra, ya que con esto amplia su cosecha y así puede darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida; además sueña con que sus hijas puedan estudiar en la universidad y algún día sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Ismael is the father of two daughters.  He studied until second grade and had to work since he was very young to help his parents.  He is married and his wife is a domestic worker.  Currently in the house live his two daughters who are studying, and his wife, who helps him with the agricultural work.  

Ismael has made a living planting basic grains such as corn and beans since he was young.  His parents taught him this work, as it was the only type of work they knew to sustain the family.  Aside from working his own crops, he also works as a laborer for other people.  He has to walk 2 kilometers from his home to get to the crops, and his wife and two daughters help him with this work.  

The loan will be used to buy compost, seeds, and pesticides for his corn and bean crops, and with this help his crops will improve because he will be able to treat them in a timely fashion.  Additionally, this year he was able to get more land t rent and in this way increase the production of basic goods.  

Ismael wants to continue cultivating the land, and improve his harvest to give his family a better quality of life.  He also dreams that his daughters will be able to study in the university and be professionals.

loans.use: to buy compost, seeds, and pesticides for his corn and bean crops.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy pots, fertilizer and other types of plants

loans.name: Jacqueline

texts.en:
Jacqueline is a 48-year-old mother of four children who has been working as an English teacher in a private school for 20 years to support her husband in covering their family's increasing living needs and develop their living.

Jacqueline is a hardworking woman who puts in so much effort to provide her students with the best education and her children with the best living. Unfortunately, her limited monthly salary combined with her husband's income is barely enough to cover their daily needs. Thus, today she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to pay for the requested construction needs she has to prepare to make necessary maintenance at her house to make sure it is a healthy living place.

loans.use: to pay for construction needs she has to prepare to make necessary maintenance at her house to make sure it is a healthy living place

loans.name: Wilkister

texts.en:
Wilkister is 38 years old, married to Joseph and supports a family of four children. 

She has been practicing dairy farming for the last eight years, earning KES 7,000 per month. 

Wilkister has applied for her first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to buy a dairy cow for more milk production and supply to earn more income. 

She plans to use the anticipated profits to educate her children and to start a retail shop. 

Her future hopes and dreams are to be financially stable.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow for more milk production and supply to earn more income

loans.name: Eka

texts.en:
Eka is 33 years old. She is married and lives with her husband and two children in Batumi district. Her children go to a local school. 

Eka trades in clothes and shoes, and she wants to expand the business and purchase more stock. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, enables her to get a loan of $4,500. With the received credit, Eka will purchase a stock of shoes and clothes and will increase her income. 

She has a good number of satisfied clients and is very experienced in this business. Eka awaits your support.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of clothes and shoes to resell

loans.name: Binnaz

texts.en:
Binnaz is newly married. She started by working in her mother's store. She learned how to sew tulle curtains from her mother's employee. She has been working for herself for two years now. She is taking orders and sewing from home and selling them.

With this loan she will buy tulle. Her dream is to open a store on her own in the future but she says that she has a long way to go.


Translated from Turkish by Maya staff
Binnaz Hanım yeni evli,  işe annesinin dükkanında çalışarak başlamış. Annesinin elemanından tül dikmeyi öğrenmiş. İki senedir kendine çalışıyor. Sipariş üzerine evinde tül dikip satıyor.Aldığı kredi ile tül alacak. Hayali ileride kendisine bir mefruşat dükkanı açmak. Ama çok yolun başında olduğunu söylüyor.

loans.use: to buy tulle.

loans.name: Zeynep

texts.en:
Zeynep took over a millinery store three years ago and started selling trousseaux. Now she expanded her business. She also sells handicrafts made by women who work with or around her. Thus she has improved the variety of her products. 

She also improved the quality of the lives of women working with her. With the help of her third loan she is planning to buy materials for trousseaux. Her aim is to open a bigger store. 


Translated from Turkish by Maya staff
Zeynep hanım üç sene önce devraldığı  tuhafiye dükkanını çeyizlik malzemeler de satmaya başlayarak işini daha da ilerletti. Zeynep Hanım hazır çeyizlik malzemeler  satışının yanında çevresinde ki kadınlara el işi yaptırarak satış çeşidini arttırdı. Kadınlara kazanç kapısı sağlayarak onların hayatlarını da iyileştirmiş oluyor. Aldığı üçüncü kredi ile tekrar dan çeyizlik malzemeler alacak. Hedefi merkez de daha büyük bir dükkan açmak.

loans.use: to buy materials for trousseaux.

loans.name: Antonia

texts.es:
Antonia es una mujer de 28 años de edad, es soltera vive junto a sus dos hijos de las edades entre 5 y 11 años, esta humilde familia vive en una comunidad de Xejuyup.
Antonia para poder generar sus ingresos y sacar adelante a sus hijos se dedica a la compra y venta de ropa típica, ella tiene diez años de realizar esta actividad, Antonia gracias a su entusiasmo del día a día sus productos son muy vendibles, por lo que ella requiere de un poco más de mercadería para llegar  satisfacer mejor las necesidades de sus clientes, por tal razón solicita un préstamo para comprar hilos e tipo seda, alemán y lustrina para elaborar y vender los mejore trajes típicos de su región.
Antonia sueña con poder contar con un local donde pueda exhibir mejor sus productos y mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Antonia is a single, 28 year old woman who lives with her two sons, ages 5 and 11 years old.  This humble family lives in the Xejuyup community.  

Antonia works buying and selling traditional clothing to generate income and move her children forward.  She has 10 years of experience in this work. Thanks to her daily enthusiasm, he products sell well, which is why she needs more merchandise to better meet the needs of her clients.  For this reason, she is requesting the loan to buy silk threads, German thread, and embroidery floss to make and sell the best traditional clothing of her region.  

Antonia dreams of having a stall where she could better display and sell her products to improve her income.

loans.use: to buy silk thread, German threads and  embroidery floss.

loans.name: Euis

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! Now it’s time for you to meet one of Ruma’s agents, Euis. Euis lives in Majalengka, located in a regency in West Java located about 5 hours' drive from Jakarta, the capital city of Indonesia. She lives there with her husband and her children. 

Euis owns a stall that sells small snacks and drinks and mobile airtime credits to her community. She decided to join Ruma because she already heard before that Ruma has the best service and system. Her community sees her as an informative and trusted mobile provider.

As the business grows, Euis needs additional capital and is seeking a working capital loan from Kiva. She will use the capital to provide more mobile airtime credits to her community. Euis’s goal towards Ruma in the near future is to serve as an e-commerce business for her community with Ruma’s latest product called Mapan, so later on, her community can have access to better products with lower prices. 

As seen in the photo, Euis is the one who is standing in her own stall. She is thankful for your kind support.

loans.use: to process more prepaid mobile airtime purchases for members of her village community.

loans.name: Rosa Emilia

texts.es:
Rosa, es madre de 2 hijos, uno de ellos estudia primer grado y el otro está en primer año de kinder; está casada y su esposo se dedica a la agricultura, ella estudio hasta cuarto grado, debido a que sus padres no contaban con los suficientes ingresos económicos para que pudiera seguir estudiando.

Rosa, se dedica a vender pan dulce desde hace 4 años, sin embargo le ayuda a su esposo en las labores agrícolas que realiza, ella tomo la iniciativa de involucrarse en el negocio de pan, para obtener más fuentes de ingresos, ya que su mamá le enseño como realizar este tipo de negocio, ella sale a vender en los cantones vecinos donde reside.

Rosa, utilizara el préstamo para comprar insumos agrícolas como abono, insecticidas y semilla, con los insumos agricolas podrá lograr que sus cultivos esten bien cuidados para que produzcan una buena cosecha, que le ayudaran para que su familia siempre tengan los alimentos de cada día.
