Rosa, sueña con poner una panadería propia y también con tener terrenos propios para poder cultivar, ya que los terrenos en los que cultiva son alquilados.
texts.en:
Rosa is the mother of two children.  One of them is in the first grade and the other is in the first year of Kindergarten.  She is married, and her husband works in agriculture.  She only studied through the fourth grade due to the fact that her parents didn’t have enough financial resources to allow her to keep studying.

Rosa has worked selling pastries for the past four years.  She goes out to make her sales in the neighborhoods around where she lives.  She took the initiative to get involved in the bakery business in order to get additional sources of income, because her mother had taught her how to run this type of business.  Nevertheless, she also helps her husband with the farming work that he does.

Rosa will use this loan to buy farming supplies such as fertilizers, insecticides, and seeds.  With these supplies she will be able to make sure her crops are well cared for so that they produce a good harvest.  They will help make sure her family always has food each day.

Rosa dreams of opening her own bakery and of owning her own land to cultivate, because the plots of land she currently farms are rented.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies such as fertilizers, insecticides, and seeds.

loans.name: Taufiq

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! This is Taufiq, one of Ruma's agents. Taufiq lives in Majalengka, a regency in West Java, located about 5 hours' drive from Jakarta, the capital city of Indonesia. He lives there with his wife and his children. 

Taufiq owns a stall that sells small snacks and drinks and mobile airtime credits to his community. He decided to join Ruma because he already heard before that Ruma has the best service and system, as well as to give more contribution to his community. His community sees him as an informative and trusted mobile provider.

As the business grows, Taufiq needs additional capital and is seeking a working capital loan from Kiva. He will use the capital to provide more mobile airtime credits to his community. Taufiq’s goal towards Ruma in the near future is to serve as an e-commerce business for his community with Ruma’s latest product called Mapan, so later on, his community can have access to better products with lower prices. 

As seen in the photo, Taufiq is the one who is standing in front of his own stall. He is thankful for your kind support.

loans.use: to process more prepaid mobile airtime purchases for members of his village community.

loans.name: Ambrosia

texts.en: Ambrosia is from Malabuyoc, Cebu, Philippines. She is married, and her husband is a farmer. She has two children ages 15 and 17. For two decades, she has been operating a sari-sari (general) store to help her husband support her family. She sells items such as canned goods, rice, soft drinks, chocolate powdered drinks, canned goods, candies, chips and snacks. She is asking for a loan to buy additional stock such as canned goods, noodles, eggs, shampoo, bath soap, detergent, coffee, milk and soft drinks. In the future, she hopes to make her store bigger.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in her store.

loans.name: Asli

texts.en: Aslı is a university student, and her parents are separated.  She has to work in order to continue with her education.  She decided to do sales via a network system because the networking system has no time constraints.  She used her first loan to buy products in bulk.  Aslı sold the products and formed a business team and thus gained income.  With the help of the second loan she will again purchase bulk products and also enlarge her team.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics and cleaning supplies

loans.name: Juana Genoveva

texts.es:
Juana es una joven de apenas 20 años de edad, es soltera vive junto a sus queridos padres en una comunidad de Xejuyup.
Juana para poder obtener algo de ingresos y apoyar a sus padres con los gastos de la casa se dedica  a la venta de papas gritas en la plaza de su comunidad, ella tiene cuatro años de realizar esta labor.
Juana  es una joven muy optimista que ahora ha pensado en comprar un terreno donde ella pueda cultivar o el algún futuro construir, pero una de las dificultades que ella tiene es que no tiene  el dinero suficiente por tal razón solicita un préstamo para poder ajustar el dinero y poder comprar media cuerda de terreno con cultivo de café.
Juana tiene las esperanzas de conseguir el crédito para poder realizar la comprar, y también sueña con poder instalar un negocio de venta de abarrotes.
texts.en:
Juana is a young woman just 20 years old. She is single and lives with her beloved parents in a community of Xejuyup. To manage to get some income and support her parents with household expenses, Juana makes a living selling french fries in her community square. She has four years in doing this work.

Juana is a very optimistic young woman who has now thought of buying a plot of land where she can farm or, at some future time, build, but one of the difficulties that she has is that she doesn't have enough money. For that reason, she is requesting a loan to balance the money and be able to buy a half acre of land with coffee crop.

Juana has hopes of getting the loan to make the purchase, and also dreams to be able to set up a business selling groceries.

loans.use: to buy a half acre of land with coffee crop.

loans.name: Sabina Matilde

texts.es:
Sabina es una señora de 28 años de edad que ahora está muy agradecida pues gracias al crédito ella puedo comprar sus fertilizantes y también pudo invertir un poco más en su venta de verduras, pues gracias a Dios ahora sus ingresos han incrementado y la calidad de vida de su familia ha cambiado, él ahora solicita un nuevo préstamo para poder comprar más verduras como repollo, cebollas, tomate, zanahoria y satisfacer mejor las necesidades de sus clientes.
El gran sueño de Sabina es poder construir una casa de block para que su familia viva mejor.
texts.en: Sabina is a 28 year old woman. She is now very grateful as thanks to her loan she could buy her fertilizer and also could invest more in her vegetable sales. Thanks to God her income has increased and the quality of living of her family has changed. She is requesting a new loan to be able to buy more vegetables like cabbage, onion, tomato, carrot and satisfy the main needs of her customers. Sabina's big dream is to be able to build a cinder block house so that her family can live better.

loans.use: to buy and sell vegetables.

loans.name: Sunusi

texts.en:
Sunusi is a Babban Gona maize farmer from Bamiyayi Village. Sunusi joined Babban Gona to create a better life for his children. 

In the past, Sunusi suffered from poor yields that crippled his ability to purchase better inputs to improve his yield. Through Babban Gona’s input loan, Sunusi will have access to the best farm inputs in the market, such as fertilizers, herbicides and improved seeds that will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize/ hectare, double the Nigerian national average of 14 bags. This will see him increase his household income considerably. 

Thanks to Babban Gona's support, Sunusi now has the opportunity to increase his yields and income and use his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to purchase improved farm inputs that will increase the farm’s yields

loans.name: Los Sauces Group

texts.es: Un grupo conformado por 7 mujeres emprendedoras  y con mucha creatividad para los negocios. Así son las integrantes del grupo comunal “LOS SAUCES”.  La Sra. María de 32 años de edad, tiene un pequeño negocio de venta de mercería (artículos de costura) en su propia casa ya hace dos años. La Sra. María ha llegado a fidelizar  a sus clientes   el cual le ha generado ganancias para poder cubrir los gastos de su hogar. En el futuro le gustaría ampliar más su negocio para que  ella misma pueda coser los productos que vende, y así  obtener mayores ganancias económicas. Con el préstamo otorgado lo invertirá en comprar más materiales de mercería (artículos de costura) y así  seguir satisfaciendo las necesidades de sus clientes. A la vez  la Sra. María  y todos los integrantes del grupo se encuentran  agradecidos   con Kiva  por el préstamo otorgado  y por la confianza que se les ha brindado. La Sra. María es la primera del lado derecho, la que viste con una casaca negra y un polo de color verde, Se despide  Dejando la promesa  que cumplirá todas sus metas propuestas.
texts.en:
This is a group made of 7 enterprising woman with a creativity for business.  This describes the members of the community group "LOS SAUCES." 

Mrs. Maria is 32 years old and has had a small business selling sewing times in her home for two years. Maria has been able to build loyalty among her clients, which has generated more earnings to cover the household costs.  In the future, she would like to exempting her business so that she herself is sewing the products she sells, which will allow her greater economic earnings.  With this loan, she will invest in buying additional sewing items, and continue to meet the needs of her clients.  At the time, Maria and all the members of the group are thankful to Kiva for the loan they received, and for this confidence it has brought them.  *Maria is the first person on the right side.  She has a black cardigan and a green polo.  

She leaves you with a promise that she will accomplish all of her proposed goals.

loans.use: to buy materials

loans.name: Perlita

texts.en:
Perlita is 34 years old and from the municipality of Ronda in Cebu. She is married with four children ages 1 to 12. Perlita's husband works as a security guard and barely earns enough for their food needs. 

Two years ago, she started raising hogs for an income. She is asking for a loan to further sustain her business and will use it to buy feed. With quality feed, she will be able to produce healthy and fat hogs that are easy to market at a good price.

In the future, she hopes to make her business bigger and more successful.

loans.use: to buy feed

loans.name: Ma. Elizabeth

texts.en:
A livelihood that is common in the rural areas of the Philippines is raising hogs. Like Elizabeth, a 38-year-old woman from the community of Ronda, Cebu. For 10 years now, she has been raising hogs for an income. This is her means to help her husband in raising their two children, ages 11 and 16. 

She is asking a loan to buy feed and more piglets to raise. This is her way to continue expanding and support the needs of her children when it comes to their education.

In the future she plans to make a big piggery to increase her revenue.

loans.use: to buy feed and more piglets

loans.name: Flaviana

texts.en:
Flaviana engages in businesses buying and selling. She is a married woman with five grown children and is from Talibon, Bohol. 

She buys and sells fruits like mango and vegetables like upo (bottle gourd). In addition, she also engages in buying scrap materials like empty bottles, plastics and many others. She is asking for a loan to buy more fruits and vegetables and to have additional capital for her scrap business. 

This will improve her day-to-day income and enable her to pay her obligations. Like this, she will be able to roll her capital and start to expand both her business.

Flaviana hopes that she will be able to  manage her sources of income to improve the family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy more fruits and vegetables and have additional capital for her scrap business.

loans.name: Gilbert

texts.en:
Gilbert is 36 years old and he supports five children. 

He has been selling sodas in the market for the last eight years, and the business earns him KES 11,000 per month. 

He has applied for his first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to purchase stock of sodas for sale to clients to meet their needs.

He plans to use the anticipated profits to repay the loan and educate his children. 

His hope is to be financially stable and expand his business sector.

loans.use: to purchase stock of sodas for sale to clients to meet theirneeds

loans.name: Jemimah

texts.en:
Jemimah is 25 years old and she supports 2 children. 

She has been a shopkeeper for the last 1 year and the business earns her KES 10,000 per month. 

She has applied for her first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to purchase goods and products such as sugar, salt, cooking oil, baking flour and maize flour for her retail shop to meet client needs.

She plans to use the anticipated profits to repay the loan and educate her children. 

Her hope is to be financially stable and expand her business sector.

loans.use: to purchase goods and products such as sugar, salt, cooking oil, baking flour and maize flour for her retail shop to meet client needs

loans.name: Grupo De Mujeres Sector Campo Xejuyup Group

texts.es:
Isabel (la primera del lado izquierdo de la fotografía de blusa negra) es una mujer de 33 años de edad, es soltera vive junto a sus dos hijos de las edades entre 13 y 17 años, esta humilde familia vive en una comunidad de Nahualá.
Isabel con el afán de obtener sus ingresos y sacar adelante a sus hijos se dedica  la elaboración de güipiles y fajas típicas, ella tiene ocho años de realizar esta labor.
Isabel gracias a la dedicación que le pone a su trabajo, cuenta con muchos clientes es por ello que ahora solicita un préstamo para poder comprar más materiales como hilos de tipo alemán, seda, lustrina, y mish para seguir elaborando hermosos trajes típicos.
El gran sueño de Isabel es construir su casa y apoyar a sus hijos en la escuela para que sean grandes profesionales.
texts.en:
Isabel (the first one on the left in the photograph, in a black blouse), 33, lives with her two children, ages 13 and 17.  This humble family lives in a community in Nahualá.

Isabel wants to earn a living and get her children ahead, so she works making huipiles [traditional woven blouses] and traditional skirts.  She has been in this line of work for eight years and has a lot of customers thanks to her dedication to her work.

Now she's requesting a loan to buy more supplies, such as German, silk, cotton, and rayon threads so she can keep sewing.

Isabel's big dream is to build her house and support her children in school so they'll be great professionals.

loans.use: to buy German, silk, cotton, and rayon threads

loans.name: Rümeyza

texts.en: Rümeyza is divorced and has two children. She runs a hair salon. She has been in the hair styling business for 36 years, and she started her salon after her divorce. She also makes goods from recycled materials. She does not like to sit doing nothing, and she says that her mind rests while she is busy. With the help of the loan she is planning to purchase supplies for her salon. She aims to live a healthy life and to work.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her salon

loans.name: Yahaya

texts.en:
Yahaya is a Babban Gona maize farmer from Galadima Mayau Village. Yahaya joined Babban Gona to increase his wealth. 

Through Babban Gona’s input loan, Yahaya will have access to the best farm inputs in the market such as fertilizer, herbicides and improved seeds that will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize/hectare, double the Nigerian national average of 14 bags of maize.  This season, Yahaya  has grand plans to harvest 60 bags. This will see him increase his household income considerably. 

Thanks to Babban Gona's support, Yahaya now has the opportunity to increase his yields and income and use his extra earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: To purchase improved farm inputs that will increase the farmer’s yields

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more stock of maize grains to sell

loans.name: Heizel

texts.en:
Heizel is from Badian, Cebu. She is 23 years old with a five-year-old son. Two years ago, she started weaving mats for a living. She earns PHP 4,000 per month from this business. 

She is asking for a loan to buy materials for weaving like buri (palm) and dye. Her income will be utilized for her son's food, school fees and reinvested in the same business for expansion.

loans.use: to buy buri and dye.

loans.name: Isidra Blanca

texts.es:
Isidra, es madre de 2 hijos, estudio hasta noveno grado, es madre soltera y vive con sus padres a quienes cuida, económicamente dependen de ella sus 2 hijos y sus padres.

Isidra, se dedica a la elaboración y venta de pan dulce desde hace 15 años, este trabajo lo aprendió por medio de una vecina, a quien ella llegaba a ver como lo realizaba, fue asi como fue aprendiendo poco a poco y comenzó a hacer pan para vender, hoy en día es su principal fuente de ingresos para su familia y en ocasiones sus hijos le ayudan a elaborarlo.

Isidra, utilizara el préstamo para comprar harina, azúcar, huevos y sal, con la compra de estos insumos, pretende ampliar su  negocio y mejorar sus ventas para aumentar sus ingresos y poderles dar a sus padres e hijos una mejor calidad de vida.

Isidra, sueña con arreglar su casa, principalmente el techo porque en invierno le caen muchas goteras; además sueña con construir un cuarto más para su hijo y en un futuro comprar un horno industrial, ya que el que actualmente tiene es artesanal.
texts.en:
Isidra is a mother to two children.  She studied through 9th grade, is a single mother , and lives with her parents, whom she cares for.  Her parents and children are economically dependent on her.  

Isidra makes a living through baking and selling sweet bread for the past 15 years.  She learned this work through a neighbor, through whom she saw how it was done and learned little by little until she started making bread to sell.  Today it is the main source of income for her family.  Sometimes her children help her make it.  

Isidra will use the loan to buy flour, sugar, eggs, and salt.  By buying these goods, she will expand her business and improve her sales of increase her income and give her children a better quality of life.  

Isidra dreams of fixing her house, mainly the roof because in the winter there are many leaks.  Furthermore, she dreams of building an additional room for her son, and to someday buy an industrial oven, as the one she currently has is artisanal.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, eggs and salt.

loans.name: Jose Armando

texts.es:
José, es un pequeño productor con 8 años de experiencia en la caficultura. Cuenta que desde pequeño soñaba con dedicarse a la producción de este rubro, y hoy con 39 años de edad mantiene viva la pasión por lo que hace. 

El ciclo pasado gran porcentaje de sus plantas de café fueron afectadadas por una plaga llamada “Roya”, poniendo en riesgo su producción. Gracias a las rápidas medidas de mitigación logró sacar la mínima producción, necesaria para mantener emergente la finca. 

Para el actual ciclo, José ha diseñado un plan de mejoramiento en la nutrición de sus cafetos, con lo que incrementará la nutrición de éstas y por ende su cosecha. Para esto solicita un financiamiento para la adquisición de los insumos agrícolas necesarios para cumplir su propósito.

La meta de este pequeño productor es lograr potenciar la productividad de su finca, y con ello incrementar los ingresos para mejorar las condiciones de su familia.
texts.en:
José is a small producer with 8 years of experience in coffee growing. He says that from a young age he dreamed about working in coffee production, and today with 39 years of age he’s still passionate for what he does.

In the past cycle a great percentage of his coffee crops were affected by a plague called “Roya”, putting at risk his production. Thanks to the quick mitigation measures, he managed to save a minimum production needed to keep the farm afloat. 

For this current cycle, José has designed an improvement plan of nutrition for his coffee trees, which will increase the nutrition of the plants and ultimately improve his harvest. He is requesting a loan to buy agricultural supplies needed to achieve his purpose.

This small producer’s goal is to boost his farm’s productivity and increase his incomes to improve his family’s conditions.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies for his coffee plantation.

loans.name: Ana Francisca

texts.es:
Francisca, es madre de 2 hijos, estudió hasta cuarto grado, es madre soltera y uno de sus hijos es quien le ayuda en el cultivo de maíz, frijol y hortalizas; actualmente su hijo es el único que depende de ella, ya que solo ellos viven juntos en la misma casa.

Francisca, se dedica a la siembra de granos básicos como maíz, frijol y hortalizas desde hace 28 años, esta actividad la aprendió de su padre cuando era muy joven, también vende productos por catalogo, para poder mejorar sus ingresos, para llegar hasta donde están sus cultivos tiene que caminar 2 kilómetros desde su vivienda.

El préstamo sera utilizado para comprar abono, pesticidas y una nueva variedad de semilla, esta semilla será más productiva para su cultivo de maíz y frijol, con lo cual mejorara su cosecha y aumentara la producción de granos.

Francisca, desea seguir mejorando sus cultivos y ayudandole a su hijo para que pueda tener un mejor futuro.
texts.en:
Francisca is the mother of two children. She studied up to Grade 4. She is a single mother and one of her children helps her with growing corn, beans and vegetables. Actually her son is the only one who is dependent on her as only they live together in the same house.

Francisca has worked growing basic grains like corn, beans and vegetables for 28 years. She learned this work from her father when she was young. She also sell products by catalog in order to improve her income. She has to walk two km from her house to get to where her crops are.

The loan will be used to buy manure, pesticides and a new variety of seeds. This seed will be more productive for her corn and beans crops, so she will improve her harvest and increase her production of grains. Francisca wants to continue to improve her crops and helping her son so that he can have a better future.

loans.use: to buy manure, pesticides and a new variety of seeds.

loans.name: Felicita

texts.es:
Felicita, de 38 años de edad, tiene 3 hijos, es madre soltera y se dedica a los oficios domésticos y a la venta de tortillas.

Felicita, tiene 5 años de hacer tortillas para vender, pero desde su niñez aprendio a hacerlas y hoy de esa manera mantiene su familia. 

Felicita, solicita el crédito para comprar arena, cemento y lámina para mejorar su vivienda.

El sueño de Felicita, es poder mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Felicita is a 38 year old single mother of three children who works keeping the house and selling tortillas. Felicita has five years experience selling tortillas. She learned how to make them as a child and now this is her way to support her family.

Felicita is requesting the loan to buy sand, gravel and laminated sheeting to make improvements on her house. Felicita's dream is to be able to improve the quality of life of her family.

loans.use: to buy sand, gravel and laminated sheeting to make improvements on her house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase farm tools and implements such as jembes to enable her do more farming activity to increase sugarcane supply to the market

loans.name: Ishaku Idi

texts.en:
Ishaku Idi is a Babban Gona maize farmer from Gidan Bawa Village. Ishaku Idi joined Babban Gona to expand his farm and grow his agricultural business. 

Through Babban Gona’s input loan, Ishaku Idi will have access to the best farm inputs in the market such as fertilizers, herbicides and improved seeds that will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize/hectare, double the Nigerian national average of 14 bags. This will see him increase his household income considerably. 

Thanks to Babban Gona's support, Ishaku Idi now has the opportunity to increase his yields and income and use his extra earnings to ensure that all his children get a post-secondary education.

loans.use: to purchase improved farm inputs that will increase the farm’s yields

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert is 38 years old, married to Roseline and supports a family of three children. 

He has been practicing farming for the last five years, earning KES 7,000 per month. 

Robert has applied for his first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to buy a dairy cow so as to supply more milk for more income gain. 

He plans to use the anticipated profits to educate his children and to extend his dairy farming. 

His future hopes and dreams are to be financially stable.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow so as to supply more milk for more income gain

loans.name: Elvin Antonio

texts.es:
Elvin es un pequeño productor de café desde hace 23 años. Junto a su esposa, se dedican a la caficultura en una pequeña finca al norte de Nicaragua. Es un líder en su comunidad, y en los últimos ciclos ha logrado cosechar hasta 80 quintales de café.

Con la asistencia oportuna de los técnicos de PAC, él ha logrado diseñar e implementar un plan de manejo en su finca, para alcanzar mejores resultados en este nuevo ciclo agrícola. Para esto, solicita un financiamiento que le ayude a adquirir los insumos agrícolas que le permitirán asegurar la mejora nutricional de sus cafetos.

La meta de este pequeño productor es incrementar la productividad de su finca y con ello los ingresos para garantizarle mejores condiciones a su familia.
texts.en:
Elvin has been a small coffee producer for the past 23 years.  Together with his wide, he makes a living coffee growing on a small farm in northern Nicaragua.   He is a leader in his community, and in the more recent seasons has been able to harvest 8,000 pounds of coffee.    With the timely assistance from the PAC technicians, he has been able to design and implement a management plan for his farm to have better results in this new growing season.  

For this, he requests financing that will help him to obtain the consumable agricultural goods that will allow him to ensure good nutrition of his coffee plants.  The goal of this small producer is to increase the productivity of his farm, and with it the income that will guarantee better conditions for his family.

loans.use: to buy consumable goods to use on his coffee farm to have a good harvest.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more clothing and to buy food in order to make tamales and beverages.

loans.name: Onofre

texts.en: Onofre is 64 years old and lives in the town of Badian in Cebu. He is married and has been raising hogs and cattle for a living. He likes this type of business because he can keep his animals close to home, and is asking a loan to buy feed to fatten his hogs and cattle. This way, he will be assured that his animals are healthy and disease-free. In the future, Onofre plans to expand his business and make it more successful. He will use the additional income he expects to earn to for food, savings and reinvestment in his business.

loans.use: to buy feed for his livestock.

loans.name: Estela Elizabeth

texts.es:
Estela, tiene 2 hijos, ambos están estudiando, ella estudió hasta sexto grado, está acompañada y su pareja es agricultor.  

Estela, se dedica al comercio de minutas desde hace 5 años, su madre empezo a vender y le enseño como administrar ese negocio; la venta la tiene frente a la escuela del caserío y su esposo le ayuda con el negocio cuando no está trabajando en la agricultura. 

El préstamo lo necesita para iniciar un nuevo negocio de venta de ropa, para diversificar sus ingresos y para ello comprara blusas, pantalones, camisas, faldas y azúcar y jaleas de sabores para la venta de minutas. 

Estela, sueña con ver a sus hijos graduados de una carrera universitaria.
texts.en:
Estela has two children, both of whom study in school. Estela studied through sixth grade.  She lives with her partner who works in agriculture.  

Estela works making flavored snow cone snacks and has been in this field for five years.  Her mother began the business and showed her how to run it.  She completes her sales in front of a school in the area and her husband helps her with the business when he is not working in agriculture. 

She needs a loan in order to invest in a new business selling clothing, in order to diversify her income.  For this reason she will buy blouses, pants, shirts, skirts, as well as syrup and jellies in different flavors to sell with her snow cones.

Estela dreams of seeing her children go to college.

loans.use: buy blouses, pants, shirts, and skirts to begin a new clothing business, as well as to buy syrup and jellies in different flavors to sell from her snow cone stall.

loans.name: Yanira Guadalupe

texts.es:
Yanira, es madre de 3 hijos, estudió hasta sexto grado, está casada y su esposo es agricultor, sus 3 hijos viven con ella y dependen económicamente de ella.

Yanira, se dedica a la siembra de granos básicos desde hace varios años, su esposo fue quien le enseño todo lo relacionado a esta actividad, además de trabajar sus cultivos, también es empleada los fines de semana en un turicentro, para poder ayudarle a su esposo con el sustento diario de su familia, para llegar hasta donde están sus cultivos camina 2 kilómetros desde su vivienda.  

El préstamo sera utilizado para comprar abono, semilla y pesticidas para su cultivo de maíz y frijol, con lo cual mejorara sus cultivos, ya que este año ha arrendado una cantidad mayor de terreno para aumentar la producción de granos y mejorar su calidad de vida.

Yanira, desea seguir cultivando la tierra; además desea continuar ayudandole a sus hijos para que continuen con sus estudios.
texts.en:
Yanira is mother to three children.  She studied through sixth grade.  She is married and her husband works in agriculture.  Her three children live with her and depend economically on her. 

Yanira works planting basic grains and has been in the field for several years.  Her husband was the one who taught her everything related to agriculture.  In addition to working the fields, she also works on the weekends at a tourist center in order to help her husband manage household expenses.  In order to reach their fields they walk 2 kilometers from home. 

The loan will be used to buy fertilizer, seed and pesticides for growing corn and beans.  These items will improve their crops, since this year they have rented a larger plot of land in order to increase their production of basic grains and improve their quality of life. 

Yanira wants to continue cultivating the land.  In addition she wants to help her children continue with their studies.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, seed and pesticides for growing corn and beans.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy farm supplies.

loans.name: Elened

texts.en: Elened is 52 years old, married, and supports a family of seven children. He has been practicing dairy farming for the last 14 years and earns KES 12,500 per month. He has applied for his first loan, for KES 25,000, from Vision Fund Kenya to buy a dairy cow he can produce more milk to sell. Elened plans to use the profits he expects to earn to educate his children and to open a retail shop in the area. His future hopes and dreams are to be financially stable.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow to produce more milk to sell.

loans.name: Müyesser

texts.en:
Müyesser is married, and when her husband went overseas to work, she had to move in with her mother. She quickly became bored and, thanks to her friends' suggestions, started selling trousseau materials to her neighbors. She is happy to make and save the money she has earned, and dreams of buying a house. With the help of this loan, she plans to buy more trousseau materials to sell.

Translated from Turkish by Maya staff
Müyesser Hanım evli. Eşi yurt dışına çalışmak için gidince geçici olarak köyde annesinin yanında yaşamaya başlamış. Boş durmaktan sıkılınca arkadaşının önerisi ile köyde ve çevresin de çeyizlik malzemeler satmaya başlamış. Kendi parasını kazanmaktan mutlu. Böylelikle para biriktirebildiğini söylüyor. Birikimi ile ev almayı hayal ediyor. Aldığı kredi ile çeyizlik malzeme alacak.

loans.use: to buy materials for a trousseau.

loans.name: Grupo Chuachinup Nuevo Group

texts.es:
Lucia es una mujer de 37 años de edad, es casada tiene una linda familia de cinco hijos de las edades entre 8 y 17 años, esta humilde familia vive en una comunidad de Nahualá.
Lucia (es la primera del lado derecho de la fotografía de blusa verde)  para sacar adelante a sus hijos y darles lo mejor se dedica  a la venta de café, ella tiene diez años de dedicarse a este tipo de negocio. Lucia ahora se ve a la necesidad de darle mantenimiento a unas parcelas de café que hace algún tiempo cultivo, pero una de las dificultades que Lucia tiene es que no cuenta con el capital suficiente para poder comprar sus fertilizantes y pagar la mano de obra por tal razón junto a un grupo de personas solicita un préstamo para poder cubrir esta necesidad.
Lucia y su grupo esperan contar con el crédito para poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Lucia, age 37, is married and has a lovely family of five children between the ages of 8 and 17.  This humble family lives in a community in Nahualá.

Lucia (in the photo she is the first one on the right with a green shirt) sells coffee in order to get her children ahead and to give them the best.  She has been in this type of business for ten years.  Lucia now realizes that it is necessary to perform maintenance on her coffee fields, which she has been cultivating for some time.

However, one of the difficulties that Lucia has is that she does not have enough capital to be able to buy the fertilizers and to pay for the labor.  That is the reason that she is requesting a loan, together with her group, in order to be able to cover this necessity.

Lucia and her group hope to have the loan in order to be able to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to buy the fertilizers and to pay for labor.

loans.name: Baktykan

texts.ru: Бактыкан, 60 лет, замужем, дети взрослые. У нее - высшее образование, Бактыкан на пенсии, на протяжении 35 лет работает фельдшером. В качестве дополнительного дохода для своей семьи она уже 25 лет занимается сельским хозяйством. Благодаря упорному труду Бактыкан, на сегодняшний день у нее есть 5 коров, 50 овец. В целях дальнейшего расширения бизнеса, Бактыкан обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 40,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота для разведения. Доходы от кредита Бактыкан планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие ее бизнеса и покупку мебели для дома.
texts.en: Baktykan is 60 years old, married, and has grown-up children. She has a higher education and she is retired. For 35 years, Baktykan worked as a medical assistant. She has been farming for 25 years in order to get additional income for her family. Thanks to Baktykan's hard work, today she has five cows and 50 sheep. With the aim of expanding her business further, Baktykan has applied to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 40,000 som (KGS) to buy livestock for breeding. Baktykan plans to invest the proceeds of the loan in further developing her business and buying furniture for her home.

loans.use: to buy some livestock to increase her herd.

loans.name: Kulsun

texts.ru: Кулсун, 59 лет, в разводе, есть ребенок. Кулсун занимается сельским хозяйством, есть 2 коровы, 15 овец. Ежемесячный доход составляет 18,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Кулсун обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на увеличение поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Кулсун планирует вложить в дальнейшее расширение ее бизнеса и планирует накопить средства на ремонт дома.
texts.en: Kulsun is 59 years old. She is divorced and has a child. Kulsun farms: she has two cows and fifteen sheep. Her monthly income is 18,000 som (KGS). In order to develop her business further, Kulsun has applied to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 50,000 som (KGS) to increase the size of her herd. Kulsun plans to invest the proceeds of the loan in further expanding her business, and she plans to save up to renovate her house.

loans.use: to buy some livestock to increase her herd.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en: Marilyn hails from the town of Alegria in Cebu. She is married and the mother of three children ages 3, 9 and 11. To help her husband support their family, she grows vegetables such as bitter gourd. She is asking for a loan to keep her farm free from pests and make it more successful. She will use this loan to buy seeds, fertilizer and pesticides. Marilyn works hard because she believes that her children deserve the best in life. She will use the income she expects to earn to buy food and pay school fees.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer and pesticides

loans.name: Ma. Magdalina

texts.en:
Ma. Magdalina grows vegetables in Alegria, Cebu. She works hard in her farm to earn a living. She plants eggplant as her source of livelihood. She is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and seedlings to make her business thrive.

In the future, Ma. Magdalina plans to cultivate more lands to make a better profit out of her vegetables. Her income will be for consumption and reinvestment in the same business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seedlings.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maria es una joven de 28 años, entusiasta, proactiva que vive junto a sus padres en una comunidad de Nahualá.
Maria para obtener sus ingresos y apoyar a sus padres con los gastos de la casa se dedica  a la compra y venta de abarrotería, con la cual lleva cinco años de realizarla, Maria gracias a la amabilidad con la que atiende a sus clientes, mucha gente lo busca para realizar sus compras, es por ello que ahora ha tomado la decisión de solicitar un préstamo para comprar más mercaderías como azúcar, huevo, frijol, recitos y gaseosas y así satisfacer mejor las necesidades de los clientes.
Maria tiene el gran sueño de comprar un terreno donde pueda construir su propia casa.
texts.en:
María is a young woman of 28 years of age, enthusiastic, and proactive, who lives with her parents in a community of Nahualá. To earn income and support her parents with household expenses, María makes a living buying and selling in a grocery store, which she has five years of doing so. 

Thanks to the kindness with which she tends to her customers, many people seek her to shop; it is why she has now decided to request a loan to buy more goods like sugar, eggs, beans, snack foods, and soft drinks and thus better meet the needs of customers.

María has the great dream of buying a plot of land where she can build her own house.

loans.use: to buy products such as sugar, eggs, beans, snack foods, and soft drinks.

loans.name: Mijgona

texts.ru: Мичгона жительница города Турсунзаде. Ей 29 лет, и она развелась с мужем. У нее двое детей. Когда Мичгона развелась с мужем, дети были маленькими. Ей было тяжело, но она нашла себе силу воспитывать и вырасти детей. У нее прекрасные дети. Мичгона после развода начала заниматься торговлей деятельностью, чтобы зарабатывать и прокормить детей. О детьми ухаживает ее мама. Мичгона 6 лет продвигает свою работу. Она на рынке продает женскую и детскую одежду. Мичгона научилась как вести бизнес, и правильно общаться с клиентами. Она честная и старательная  женщина. Ее доходы только от торговлей деятельностью. Мичгона решила расширить деятельность. Она хочет взять кредит и за счет кредита привозить летнюю мужскую и женскую одежду на продажу. Мичгона надеется на финансовую поддержку. Вы можете поддержать ее.
texts.en: Mijgona is a resident of the town of Tursun-zoda. She is 29 years old and she is divorced. She has two children. When Mijgona got divorced, the children were little. It was hard for her, but she found the strength to raise and educate the children. She has wonderful children. After the divorce, Mijgona began trading in order to earn money and feed the children. Her mother looks after the children. Mijgona has been working for six years. She sells women's and children's clothes at the market. Mijgona has learned how to run a business and how to communicate correctly with customers. She is an honest and industrious woman. Her income is only from her trading business. Mijgona has decided to expand her business. She wants to take a loan and use it to get men's and women's clothing to sell. Mijgona hopes for financial support. You can help her.

loans.use: to get men's and women's summer clothing to sell.

loans.name: Vianey

texts.es: Vianey  tiene la edad de 32 años, está casado   y vive con  la esposa   actualmente. El crédito lo quiere para la compra de unos cerdos pequeños y el concentrado para su alimentación .El espera poder engordarlos y venderlos con el peso ideal y  así tener mayores ingresos económicos. El espera en un futuro brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una mayor estabilidad económica, y de poder seguir creciendo. Es el primer préstamo que recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Vianey is 32 years old, married and currently lives with his wife. He wants the loan to buy some young pigs and the concentrate for feeding them.  He hopes to be able to fatten and sell them at their ideal weight and this way have greater income. 

Someday he hopes to provide his family with a better quality of life and greater financial stability, and he wants to keep his business growing.  This is his first loan from Fudecosur.  He had not had other loans before with regular banks, but Fudecosur has offered him a loan with easier terms and at a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy pigs

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: al joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 28 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo, se dedica al cultivo de maíz y maicillo desde hace 7 años, comercializa sus productos en los alrededores de la zona donde el reside, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, el joven vive en casa propia con su esposa y su hijo, el está solicitando un crédito para la compra de abono, herbicida, insecticidas, semillas etc. y así poder tener mejores ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
The young man with the pixelated face is 28 years old and lives in a high risk area.  He has been growing corn and sorghum for seven years.  He sells his products in the areas around where he lives.  With what he gets from his sales, he manages to pay for some of the household expenses.  He lives in his own house with his wife and his son.

He is requesting a loan to buy fertilizer, herbicides, insecticides, and seeds, etc.  This way he will be better to have better earnings.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, herbicides, insecticides, and seeds, etc.

loans.name: Marco Tulio

texts.es: Don Marco de 54 años de edad vive en casa propia con sus cuatro hijos, el se dedica al cultivo de maíz y frijol, tiene 30 años de experiencia en esa actividad e inicio con capital propio, gracias a su trabajo es como logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, el está solicitando un crédito para la compra de abono, herbicida, insecticidas, semillas, etc. y así poder tener mejores ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
Marco, age 54, lives in his own house with his four children.  He grows corn and beans, and he has 30 years of experience in this business activity.  He started with his own capital.  Thanks to his work, he manages to pay for some of the household expenses.

He is requesting a loan to buy fertilizer, herbicide, insecticides, and seeds, etc.  This way he will be able to have better earnings.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, herbicide, insecticides, and seeds, etc.

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.es: La Señora Beatriz y su esposo, viven en Cochabamba provincia chapare;  tienen 39 años de edad, respectivamente, de estado civil casados, económicamente son independientes, la solicitante se dedica al comercio de salchipapas, hamburguesas y mini piques y su esposo se dedica al servicio de música, para la venta de sus productos cuenta con un mercado consolidado y tambien vende a los niños de los colegios de turno mañana y tarde, la señora requiere el crédito para capital de operación compra de mercadería para su venta de salchipapas,  con la inversión que va realizar  va a tener mejores ingresos e incrementará su patrimonio familiar y de esa manera podrá mejorar su nivel de vida en beneficio de su familia hacia futuro
texts.en:
Beatriz and her husband live in Cochabamba's Chapare province. They are both 39 years old, have a common-law relationship and are economically independent.

She works in her business selling salchipapas (local street-food made of sausage and french fries mixed together), hamburgers and snacks. Her husband works in the music service field and has a consolidated market and also sells to the morning and afternoon shifts of the children at school.

Beatriz needs the loan for operating capital for her salchipapas sales. With this investment she is going to make she will have greater income and increase her family's assets and in this way they can improve their standard of living for the benefit of her family in the future.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her business.

loans.name: Isai

texts.es: Isai, tiene la edad de 34 años, esta soltero, vive con los padres, los cuales son su mayor prioridad. Con su crédito pretende hacer la compra de semilla de arroz de buena calidad y que se adapte adecuadamente a las condiciones de suelo y clima de la zona, además que tenga una buena característica de cosecha adecuada al igual que el rendimiento del producto final, además de algunos fertilizantes para aplicarle al cultivo de arroz, también realizar algunos trabajos de labores culturales como lo son la conservación de suelos por medio de realización de canales a nivel para que el agua de lluvia no pueda realizar lavados, principalmente en las partes con mas pendientes, con estas nuevas prácticas de trabajo espera cumplir con el objetivo de tener una plantación con mejor sanidad y un suelo con mas fertilidad y por ende una mejor cosecha. Con esta compra de productos adecuados tendrá una calidad mejor de producto para el consumidor. Es el primer préstamo que ha recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Isai, 34, is single and lives with his parents, who are his top priority. 

With his loan, he intends to buy quality rice seed which is properly adapted to the conditions of the soil and the climate of the area with good characteristics for an adequate harvest and final product. He will also buy fertilizer to apply to his crop of rice and work on some agricultural practices such as soil conservation, which he will accomplish by constructing canals so that the rainwater cannot wash away the soil in the most sloping areas. With these new working practices, Isai expects to meet his goal of having a farm with better health and more soil fertility for a better harvest. With the purchase of these suitable products, he will have a better quality product for the consumer. 

It is the first loan he received from FUDECOSUR. He has not had a loan previously in the state banks but FUDECOSUR has provided the loan with better resources and a much lower rate of interest.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizers for his rice crops

loans.name: Carlos Brigido

texts.es: Don Carlos de 60 años de edad vive en casa propia con su hija, él se dedica al cultivo de maíz y frijol, desde hace 40 años inicio con capital propio, con las ganancias que obtiene logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, el está solicitando un crédito para la compra de abono, fertilizantes, controles de plagas, semillas, herbicidas para poder asistir su cultivo y así tener mejores cosechas para una mejor ganancias económica.
texts.en:
Carlos, 60, lives in his own home with his daughter. He earns his living cultivating corn and beans, which he began 40 years ago with his own investment. He uses the profits he earns to pay for household expenses. 

He is requesting a loan for the purchase of fertilizer, manure, pest control, seeds, and herbicides to tend to his crops and have better crops for improved economic returns.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers, and more to grow corn and beans

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a new stock of clothes, especially sweaters, jumpers, and coats for this cold season.

loans.name: Cornelia Angelica

texts.es: Cornelia de 42 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo, ella se dedica desde hace 20 años al cultivo de maíz y frijol, comercializa sus productos en los diferentes mercados que están cerca de su casa, con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas es como puede salir adelante, la clienta está solicitando un crédito para la compra de abono, herbicida, insecticidas, fertilizantes, controles de plagas, entre otros insumos y así poder tener una buena cosecha para seguir con sus ventas.
texts.en: Cornelia is 42 years ago and lives in her own house with her husband. For 20 years she has worked growing corn and beans. She sells her products in the different markets that are close to her house. With the profits she makes from her sales she can get ahead. Cornelia is requesting a loan to buy manure, herbicide, insecticide, fertilizer, pest control amongst other inputs to be able to have a good harvest to continue with her sales.

loans.use: to buy manure, herbicide, insecticide, fertilizer, pest controls amongst other supplies.

loans.name: Ana Gladis

texts.es: Ana de 40 años de edad vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, ella se dedica desde hace 20 años a la siembra de maíz y maicillo, vende sus productos a comerciantes de la zona donde ella reside, y con las ventas que realiza logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de abono, herbicida, insecticidas, fertilizantes, controles de plagas, etc. y mejorar el terreno que muestra en la fotografía para continuar con sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Ana is 40 years old and lives in her own home with her family. She has been growing corn and sorghum for 20 years. She sells her products to merchants in the area where she lives, and with the sales she makes manages to pay some household expenses. 

She is requesting a loan to buy manure, herbicide, insecticides, fertilizers, pest control agents, etc., and to improve the land shown in the photo so that she can can continue with her crop-growing.

loans.use: To buy manure, herbicide, insecticides, fertilizers, pest control agents, etc., and to improve the land.

loans.name: Maria Concepcion

texts.es:
María, es madre de 2 hijos, estudió hasta sexto grado, está casada y su esposo es agricultor, uno de sus  hijos es albañil y su otro hijo es estudiante y le ayuda en sus tiempos libres.

María, se dedica a la siembra de granos básicos junto a su esposo desde hace 35 años, además de cultivar la tierra, también tiene una venta de frutas, tostadas de yuca y plátano los fines de semana en un turicentro, con todas esas actividades ha podido ayudar a sacar a su familia adelante, para ir a sus cultivos tienen que caminar 3 kilómetros desde su vivienda.

El préstamo sera utilizado para comprar abono, pesticidas y semilla para su cultivo, con estas compras aumentara la producción de granos básicos.

María, desea mejorar sus cultivos y así poder seguir ayudandole a sus hijoas para que estudien y se puedan graduar de una carrera universitaria.
texts.en:
María is a mother of two. She has a sixth grade education. She is married and her husband is a farmer. One of her sons is a bricklayer and her other son is a student who helps with work in his free time. 

María earns her living in the cultivation of basic staple crops alongside her husband. She has done this work for 35 years. In addition to cultivating the land, she also sells fruit and yucca and plantain tostadas in a tourist center on the weekends. With all of her activities, she helps her family get ahead. 

She must walk 3 kilometers from her home in order to reach her crops. The loan will be used to buy fertilizer, pesticides, and seeds for cultivation. The purchases will help her increase her production of basic staple crops.

María wants to improve her crops so that she can help her sons to study and graduate from college.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, pesticides, and seed

loans.name: Maria Sofia

texts.es: Doña Sofía es originaria del área de Chimaltenango, Y desde hace más de ocho años se ha dedicado a la crianza de marranos ella está muy agradecida con Fape y Kiva porque gracias al apoyo que le están brindando está cumpliendo sus metas y sueños. Actualmente tiene más de doce marranas en gestación y siempre tiene lechones a la venta también estrega marranitos en una fundación mensualmente. Con sus ingresos está dando estudios a su hijo más pequeño. Solicita el crédito para la compra de concentrado, vitaminas, afrecho y granillo. Y ahora también piensa comprar ganado vacuno para obtener leche y así elaborar quesos para la venta y con esto agrandar mas su negocio.
texts.en:
Doña Sofía is from the area of Chimaltenango.  For more than eight years she has worked raising pigs.  She is very grateful to Fape and Kiva because thanks to the support that they offer, she is accomplishing her goals and dreams.  Presently she has more than twelve piglets about to be born.  She always has suckling piglets for sale and also gives piglets to a foundation monthly.  

With her income she is able to pay for the education of her youngest child.  She is asking for the loan to purchase concentrated vitamins, mash and grain.  She is also planning to purchase cattle to have the milk and then make cheeses to sell and augment her business.

loans.use: Compra de animales para la crianza.

loans.name: Dismas

texts.en:
Dismas is 39 years old, is married, and supports four family members.

He is a small scale farmer. He has applied for his first loan of 25,000 Kenya shillings (KES) from VisionFund Kenya to purchase fertilizers so as to improve soil nutrients for a better harvest.

He plans to use gained profits to repay the loan and expand his agricultural sector. His hope is to be financially stable.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers so as to improve soil nutrients for a better harvest.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is 45 years old and supports four children. 

She has been a farmer selling farm produce such as bananas in the market for the last 18 years. The business earns her KES 10,000 per month. 

Jane has applied for her first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to purchase farm tools and implements, such as jembes (digging hoe) to do more farming activity and increase her banana supply to the market.

She plans to use the anticipated profits to repay the loan and educate her children. 

She hopes to be financially stable and expand her agricultural business.

loans.use: To purchase farm tools and implements such as jembes (digging hoe) to do more farming activity and increase her banana supply to the market.

loans.name: San Expedito Group

texts.es:
El comité se denomina San Expedito está integrado por 18 mujeres muy emprendedoras de la ciudad de Santaní, ellas son de una ciudad eminentemente rural, donde todas están luchando para poder mejorar cada día.
Todas se dedican a actividades rurales de cría y venta de animales, entre ellas la Sra. Maria, una persona muy trabajadora, que lucha para poder crecer y salir adelante.
Maria pide este préstamo para la compra de animales para la cría y también de balanceados. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder mejorar cada día.
texts.en:
The communal bank is called San Expedito and it includes 18 very enterprising women from the city of Santaní. They are from a predominantly rural city, where everyday they strive to improve. They all make livings doing rural occupations, like breeding and selling animals. 

Among them is Sra. Maria, a hard worker that is striving to grow and get ahead. She is requesting this loan to buy animals for breeding and also for animal feed. She appreciates receiving the opportunity to improve everyday.

loans.use: to buy animals for breeding and animal feed.

loans.name: Markus

texts.en: Markus is a Babban Gona maize farmer from Dogon Awo Village. He joined Babban Gona to create a better life for his children. In the past, Markus suffered from poor yields that crippled his ability to improve his farming skills. Through Babban Gona’s input loan, Markus Markus will have access to the best farm inputs in the market such as fertilizer, herbicide and improved seed that will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize per hectare, more than double the Nigerian national average of 14 bags. This will see him increase his household income considerably. Thanks to Babban Gona's support, Markus now has the opportunity to increase his yields and income and use his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: To purchase improved farm inputs that will increase his yields

loans.name: Alex

texts.en: Alex is 36 years old from the community of Alegria in Cebu. He is married with two children, ages 10 and 11. He is raising hogs for a living to support his family. He is asking for a loan to buy more piglets to raise and pig feed to keep his animals healthy. Alex's dream is to successfully send his children to school. In the future, he would like to expand his business by making his barn bigger and increasing his animals to raise for more profit.

loans.use: to buy piglets and feed

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
Marina is 29 years old, married, and has two children who attend school. She lives in Lagodekhi, Georgia. The family is involved in agricultural activities. They have a cow and produce cheese to sell locally. In addition, they have a plot of agricultural land, where they grow maize and sell the harvest. 

Marina wants to start a trading business and requested a loan from Credo's Start Up program for 7,000 GEL, which she will use to purchase a car and stock of fruits and vegetables to begin a trading business.  Her husband will drive the car and they both will trade fruits and vegetables from village to village. Marina is very motivated to increase her family income.

loans.use: to purchase a car and stock of fruits and vegetables to begin a trading business

loans.name: Verónica Del Pilar

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Señoras Exitosas se reúne cada 15 días en el barrio Medardo Mora en  la ciudad de Manta,  ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año, por su gastronomía y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual con muchos atractivos turísticos.
En este lugar vive la señora Verónica, tiene 39 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos de 19, 18  y 14 años de edad, todos viven en su casa y el menor  estudia en colegio. Su esposo es taxista.
Doña Verónica es una mujer que le gusta trabajar para así ayudarle a su marido a salir adelante, ya que son muchos los gastos y lo que él hace no alcanza para solventarlos, para esto ella se dedica al comercio, vende ropa de todo tipo, zapatillas y bisuterías, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta en las mañanas o noches y cuenta con muy buena clientela que siempre le piden sus productos, son más de 7 años  que se dedica a esta actividad  la cual comenzó con los créditos y que ahora le permiten ganarse la vida.
Este crédito es para comprar ropa, zapatillas y bisuterías. Esta desde el inicio en el Grupo De Crédito le gusta por la ayuda que le brindan los créditos. Sus sueños son seguir mejorando su negocio y su vida familiar
texts.en:
Señoras Exitosas Communal Bank meets every two weeks in the Medardo Mora neighborhood in the city of Manta.  The city's known for its beautiful beaches that are visited year round, for its cuisine, and for being a city of unparalleled beauty with a lot of tourist attractions.

Verónica, 39, lives there.  She's married and they have three children, ages 19, 18, and 14.  They all live in her house, and the youngest one is in high school.  Verónica's husband is a taxi driver.

Verónica's someone who likes to work so she can help her husband get ahead.  They have a lot of expenses, and what he earns isn't enough to cover them all.  So Verónica works as a vendor selling all types of clothing, shoes, and costume jewelry.  She sells door-to-door en the morning or evening, and she has steady customers who always order from her.  She has been in this line of work for more than seven years.  She started with loans, which allow her to earn a living now.

This loan is to buy clothing, shoes, and costume jewelry.

Verónica has been in the communal bank since the beginning and she likes it because of the help she gets from the loans.  Her dream is to keep improving her business and her family life.

loans.use: to buy clothing, shoes, and costume jewelry

loans.name: Malika

texts.ru: Малика шьет для себя и своих клиентов национальные и европейские платья, имеет множество увлекательных идей и организует для своих клиентов интересные события. Шить на заказ Малика начала недавно. До этого шила только себе и для своей семьи. Для себя начала шить, как и многие, потому, что в магазинах нет той одежды, какая ей подходит и по фигуре, и по внутреннему ощущению. Для пошива одежды на заказ ей понадобилась новая швейная машинка. Однако со сложным финансовым положением семьи, позволить купить машинку себе она не смогла. Для покупки швейной машинки и дополнительного оборудования Малика обратилась за получением кредита, в размере 5 000 сомони. Малика верит, что с Вашей помощью она сможет все преодолеть.
texts.en: Malika sews national and European dresses for herself and her clients. She has many intriguing ideas and organizes interesting events for her clients. Malika began sewing to order recently. Prior to this, she only sewed for herself and her family. She began sewing for herself because, like for many, the shops do not have clothing that suits her figure and her inner sense. She needed a sewing machine in order to be able to sew clothes to order. However, with her family's difficult financial position she was not able to afford a sewing machine. Malika has applied for a loan of 5,000 somoni in order to buy a sewing machine and additional equipment. Malika believes that with your help she will be able to overcome everything.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine.

loans.name: Ana Cecilia

texts.es: Ana de 40 años de edad es madre soltera vive en casa propia con sus dos hijos, ella se dedica desde hace 10 años a la agricultura al cultivo de maíz y maicillo, cuando ya está su cosecha la comercializa en los pueblos aledaños, ya tiene muchos clientes fijos, Ana está solicitando un crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, herbicidas, etc. y mejorar el terreno que muestra en la fotografía para poder continuar con sus cultivos ya que esa es su única fuente de trabajo y así tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Ana, 40, is a single mother who lives in her own home with her two children.

She has earned a living for 10 years in agriculture growing corn and sorghum.  When the crop is ready she sells it in neighboring towns, and she has a lot of steady customers.

Ana's requesting a loan to buy seeds, fertilizer, soil amendments, pest controls, herbicide, and so on, and to improve the plot of land shown in the photograph.  That way she can continue with her crops, which is her only source of work, and earn more income.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer, soil amendments, pest control, herbicide, etc., and to improve her plot of land

loans.name: Pablo Enrique

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Señoras Exitosas se reúne cada 15 días en el barrio Medardo Mora en  la ciudad de Manta,  ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año, por su gastronomía y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual con muchos atractivos turísticos.
En este lugar vive don Pablo, tiene 41 años de edad, está casado y de esta relación tienen seis hijos, cuatro mayores de edad y dos de 15  y 13 años que estudian en colegio. Su esposa es ama de casa.
El señor Pablo es un hombre  muy trabajador que hace lo posible para darles lo necesario a su familia, él hace mas de 11 años se dedica a la venta de ceviches y encebollados, tiene una carreta la cual la ubica todos los días en una de las calles principales de la ciudad,  trabaja todos los días y en ocasiones le ayudan su mujer y sus hijos, su mujer también le ayuda en la casa en la preparación de los alimentos que luego el lleva a vender en su carreta.
Este crédito es para comprar pescado, yuca, sodas y otros víveres para preparar los alimentos. Esta desde el inicio  en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos le permiten ir mejorando su negocio.  Sus sueños son tener un gran local.
texts.en:
Señoras Exitosas Communal Bank meets every two weeks in the Medardo Mora neighborhood in the city of Manta.  The city's known for beautiful beaches that attract visitors year round, for its cuisine, and for being a city of unparalleled beauty with a lot of tourist attractions.

Pablo, 41, lives there.  He's married and they have six children, four adults and two students, ages 15 and 13.  His wife's a homemaker.

Pablo's a very hardworking man who does everything he can to give his family what they need.  He has sold ceviche and encebollado [fish stew] for more than 11 years.  He has a cart he sets up on one of the city's main streets every day.  He works every day, sometimes helped by his wife and children.  His wife also helps him at home preparing the food, which he then takes out to sell from his cart.

This loan is to buy fish, yuca, soda, and other provisions to prepare the food.

Pablo has been in the communal bank since the beginning and he likes it because the loans allow him to keep improving his business.  His dream is to have a great sales space.

loans.use: to buy fish, yuca, soda, and other provisions

loans.name: Castor

texts.en:
Castor owns a farm in Alegria, Bohol. He grows bell peppers to earn an income. This has been his business for 20 years now.

Castor is asking a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides to keep his plants healthy. He hopes to grow more plants and varieties to have a better profit and maximize his land. In the future, he plans to expand his business and make it more profitable and sustainable. Castor is 51 years old.

loans.use: to  buy fertilizer and pesticides

loans.name: Ashirbu

texts.ru: Аширбу, 60 лет, замужем, есть 2 сына, старший на заработках, младший помогает по хозяйству. У Аширбу среднее образование, уже 20 лет занимается животноводством, в качестве стартового капитала у Аширбу было всего 10,000 сомов (KGS). Сегодня в хозяйстве Аширбу есть 6 коров, 20 овец, 4 лошади. Ее ежемесячный доход составляет в среднем 30,000 сомов (KGS). Аширбу обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом в сумме 150,000 сом (KGS), на который она купит овец для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита позволят Аширбу развить ее деятельность.
texts.en: Ashirbu is 60 years old, married, and has two sons. Her elder son works abroad, and the younger son helps on the farm. Ashirbu has a secondary education. She has been rearing animals for 20 years. Ashirbu had 10,000 som (KGS) of starting capital. Today Ashirbu has six cows, 20 sheep, and four horses. Her average monthly income is 30,000 som (KGS). Ashirbu has applied to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 150,000 som (KGS) with which she will buy some sheep to increase her herd. The proceeds of the loan will enable Ashirbu to develop her business.

loans.use: to buy some sheep in order to increase her herd.

loans.name: Santiago

texts.es: Don Santiago de 59 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa, el se dedica al cultivo de granos básicos y jocotes desde hace 41 años, experiencia que le ha dado la oportunidad de tener un buen cultivo por esa razón posee muchos clientes y con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas es como puede salir adelante, el está solicitando un crédito para la compra de insumos agrícolas como abonos, controles de plagas, herbicidas, fertilizantes y semillas para asistir sus cultivos y asi tener una buena cosecha.
texts.en: Don Santiago is 59 years old and lives in his home with his wife.  He has cultivated basic grains and jocotes (a fruit) for 41 years, experience which has given him the opportunity to have a good harvest.  For this reason, he has many clients and can use the earnings from his sales to move forward.  He is asking for a loan to buy agricultural supplies such as compost, plague-control, herbicides, fertilizers, and seeds to help his plants and have a good harvest.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies such as compost, plague-controls, herbicides, fertilizers, and seeds.

loans.name: Mariem

texts.en: Mariem is married to a farmer and has four daughters. The income from farming is very small and cannot cover the family's monthly expenses. Mariem started a livestock fattening project to increase her income and improve the living conditions of her family. She is requesting a 5,000 EGP loan to buy five animals such as goats and lambs.

loans.use: to buy five animals such as goats and lambs.

loans.name: Emerita Esmeralda

texts.es: Emerita de 30 años de edad es madre soltera vive en casa propia con sus padres y su hijo, ella se dedica a la venta de empanadas y verduras desde hace 3 años, también se dedica a la agricultura, su negocio lo tiene ubicado en su lugar de residencia y tiene muchos clientes por ser un producto muy vendible, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de plátanos, leche, azúcar, entre otros ingredientes para continuar con la venta de empanadas y tener mejores ingresos económicos.
texts.en: Emerita is a 30 year old single mother and lives in her home with her parents and son.  For 3 years, she has made a living selling empanadas and vegetales.   She also woks in agriculture.  Her business is located in her residence and she has many clients because her products sell well.  She is requesting a loan to buy plantains, milk, sugar, and other ingredientes to continue selling empanadas and have better income.

loans.use: to buy plantains, milk and sugar, among other ingredients.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: El joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 22 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo, se dedica al cultivo de granos básicos y jocotes desde hace 5 años y también trabaja en una granja avícola, con lo que obtiene de su trabajo es como logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, el joven vive en casa propia con su compañera de vida y su hijo, el esta solicitado un crédito para la compra de abono, herbicida, insecticidas, controles de plagas, etc. y así poder tener mejores ingreso económicos para una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
The young man who has had his face pixelated for being 22 years old and living in a high risk area has worked cultivating basic grains and jocotes (tropical fruit) for 5 years. He also works on a poultry farm. He manages to cover some of the household costs with what he obtains from his work. 

He lives in his own home with his life partner and their son. He is requesting this loan to buy fertilizer, herbicide, insecticide, pesticide, etc. In this way he can have better financial earnings for a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, herbicide, insecticide, pesticide, etc.

loans.name: Rabecca

texts.en: Rabecca is a Babban Gona maize farmer from Dogon Awo Village. She joined Babban Gona to create a better life for her children. In the past, Rabecca suffered from poor yields that crippled her ability to improve her farming skills. Now that she has joined Babban Gona, Rabecca has the chance to attain yields of up to 30 bags of maize/hectare, double the national average in Nigeria and earn an income of up to $2,000/hectare. Through Babban Gona’s input loan, she will have access to high-quality farm inputs such as fertilizers, herbicides, and improved seeds that will increase her yields and income considerably. With ambitious goals of harvesting 35 bags of maize this year, Rabecca can now ensure that her children get a post secondary school education.

loans.use: to purchase improved farm inputs that will increase farm yields.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en: Victoria is 48 years old and resides in Alegria, Cebu. She is married with a fifteen-year-old daughter. She has been engaged in raising hogs and a sari-sari (general) store business for twenty-five years now. She is asking for a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy piglets, feed, canned goods, toiletries, seasoning and condiments. She is determined to make the most of her business so that she can keep her child in school. In the future, she hope to make her business a success.

loans.use: to buy piglets, feed, canned goods, toiletries, seasoning and condiments

loans.name: Germaine

texts.fr:
Germaine est une mère de famille dynamique et travailleuse de 30 ans. Et elle est mariée. Ils ont deux enfants de 7 et 10 ans qui sont tous scolarisés dans une bonne école privée. Ils leurs voudraient de la bonne base dans le domaine de l'éducation.
Germaine exerce avec son mari une activité de vente des ustensiles de cuisine pour soutenir leur petite famille. Ils savent s'entraider pour entretenir l'activité. Elle est dans ce secteur depuis l'an 2000. Et elle tient vraiment à cette activité qui lui a beaucoup permis d'améliorer la qualité de vie de la famille: scolariser ses enfants, payer régulièrement le loyer, acheter et renouveler les meubles dans sa maison, constituer des épargnes, etc...
Son objectif est de développer encore et étendre son affaire afin de pouvoir continuer à améliorer le niveau de vie de sa petite famille.
texts.en: Germaine is a dynamic and hardworking 30-year old mother. She is married, and with her husband they have two children aged 7 and 10 years who are both attending a good private school. The parents want them to have a good educational foundation. Germaine and her husband carry out the sale of kitchen utensils in order to support their little family. They know to help each other out in order to sustain their activity. She is in this sector since the year 2000. She greatly cares about this activity which has allowed her to improve her family's quality of life: schooling for her children, regular rent payment, purchase and upgrade of her household furniture, accumulate some savings, etc... Her objective is the further development and extending of her trade in order to continue to improve the standard of living of her little family.

loans.use: to buy kitchen utensils and hardware items

loans.name: Juanita

texts.en:
Juanita is from Dumanjug, Cebu. She is 55 years old and relies on fish vending and raising hogs to support the needs of her family. She is asking for a loan of PHP 30,000 to buy feed and fresh fish to sell and to pay tuition. She is gratified with how her business is thriving. Her income will be used to pay for the schooling of her youngest child who is 14 years old.

In the future, Juanita plans to expand her business and buy more piglets to raise for a better income.

loans.use: to buy feed and fresh fish to sell and to pay tuition

loans.name: El Paraiso Group

texts.en:
Roughly 2 and ½ hours directly west of Panajachel rests the city of Santa Clara La Laguna, Guatemala. A brisk breeze hits you as you step out of the shuttle bus onto to the steep sloping roads that lead you in various directions. A stone’s throw away and you will land in the meeting grounds of “El Paraíso” or “The Paradise”, a trust bank that has been with Friendship Bridge for over 15 years. 

“El Paraíso” is an extremely gregarious group that keeps the mood light and the smiles wide. Elected as the group’s president is Rosa, who has built and maintained a business as a seamstress that has helped fully educate each of her children. The strong leader kept returning to how much the loans she received helped her business and with the profits she has been able to purchase materials for her children to study and be properly nourished while doing so.  With the new loan, Rosa plans to purchase new fabric, clothing, and better materials to attend to the demands of her business. 
 
Aside from the loan, Rosa and the other members will receive a non-formal education that touches on all aspects of self-development/empowerment as a part of the Friendship Bridge Micro Credit Plus program, which allows the women of “El Paraíso” and other trust  bank groups to grow both as an entrepreneur and also increase their knowledge on topics like health, business, family, and specific topics about women.  

The trust bank Paraíso appreciates the confidence of Kiva investors for giving them the opportunity to pursue development for their small businesses through microcredit.

loans.use: to purchase new fabric, clothing, and better materials for her embroidery business.

loans.name: Lili

texts.en: Lili is 65 years old. She lives in the Ozurgeti district with her husband and son. The family is involved in agricultural activities. In particular, they have a plot of agricultural land where they grow maize and nut trees. They sell the harvest seasonally. Lili wants to build a greenhouse and requested a loan. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo enables her to get a loan of 1000 GEL. With the received credit Lili will build a greenhouse and will grow vegetables. She will sell the harvest twice a year and will increase her income. Lili awaits your support.

loans.use: to build a greenhouse

loans.name: Bonifacia

texts.en: Bonifacia is from the municipality of Dumanjug in Cebu.. She is 43 years old with two children, ages 15 and 20. Bonifacia is an owner of a sari-sari (variety) store which is attached to her home. She also raises hogs for an income. She has been in business for seven years now. She is asking a loan of 12,000 PHP to buy feed, rice and canned goods. Bonifacia plans to expand and improve her store someday to increase her customer base and increase profitability.

loans.use: to buy feed, rice and canned goods

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is from Alcantara, Cebu. She is married with four adult children. Lolita finds joy in attending to her sari-sari (general) store business for 10 years now. Mildred is requesting a loan of PHP 20,000 to stock her store with items such as canned goods, feed, candies, biscuits, chips, shoe polish, insect repellent, bleaching agent and matches.
In the future, she hopes to keep her store with high a inventory level to keep her customers coming.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, feed, candies, biscuits, chips, shoe polish, insect repellent, bleaching agent and matches

loans.name: Linda

texts.en: Linda is from the town of Alcantara in Cebu.  She is 55 years old and has operated a sari-sari (general) store in her community for 20 years. She sells household basic commodities like detergent, seasoning, toiletries, chips, canned goods and soft drinks. She is asking for a loan to buy more items to resell, like coffee, sugar, toiletries, canned goods, noodles, insect repellent, feed and rice and to pay tuition. These items are in high demand and sell well on a daily basis. With a loan, Linda is confident that her sari-sari business will be more prosperous.
