She will use her profits for the school fees of her youngest child, who is 12 years old.

loans.use: to buy coffee, sugar, toiletries, canned goods, noodles, insect repellent, feed, and rice and to pay tuition.

loans.name: Yolanda Marina

texts.es:
Yolanda mujer ecuatoriana nació en Latacunga, perteneciente a la parroquia Mulalo del cantón Latacunga perteneciente a la provincia de Cotopaxi de la República del Ecuador tiene 45  años de edad, es madre soltera pues el padre de sus hijos los abandonó desde hace muchos años , tiene tres hijos pero dos de ellos son ya mayores de edad, solo la ultima hija vive con ella en casa de la madre , que esta ubicada en un sector extremadamente rural de la ciudad  conocido como Pucará, este sector es muy reconocido porque su gente se dedica a la ganadería y a la agricultura.  Yolanda  ha demostrado ser una mujer luchadora y emprendedora, con el esfuerzo y sacrifico de sus padres pudo terminar la secundaria, ya que desde que terminó el colegio tuvo que trabajar.
Por la falta de recursos económicos en un inicio  tuvo que buscar la manera de solventar y ayudar a su esposo en los gastos, y empezó a criar animales, esto era ya una gran ayuda para su familia, después Yolanda descubrió un don y decido ponerse a criar y vender animales menores y la producción de leche. Por el momento solicita un crédito para invertir en el emprendimiento de su negocio.
Hoy Yolanda  quiere extender un sincero agradecimiento y felicitación a Fundación Alternativa en Ecuador y a Kiva por hacer posible el crecimiento en su vida laboral y personal.
texts.en:
Yolanda is an Ecuadorian woman born in Latacunga, belonging to the Mulalo parish of  canton Latacunga which belongs to the Cotopaxi province of the Republic of Ecuador.  She is 45 years old and a single mother because the father of her children abandoned many years ago. Yolanda has three children but two of them are grown. Only her youngest daughter lives with her in her mother's house, which is located in an extremely rural area of ​​the city known as Pucara.  This sector is highly recognized because its people are dedicated to livestock and agriculture. Yolanda has proven to be a fighter and enterprising woman.  
     With the effort and sacrifice of her parents, Yolanda finished high school.  Since she finished school, she had to work due to  lack of economic resources.  Initially she had to find ways to solve and help her husband with the expenses, and she began breeding animals, this was already a great help to her family.  After that Yolanda discovered a gift and decided to begin raising and selling small animals and to produce milk . For now she is requesting a loan to invest in her business venture.
 Today, Yolanda wants to extend a sincere thanks and congratulations to Alternative Foundation in Ecuador and Kiva for making the growth in her work and personal life possible.

loans.use: To start her business raising  small animals thus making possible the growth of her work and personal life.

loans.name: Hajaniaina Livasoa

texts.fr:
Hajanirina Livasoa est un père de famille consciencieux de 47 ans. Il est marié et a trois enfants dont un déjà marié et le dernier , âgé de 6 ans est scolarisé dans une école privée.
Hajanirina et sa femme exercent ensemble une activité de vente de produits alimentaires (épicerie) pour entretenir la famille. Ils sont très solidaires surtout lorsqu'il est question du bien-être de la famille. Madame était femme de ménage auparavant et Monsieur employé dans une entreprise, et depuis 2009, ils ont décidé ensemble de démarrer l'épicerie pour le bien de la famille.
L'objectif, le but, la priorité de ce père de famille est d'offrir une meilleur qualité de vie à sa famille, tant sur le plan social que sur le plan économique, donc d'améliorer son activité.
texts.en: Hajanirina Livasoa is a conscientious 47-year-old family man. He is married with three children, one of whom is already married and his youngest, aged six, is currently attending a private school. Together with his wife, Hajanirina sells food products (groceries) in order to support his family. They both put up a united front, especially when it comes to their family's well-being. His wife used to work as a cleaning lady and Hajanirina used to work for a business. In 2009, they both decided to start up a grocery stand to support their family. The goal for this head of the family is to offer his family a better quality of life, both socially as well as economically. In order to do this, he wishes to improve his business.

loans.use: to purchase biscuits, sweets and chocolates, as well as cooking utensils and cutlery

loans.name: Ddc Group

texts.en:
Jamila, who is in her early 20s, is married with two children, one in school and the other still too young for school.  She has been running a gengeduka business. She works from 8 a.m. to 9 p.m. daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Jamila's third loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loans to increase her gengeduka stock and has paid them back successfully. She used the profit to pay school fees, repay the loan and cover household expenses.  She will use this loan to increase the gengeduka stock and serve more customers. She dreams of growing her gengeduka business.

Jamila will share this loan with her loan group Ddc, which has three members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to increase the gengeduka stock and serve more customers.

loans.name: Cristina

texts.es:
La señora  Cristina de 54 años de edad es casada  y no  tiene hijos  que dependen de ella, vive en una comunidad de Valle  al sur de Honduras y tiene casa propia, se dedica desde hace 19 años  al cultivo de maíz y frijoles.
Doña Cristina también cultiva café y marañón este negocio lo realiza con la ayuda de su familia y también contrata para sembrar y limpiar a varios empleados,  ella también recibe ingresos de sus hijos que viven en el exterior. 
Doña Cristina es una persona emprendedora que  está solicitando el préstamo para la compra de cemento, arena, grava, laminas, etc. para terminar de mejorar  su casa y con la ayuda uno de sus hijos está terminando de  y el préstamo desea logarlo.
Uno de sus  sueños es mejorar es que su negocio siga creciendo.

San Lorenzo, Honduras -  Mayo del 2015.
texts.en:
Señora Cristina is 54 years old, married, and does not have children who depend on her.  She lives in a community in Valle in southern Honduras and has her own house.  For 19 years she has made a living by growing corn and beans.

Doña Cristina also grows coffee and cashews, which she does with the help of her family.  She also hires various employees to plant and clean.  In addition, she receives income from her children who live abroad.

Doña Cristina is an enterprising person who is requesting the loan in order to buy cement, sand, gravel, sheet metal, etc. in order to finish improving her house.  One of her children is helping with the completion and she wants to accomplish this with the loan.

One of Cristina's dreams is to improve so that her business can continue growing.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - May 2015.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, gravel, sheet metal, etc., in order to finish improving her house that also is the place where she runs her business

loans.name: Ritchel

texts.en: Thirty-four-year-old Ritchel is a sari-sari store owner from the community of Alegria, Cebu. She also farms rice for additional income. She is married with two children aged three and ten. Ritchel has been selling basic items to the community for ten years now, earning her PHP 4000 per month. She is asking for a loan to increase her inventory and to attract more customers. She will use it to buy biscuits, chocolate bars, candies, vinegar, chips, shampoo, bath soap and fertilizer. Ritchel knows how a store that looks full attracts more buyers than the ones that lack display. Ritchel plans to make her store bigger for better profitability.

loans.use: to buy biscuits, chocolate bars, candies, vinegar, chips, shampoo, bath soap and fertilizer

loans.name: Famille Bora Group

texts.fr:
Imitant ses parents, Michel est devenu riziculteur en l'an 2000. Il avait constaté que cette activité était rentable car ils leur permettaient de subvenir tant soit peu à leurs besoins sociaux(scolarité, habitat, alimentation,...). Souvent, le manque de moyens handicape l'entretien de champs également les maladies du paddy et les oiseaux ravageurs; toutefois avec une bonne récolte, il pourra facilement scolariser ses enfants, construire une maison et initier au besoin une activité de petit commerce et d'élevage.
Président du groupe FAMILIA BORA, il tient sur la photo un carnet rose.
texts.en: Following in his parents' footsteps, Michel started growing rice back in 2000. He had noticed that this activity was profitable as it allowed them to meet their relatively limited social needs (school fees, home costs and food). A lack of means often handicap the upkeep of their fields, as well as diseases infecting the rice paddies and scavenging birds. However, with a good harvest, he will be able to easily give his children an education, build his own house and start up a small-scale retail and livestock business if needs be. Michel is also the president of the Famille Bora Group. He is the man holding the pink booklet in the photo.

loans.use: to pay for the labour costs to maintain and harvest their plot of land, as well as purchase fertiliser and phytosanitary products

loans.name: Suglo Kongbo - Nyong Nayili Group

texts.en: Damu is a 45-year-old married woman with four children. Damu belongs to a shea nut and butter processing group called Suglo Kongbo - Nyong-Nayili in the northern region of Ghana. Damu is the person pictured seated with the hand raised, among her group mates. She has a good market for her products and wants to earn more income from her business. Damu and Suglo Kongbo - Nyong-Nayili have requested a loan of GHS 10,200.00. Her share of the loan is GHS 400.00, which she would use to buy shea nuts for processing. Damu intends to repay the loan and support her children. Damu is thankful to Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: To buy shea nuts for processing.

loans.name: Madeline

texts.en:
Madeline lives in Alegria, Cebu with her husband and three children, ages one, six and eight. She has been selling fresh fish in her neighborhood while her husband drives a motorcycle called "habal-habal" to earn an income. They both work hard for their children. She is asking for a loan to pay for a motorcycle down payment for a new motorcycle. She is confident that with a new unit, her husband will be more productive and can earn a better income everyday.

In the future, she hopes to expand her business and make it more successful.

loans.use: to buy fresh fish and pay for a down payment on a motorcycle.

loans.name: Tanteraka Harivelo

texts.fr:
Tanteraka Harivelo est un père de famille de 41 ans. Il est marié et ils ont trois enfants dont deux, qui sont âgés de 13 et 8 ans, sont scolarisés dans des écoles privées.
Tanteraka Harivelo exerce deux activités génératrices de revenu, c'est un homme qui cherche toujours à augmenter son revenu afin de pouvoir améliorer le niveau de vie de sa famille. Il vends des cordes en nylon et quelques appareils électroniques. Puis, il effectue de l’élevage de porc.. C'est sa femme pour l'aider qui tient l'un des points de vente des cordes en nylon.
Son désire est de développer son affaire afin d'améliorer son économie. Il souhaite ainsi construire sa propre maison.
texts.en: Tanteraka Harivelo is 41 years old. He is a married father to three children, two of whom, aged eight and 13 years old, are currently attending private schools. Tanteraka Harivelo carries out two revenue-generating activities. He is a man who is always searching to increase his income in order to improve his family's living standards. He sells nylon rope and electronic devices. He also rears pigs. His wife assists him in the rope selling business by running one of his stalls. His desire is to further develop his business so he can increase his savings. This way, he hopes to be able to build his own home.

loans.use: to purchase nylon rope, radios, boards and batteries

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en: Sarah lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is single with two children and all go to school. She takes care of one additional family member. She is a tailor. She has been in this business for two years. She works seven days a week. She has requested a loan from MCDT – SACCO to buy materials for making clothes. Her major challenge includes the seasonality of materials for clothes. Her goal and aspiration is to buy an electric sewing machine. She lives in her own house and the family has access to electricity but does not have access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees.

loans.use: To buy materials for making clothes

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 43 years old from Alegria, Cebu. She is married with four children. Her oldest is 17 and her youngest is 10. Five years ago, Jocelyn started raising hogs. Her business is thriving but since she is also supporting four dependents she needs additional capital to keep it going. She is asking a loan of PHP 3000 to buy feed.

Jocelyn hopes that in the future her business will continue to flourish and give her family a comfortable life.

loans.use: to buy feed

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
Cristina is a vegetable vendor from the town of Alegria, Bohol. She sells vegetables such as carrots, string beans, squash, bitter gourds, ginger, eggplant and christophine (chayote). She just started this business seven months ago and this allows her to earn an income of PHP 3000 per month. She is asking for a loan to buy more stock of vegetables to sell like squash, eggplants, bitter gourds, ginger, garlic and bell peppers.

Cristina is 42 years old with two children ages 16 and 19. Her income will be for their education and the family's daily consumption.

loans.use: to  buy squash, eggplants, bitter gourds, ginger, garlic and bell peppers.

loans.name: Flor María

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Señoras Exitosas se reúne cada 15 días en el barrio Medardo Mora en  la ciudad de Manta,  ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año, por su gastronomía y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual con muchos atractivos turísticos.
En este lugar vive la señora Flor, tiene 26 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres  hijos de 9 y 7 años  y un bebé de 3 meses de edad, los dos mayores  estudian en escuela. Su esposo es diseñador grafico.
Doña Flor se dedica al comercio, vende ropa de todo tipo, carteras, perfumes, sobrecamas, entre otros productos, ella viaja a Guayaquil  a comprar la mercadería ya que allá consigue mejor variedad de prendas lo cual le favorece ya que lo que trae lo vende muy rápido, deja  a crédito y cobra cada ocho días. Tiene más de 5  años que se dedica a esta actividad con la cual  se gana algo por el bien familiar.
Este crédito es para comprar ropa, zapatos, perfumes, sobrecamas, entre otras cosas. Lleva 3 ciclos en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos son rápidos y a bajos intereses. Sus sueños es que sus hijos tengan una buena educación.
texts.en:
The Credit Group Ladies Success (El Grupo De Crédito Señoras Exitosas) meets every 15 days in the neighborhood of Medardo Mora in the city of Manta. City is known for its beautiful beaches that are visited year round, for its gastronomy and for exquisite beauty with many tourist attractions.

This is where Flor lives. She is 26 years old, married and has three children at the ages of 9, 7 and 3 months old. The two older children study in school. Her husband is a graphic designer.

Flor makes living selling all kinds of clothing, handbags, perfumes, bedspreads, among other products. She travels to Guayaquil to buy goods because there are better varieties of garments. She prefers them because they sell very fast. She buys them with credit and pays off every eight days. It has been more than five years in this work so that she can earn something for her family expenses.

Flor requests a loan to buy clothes, shoes, perfumes, bedspreads, among other things. This is her 3rd cycle in the Group. She likes it because the loans are fast and have low interest rates. She hopes for her children to obtain a good education.

loans.use: to buy clothes, shoes, perfumes, bedspreads etc.

loans.name: Nadia

texts.en: Nadia is married and has three daughters and two sons. Her husband is a part-time farmer and she runs a small grocery store that she started to help her husband with the family income. Nadia is requesting a 3,000 EGP loan to buy grocery products such as pasta, rice and oil to increase her sales for her family.

loans.use: To buy grocery products such as pasta, rice and oil.

loans.name: Irimiya

texts.en:
Irimiya is a Babban Gona farmer from Kanakargo Village. Irimiya joined Babban Gona to become a better farmer.

Through Babban Gona’s input loan, Irimiya will have access to top-of-the-range farm inputs such as fertilizers, herbicides, and improved seeds. This loan will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize per hectare, double the 14 bags per hectare earned by the average Nigerian smallholder maize farmer.

With the opportunity to earn high yields and increase his net income, Irimiya would like to use his extra earnings to buy maize grinding machines.

loans.use: to purchase improved farm inputs that will increase his yields.

loans.name: Nasiru

texts.en: Nasiru is a Babban Gona maize farmer from Makwalla Village. Nasiru joined Babban Gona to create a better life for his children. In the past, Nasiru suffered from poor yields that crippled his ability to repair his house. Through Babban Gona’s input loan, Nasiru will have access to the best farm inputs in the market such as fertilizer, herbicide and improved seed that will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize per hectare, more than double the Nigerian national average of 14 bags. This will see him increase his household income considerably. Thanks to Babban Gona's support, Nasiru now has the opportunity to increase his yields and income and use his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: To purchase improved farm inputs that will increase the farmer’s yields

loans.name: Markus

texts.en:
Markus is a Babban Gona maize farmer from Kyasge Village. Markus joined Babban Gona to expand his farm and grow his agricultural business.

Through Babban Gona’s input loan, Markus will have access to the best farm inputs in the market, such as fertilizers, herbicides, and improved seeds that will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize per hectare, double the Nigerian national average of 14 bags. This will see him increase his household income considerably.

Thanks to Babban Gona's support, Markus now has the opportunity to increase his yields and income and use his extra earnings for a better home for his family.

loans.use: to purchase improved farm inputs that will increase his yields.

loans.name: Tuganane Group

texts.en:
Zuhura, who is in her mid-forties, is single with two children who are still at school. She has been selling fish for eight years now. She works from 8:00 a.m. to 9:00 p.m. daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Zuhura’s first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She will use this loan to increase her stock of fish and meet her customers’ demand. She dreams of having a big fish market.

Zuhura will share this loan with her loan group, Tuganane, which has five members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to increase her stock of fish and meet her customers' demand.

loans.name: Adamu

texts.en:
Adamu is a Babban Gona farmer from Garu Village. Adamu joined Babban Gona to become a better farmer.

Through Babban Gona’s input loan, Adamu will have access to top-of-the-range farm inputs such as fertilizers, herbicides, and improved seeds. This loan will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize per hectare, double the 14 bags per hectare earned by the average Nigerian smallholder maize farmer.

With the opportunity to earn high yields and increase his net income, Adamu would like to use his extra earnings to buy a house.

loans.use: to purchase improved farm inputs that will increase his yields.

loans.name: Ahmed

texts.en: Ahmed is a Babban Gona farmer from Makwalla Village. Ahmed joined Babban Gona to become a better farmer. Through Babban Gona’s input loan, Ahmed will have access to top-of-the-range farm inputs such as fertilizers, herbicides, and improved seeds. This loan will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize per hectare, double the 14 bags per hectare earned by the average Nigerian smallholder maize farmer. With the opportunity to earn high yields and increase his net income, Ahmed would like to use his extra earnings to acquire more land to put in Babban Gona program.

loans.use: To purchase improved farm inputs that will increase his maize yields

loans.name: Omar Eliceo

texts.es: Omar de 34 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa y sus tres hijos, él se dedica al cultivo de granos básicos (maíz y frijol) desde hace 8 años,  adicional a eso también  trabaja en estructuras metálicas,  con las ventas que realiza de sus productos agrícolas es como puede salir adelante, el está solicitando un crédito para la compra de abono, herbicida, insecticidas, semillas etc.  y asi poder asistir mejorar a sus cultivos y el tendrá una buena cosecha para ser comercializada.
texts.en:
Omar is 34 years old and lives in his own house with his wife and three children. He makes living growing basic grains (corn and beans) for 8 years. In addition, he works in metal structures. He can get ahead with the sales of agricultural products. 

He requests a loan to buy fertilizer, herbicides, insecticides, seeds etc. These will help improve his crops and a good harvest to be marketed.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, herbicides, insecticides, seeds etc.

loans.name: Abelino

texts.es:
Abelino es un hombre de 53 años de edad, es soltero y tiene una linda familia de nueve hijos de las edades entre 10 y 35 años, esta humilde familia vive en una comunidad de Santo Tomas la Unión.
Abelino con el afán de obtener sus ingresos y sacar adelante a su familia trabaja como jornalero de un potrero, él tiene quince años de realizar la actividad, pero para mejorar sus ingresos por las mañanas se dedica a la venta de leche de vaca, a este humilde hombre trabajar con animales es su más grande pasión, por tal razón solicita un préstamo para la crianza de pescado tilapia.
El gran sueño de Abelino es comprar un terreno  para luego heredarles a sus hijos para que construyan sus casas.
texts.en:
Abelino is a 53-year-old man, unmarried and with a beautiful family of five children aged between 10 and 35. This humble family lives in a community in Santo Tomas La Unión.

With the intention of obtaining income and providing for his family, Abelino works as a day labourer for a cattle-herder. He has been doing this for 15 years, but in order to improve his income he sells cows' milk in the mornings. Working with animals is this humble gentleman's greatest passion, and it is for this reason that he is asking for a loan to rear tilapia fish.

Abelino's great dream is to buy some land that he can later pass on to his children for them to build their houses on.

loans.use: to rear tilapia fish.

loans.name: Kpanmanga Bimbilla - Gumbihini Group

texts.en:
Mariam is a 45-year-old woman from Bimbilla, in the northern region of Ghana. She is married, with five children. Mariam is the person pictured sitting in the middle with the hand raised among her group mates. Mariam is a member of a rice processing group that has been business for the past seven years. The name of the group is ‘Kpangmanga Bimbilla, Gunbihini’. She earns a good profit from the business, as the group has been trained by Grameen Ghana on how to process quality rice for the local market. 

Mariam and ‘Kpangmanga Gunbihini, Bimbilla’ have requested for a loan of GHS 17300.00. Mariam’s share of the loan is GHS 500.00, which she would use to buy paddy rice from local farmers for processing. She wants to earn more income to repay this loan and help her support her children in school. Mariam is highly grateful to Kiva lenders and hope to sustain their relationship with Grameen Ghana and Kiva.

loans.use: To buy paddy rice from local farmers for processing and so support her children's education

loans.name: Albertine

texts.fr:
Albertine est une femme travailleuse infatigable de 56 ans. Elle est mariée et il travaille avec elle dans l'exercice de son activité. Ils n'ont qu'un enfant qui est actuellement étudiant à l'université.
Albertine exerce une activité de vente de friperie et ceci depuis très long temps, depuis l'an 1988. Avant cette année elle était marchande de légumes ou plus précisément des brèdes(herbes potagères. Ce qui fait qu'elle possède beaucoup d'années d'expérience dans le domaine du commerce.
Malgré son âge avancé, elle tient encore continuer à travailler, lutter et avancer; son objectif est de développer encore  son activité afin de pouvoir continuer à contribuer au financement de l'éducation de son enfant  et de prévoir une solide retraite car elle ne recevra aucune pension.
texts.en:
Albertine is a hard-working 56 year old lady.  She is married and her husband works alongside her with the business.  They only have one child, who is currently studying at university.  Albertine sells second-hand clothes, which she has been doing for a very long time - since 1988.  Before that she sold vegetables, or more accurately pot herbs.  This means that she has many years of experience in the business sector.  

Despite her age, she still works, fighting and progressing; her aim is to further develop her business so she can continue to contribute to her child's education and ensure that she has a solid retirement as she will not receive a pension.

loans.use: to buy bags of second-hand clothes

loans.name: Jafaru Black

texts.en: Jafaru Black is a Babban Gona maize farmer from Sarki Village. Jafaru Black joined Babban Gona to create a better life for his children.  In the past, Sarki suffered from poor yields that crippled his ability to pay for his children's school fees. Now that he has joined Babban Gona, Jafaru Black has the chance to attain yields of up to 30 bags of maize/hectare, double the national average in Nigeria and earn an income of up to $2,000/hectare. Through Babban Gona’s input loan, he will have access to high-quality farm inputs such as fertilizers, herbicides, and improved seeds that will increase his yields and income considerably. Jafaru Black can now ensure that his children get a post secondary school education.

loans.use: To purchase improved farm inputs that will increase his maize yields

loans.name: Corazon De Oro Group

texts.en:
The shores of beautiful Lake Atitlan in western Guatemala have many small villages, all with predominantly indigenous Maya populations. One of the villages is Santa Cruz La Laguna, which is one of the smallest. The women of Santa Cruz La Laguna are very proud to continue to wear their beautiful and traditional clothing called “traje” and consists of a “huipil” (blouse), “corte” (wrap-around skirt), and “faja” (belt).

Ten very hardworking women of Santa Cruz la Laguna make up the membership of the Friendship Bridge Trust Bank “Corazón de Oro,” or “Golden Heart.” The majority of the women produce beautiful Mayan clothing and textiles or “traje.” Since Panajachel draws tourists from all over the world, they sometimes travel there to sell their colorful “traje.”

One of the members is Cruz, 28 years old, who was married at an early age and now has five young children. She sells textiles, principally “huipiles” and “fajas” that she makes. They are often embroidered and/or woven. She also buys articles of clothing to resell. Besides clothing, she sells fruit.

In order to grow her business, Cruz has decided to ask for a loan from Friendship Bridge to buy a large quantity and variety of quality threads, as well as more fruit to sell. Her business is of great benefit to her family since the extra income provides for two of children’s educations. She wants to provide an education for all of her children because she knows that they will have a brighter future with one.

Speaking on behalf of the other members of “Corazón de Oro,” Cruz says the group is very grateful for the confidence and trust the investors of KIVA have shown them. The loans allow the women to work and build a much better future for themselves, their children and their community. Thank you, Kiva investors!

loans.use: to buy a large quantity and variety of quality threads, as well as more fruit to sell

loans.name: Maria Eugenia

texts.es: María de 37 años de edad habita en casa propia junto a su esposo y su hijo de 13 años de edad al que ha logrado sacar adelante con mucho esfuerzo.  Ella posee una tienda en la que vende productos varios de consumo diario y es gracias a su amabilidad, que las personas que la conocen la recomiendan. María debido a la gran cantidad de clientes que tiene desea comprar más productos para poder surtir su mercadería y de esta manera cumplir con la demanda de productos que solicitan sus clientes, es por eso que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: frijoles, arroz, huevos, harina, jugos, golosinas, sal, azúcar, etc.
texts.en:
María, 37, owns a house where she lives with her husband and their 13-year-old son. She has managed to help her son get ahead with a lot of effort. She owns a store where she sells different everyday products. People that know her recommend her, because she is a kind person.

Due to the great amount of customers she has, María would like to buy more products and stock up her store in order to fulfill her customers’ demands. This is why she is requesting a loan from FUSAI to buy beans, rice, eggs, flour, juices, candies, salt, sugar, etc.

loans.use: to buy beans, rice, eggs, flour, juices, candies, salt, sugar, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Joel

texts.es: Don Joel de 55 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa y sus cuatro hijos, él se dedica a la  agricultura desde hace 20 años y también trabaja como albañil, cuando ya está su cosecha la comercializa en los pueblos aledaños, ya tiene muchos clientes fijos, el cliente está solicitando un crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, herbicidas, etc. y mejorar el terreno que muestra en la fotografía para poder continuar con sus cultivos ya que esa es su única fuente de trabajo y así tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Mr. Joel is 55 yeas of age and lives in his own home with his wife and their four children. He has been making a living in agriculture for the past 20 years and also works as a builder. When his harvest is done he sells it in adjacent towns, having many regular customers. 
He is requesting a loan to purchase seeds, fertilizers, compost, plague controls, herbicides, etc. He will also invest it in improving the terrain which appears in the picture. This will all be in order for him to continue his farming, as this is his only source of work, and in this way attain a better income.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers, compost, plague controls, herbicides, etc. and to improve the terrain.

loans.name: Sonia Yamileth

texts.es:
Sonia, estudio hasta séptimo grado, está casada y su pareja trabaja de jardinero, tiene dos hijos que viven en casa, pero solo su hija mayor estudia y tambien vive con ella un hijastro.

Sonia, trabaja con ganado de repasto bovino, lo ha hecho por más de 3 años y lo aprendio de su suegro y decidio hacerlo para buscar un dinero extra, para ayudarle a su esposo con los gastos del hogar; antes solo se dedicaba a los oficios domesticos.

Sonia, necesita el crédito para comprar ganado de repasto bovino, con esto tendra más ganado y le generara mayor ganancia.

Sus sueños son, seguir trabajando lo mejor que se pueda, para que sus hijos puedan tener una buena educación.
texts.en:
Sonia studied up to the seventh grade. She is married and her partner works as a gardener. She has two children who live with her, but only her eldest daughter goes to school. She also lives with a stepson.

Sonia works raising cattle. She has done this for more than three years, taught by her father-in-law. She decided to do it thinking of receiving extra income to help her husband with the home expenses. Before, she worked taking care of the household chores.

Sonia needs this loan to buy cattle. She will have more animals and her profits will increase.

Her dreams are to continue working as much as she can so that her children can have access to a good education.

loans.use: to buy cattle.

loans.name: Maura Jaqueline

texts.es:
Cada 15 días se reúne el Grupo De Crédito Alegría Del Futuro en Lodana que  es un hermoso valle en Portoviejo, lo fuerte de la zona es la agricultura, existen sembríos de maíz y  arroz. Además se desarrolla la ganadería y en gastronomía tiene variedad de platos típicos, también sus habitantes se dedican a la venta de frutas.
En este lugar vive la señora Maura, tiene 25 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene un hijo de 2 años. El cónyuge es animador de eventos y oficial de albañilería. Viven en casa propia. Ella estudia en la Universidad.
Doña Maura es un ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos se dedica a la venta de ropa y productos de Yanbal (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Trabaja tres días a la semana de dos a tres horas al día, ella deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada ocho días. Tiene tres años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien, lo que más vende son los perfumes y cosméticos.
Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas, cosméticos y ropa. Está en el  Grupo De Crédito hace un año y le gustan las charlas educativas y los créditos adicionales como créditos emergentes y escolares. Su sueño es terminar la carrera de sistemas.
texts.en:
The Alegría Del Futuro communal bank meets every 15 days in Lodana which is a beautiful valley in Portoviejo. The area's strength is agriculture. They have corn and rice crops. They also raise cattle and have a variety of traditional dishes as cuisine. Its inhabitants also work selling fruit. 

Maura lives in this place. She is 25 years old and maintains a civil union from which she has a 2 year old son. Her spouse is an event announcer and a mason. They live in their own home. She studies at the university. 

Maura is a housewife who works selling clothes and Yanbal products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes and women's accessories) to gain her own resources. She works three days a week for two to three hours per day. She sells her products on credit and collects every eight days. She has been doing this work for three years and it is going very well for her. Perfumes and cosmetics are what she sells the most of. 

This loan is to buy perfumes, creams, cosmetics and clothing. She has been in the communal bank for one year. She likes the educational talks and the additional loans like emergency and school loans. Her dream is to complete a career in systems.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, creams, cosmetics and clothing.

loans.name: Buana

texts.en:
Buana is an artisan from Indonesia who specializes in handmade jewelry. He would like to invest in a bulk purchase of silver and gemstones.

Buana has been selling through NOVICA since 2006. This is his story:

Buana shares his passion for his art: "I've been surrounded by handicrafts all my life. I am thankful to God for giving me such a great gift so I can make a living for my family. Not much, perhaps, but enough for our simple way of life."

"With my humble heart, I want to send thanks to all of you who give me support with this loan. This allows me to give more work to my team and craft new products. I hope you will like the new designs that I will prepare. Thank you!"

Use the link below to view Buana's handmade jewelry on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/kiva/5503

loans.use: to invest in a bulk purchase of silver and gemstones.

loans.name: Ofelia

texts.en:
Ofelia has a kiosk in Atsabe, Timor-Leste where many people come to buy various groceries every day. She has been in business since 2002 and feels good about the income it brings to help her family.

Ofelia is applying for a 1000 USD loan through Kiva's field partner Tuba Rai Metin to buy additional supplies for her shop, such as noodles, candles, cigarettes, sugar, salt, milk, water, beer, fish, cooking oil and coffee. She is working to continue to build up her business.

loans.use: To buy additional stock for her shop

loans.name: Dominga

texts.es:
Dominga es una mujer de 45 años de edad, es casada tiene una linda familia de cinco hijos de las edades entre 13 y 27 años, esta humilde familia vive en una comunidad de Santa Catarina Ixtahuacán.
Dominga para sacar adelante a su familia trabaja de sol a sol vendiendo  tamales y gaseosas, este negocio lo tiene ella desde hace tres años, pero para mejorar sus ingresos también tiene quince cuerdas de plantaciones de café y banano.
Dominga desde hace algún tiempo ha pensado en cambiar el techo de su casa para darle una mejor presentación,  pero lamentablemente no le ha sido posible, por tal razón solicita un préstamo para poder comprar cielo falso, clavos y madera.
Dominga tiene el anhelo de terminar la construcción de su casa he instalar una tienda de abarrotes para mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Dominga is 45 years old, married, and has a beautiful family of five children of ages between 13 and 27. This humble family lives in a community of Santa Catarina Ixtahuacán.

In order to raise her family, Dominga works from dawn to dusk selling tamales and sodas. She has been in this business for three years. For a better income, she also has fifteen strings of coffee and banana plantations.

For some time, Dominga has been thinking about changing the roof of her house to give a better presentation. Unfortunately, it has not been possible. For that reason, she requests a loan to buy false ceiling, nails and wood.

Dominga has been eager to complete the construction of her house to install a grocery store to improve her income.

loans.use: to buy false ceiling, nails and wood.

loans.name: Claudina

texts.en:
Claudina is 24 years old. She runs a kiosk in front of her house. She earns a good income because her kiosk is located in strategic place nears a school where many people come to buy including students.

Claudina requested a loan from TRM (TubaRaiMetin) for $1.500.00, which she will use to purchase cigarettes, sugar, salt, milk, water, coffee, fish candles, slippers, and biscuits.

loans.use: to purchase cigarettes, sugar, salt, milk, water, coffee, fish candles, slippers, and biscuits

loans.name: Jhozaph's Group

texts.en:
Jhozaph, 40 years old, is a responsible mother living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. This is her fifth loan with BRAC Pakistan and her first with Kiva. 
Her husband owns a recycled material business dealing with scrap iron, aluminum, plastic bottles etc. He has been purchasing scrap goods and selling to recycling factories. Due to mounting household expenses, he does not have cash in hand to buy scrap goods and does not have scrap to sell for generating income.
Therefore, Jhozaph has requested a loan for her husband so that he can buy scrap goods, establish his enterprise, and start a savings to meet sudden needs or incidents that may occur in the future. 
Jhozaph is very impressed with this honorable support and wishes to take out more loans after the payment of this loan. She thanks Kiva and field partner, BRAC Pakistan.
Note: Jhozaph has her hand raised in the photo.

loans.use: to buy recycled materials for her husband's business.

loans.name: Nazia

texts.en:
Nazia’s husband owns a vehicle spare parts shop selling spare parts for motorbikes. He sells brake shoes, brake levers, hubs, rims, mud guards, filters, chains, headlights, batteries, etc. He has been in this business for many years and is earning a sufficient income to cover household expenses. 

Her husband is the sole support for his family. The spare parts shop is his only source of income. He estimated his future expenses and came to realize that he needs to grow his business to be able to easily cope with future expenses. Therefore, Nazia has requested a Kiva loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan to help her husband.

Nazia is the mother of four children; some of them very young and fully dependent upon their parents. She spends her whole day at home and looks after her children. She hopes that her husband will be successful in his future planning and that this loan will prove beneficial for his business. Nazia thanks Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy spare parts such as brake shoes, brake levers, hubs, rims, mud guards, filters, chains, headlights, and batteries for her husband's spare parts business.

loans.name: Abida's Group

texts.en:
Abida is 43-years old and totally devoted to her husband, who is earning a very low income. He provides sheltering services for houses under construction. He builds temporary shelters using bamboo and wooden planks that can support a concrete mixture for two weeks. Most of the work depends upon receiving a contract and most of the time he unable to get any contract for sheltering services. 
Recently, Abida's husband has gotten a huge contract but he does not have enough sheltering material to provide proper services. Abida has requested a loan so that her husband would be able to buy more sheltering material such as wooden planks, bamboo and nails to provide his best services. 
Abida is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan. She is hopeful that the Kiva lenders will support her by providing the loan.

loans.use: to buy more sheltering material such as wooden planks, bamboo and nails for her husband's sheltering services.

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena is 37 years old and has two daughters. She sells condiments. She pays rent at the place that she and her family are living. She was abandoned by her husband, so she has to take all the responsibilities by herself.

She needs a loan to buy more condiments to sell. She hopes you can help her. She is healthy, and she will do anything to give their daughters a better life.

loans.use: to buy more condiments to sell.

loans.name: Glenda

texts.en:
Glenda is a hairdresser. She works at a beauty parlor where she pays rent.

She needs a loan to buy items for the beauty parlor such as scissors, shampoo, a hair dryer, and hair dye.

Glenda also pays rent at the place where she lives with her mother and her daughter. Glenda is divorced, and she hopes you can help her because her daughter is studying and her mother is retired, so she is the only support at her home.

loans.use: to buy items for the beauty parlor such as scissors, shampoo, a hair dryer, and hair dye.

loans.name: Zilyadaini

texts.en: Zilyadaini is a Babban Gona farmer from Sarki Village. Zilyadaini joined Babban Gona to become a better farmer. Through Babban Gona’s input loan, Zilyadaini will have access to top-of-the-range farm inputs such as fertilizers, herbicides, and improved seeds. This loan will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize per hectare, double the 14 bags per hectare earned by the average Nigerian smallholder maize farmer. With the opportunity to earn high yields and increase his net income, Zilyadaini would like to use his extra earnings to acquire more land to put into Babban Gona program.

loans.use: To purchase improved farm inputs that will increase maize yields

loans.name: Jariya

texts.en:
Jariya is an artisan from Thailand who specializes in modern Thai apparel. She would like to invest in a bulk purchase of raw materials, including fabric and thread.

Jariya has been selling through NOVICA since 2007. This is her story:

Thailand's Jariya shares her love for art with her brother. "He began designing cotton clothes and received awards and recognition. One day he invited me to join him and when he saw I had developed my own skills and styles, he left me in charge. My designs focus on using natural materials and traditional techniques. We use the method of coiling thread to decorate many of our designs. It is made by hand by people from nearby villages."

"To achieve consistency in my product, I need to buy fabric and thread in bulk. This is a good time for me to prepare my items ahead of the busy selling season. With this microcredit, I won't have to worry about having the capital to make this investment.

Use the link below to view Jariya's modern Thai apparel on the NOVICA site:
<a href="http://www.novica.com/kiva/6545">http://www.novica.com/kiva/6545

loans.use: to invest in a bulk purchase of raw materials, including fabric and thread, for hand decorating by people from Thai villages

loans.name: Ramatoulaye's Group

texts.fr:
Créé le 22 Mai 2009, ce banc villageois est composé de femmes du groupement du village qui ont adhéré dans le programme afin de rendre les activités dans le petit commerce plus rentables. Une bonne ambiance anime les rencontres du groupe. 

Madame Ramatoulaye, âgée de 47 ans (assise à droite avec une main levée), est l’emprunteuse vedette du groupe. Elle est mariée et mère de 04 filles. Elle s’active dans la vente de produits alimentaires et la restauration. Elle achète des haricots et du café « Touba » dans les marchés hebdomadaires pour le revendre en détails dans son village.

Avec son nouveau prêt, elle compte acheter 20kg de haricots par semaine à 700f le kg et 5000f de café « Touba »  pour après cuisson et transformation le revendre.

Avec les bénéfices, elle compte aider son mari dans la gestion de la dépense quotidienne et s’occuper de ses enfants ( habillements , scolarité…)
texts.en:
This banc villageois was established on May 22, 2009, and is made up of a group of women from the village who joined the program in order to make their small businesses more profitable. A good atmosphere enlivens group meetings.

Mrs. Ramatoulaye, who is 47 years old (seated at right [in the photo] with one hand raised), is the group's featured borrower. She is married and the mother of four girls. Mrs. Ramatoulaye works selling foodstuffs and in the food service industry. She purchases beans and Café Touba [coffee flavored with Guinea pepper and spices] in the weekly markets and resells them at retail prices in her village.

With her new loan, Mrs. Ramatoulaye plans to purchase 20kg of beans each week at 700CFA francs per kilogram, and 5,000CFA francs' worth of Café Touba to sell after cooking and preparing. With the profits, she plans to help her husband in the management of the day-to-day expenses, and to care for her children (clothing, school fees, etc.).

loans.use: To purchase 20kg of beans each week at 700CFA francs per kilogram and 5000CFA francs' worth of Café Touba [coffee flavored with Guinea pepper and spices] to sell after cooking and preparing.

loans.name: Dalila

texts.es: Dalila de 49 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo y su hija, ella se dedica a la venta de pollo de engorde y a la agricultura siembra maiz. Desde hace 20 años comercializa sus productos en los alrededores de la zona donde ella reside y con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de concentrado para pollos, semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, entre otros, para poder continuar con su trabajo y asi poder tener mejores ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
Dalila, 49 years old, lives in her own home with her husband and her daughter. She has been selling broiler chickens and working in the agriculture sector, in which she farms corn. For the past 20 years, Dalila has sold her products in the surrounding area where she lives. With what she is able to get from her sales, she manages to cover some household costs. 

She is requesting a loan to purchase chicken feed, seeds, fertilizers, pest control, etc. to be able to continue with her work and have better income.

loans.use: To purchase chicken feed, seeds, fertilizers, pest control, etc.

loans.name: Halimatou's Group

texts.fr:
Créé le 22 Mai 2009, ce banc villageois est composé de femmes du groupement du village .Elles ont comme activité le petit commerce. Une bonne ambiance anime les rencontres du groupe. 

Madame Halimatou, âgée de 39 ans (debout à l’extrême  droite avec une main levée), est l’emprunteuse vedette du groupe. Elle est mariée et mère de 01 fille et d’un garçon. Elle s’active dans la vente de produits alimentaires et la restauration. Elle achète du riz, des légume set d’autres condiments pour son restaurant.

Avec son nouveau prêt, elle compte acheter 05 sacs de riz à 13000f le sac, 02 bidons de 20 litre d’huile raffinée à 17000f l’un, 01 sac d’oignon et d’autres condiments.

Avec les bénéfices, elle compte s’occuper de ses enfants ( habillements , scolarité…).
texts.en:
The banc villageois created on 22nd May 2009 is comprised of a group of women from the village.  Their business is petty trade. A good environment enccourages the group to meet.  Halimatou, who is 39 years old (in the back row, on the far right with her hand raised), is the group's leading borrower.  She is married and the mother of one girl and one boy.  Her business is selling foodstuffs and catering.  

She buys rice, vegetables and other condiments for her restaurant.  With her new loan, she plans to buy five bags of rice at 13000f per bag, two 20 litre containers of refined oil at 17000f each, one bag of onions and some other condiments.  With the profits she plans to provide clothes and schooling etc. for her children.

loans.use: to buy five bags of rice at 13000f per bag, two 20 litre containers of refined oil at 17000f each, one bag of onions and some other condiments.

loans.name: Anwar

texts.en:
Anwar is a 50-year-old woman. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her two sons and three daughters. Her husband has been running his own business of clothes selling for 18 years. Her husband is the only one responsible to feed the entire family and manage the household.

Her husband needs to purchase different types of clothes in bulk for reselling purposes, but due to insufficient financial means, he is unable to purchase these clothes. Therefore, Anwar is applying for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan so that she can assist her husband to purchase these clothes in bulk for his business. Her husband can also increase the size of his business and earn maximum profit with the help of this loan amount.

Anwar is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to increase her husband's clothes business.

loans.name: Genesis Maria

texts.es:
Cuando se habla de emprendedores juveniles, Génesis es un ejemplo a seguir para los demás, pues a sus 21 años de edad, quiere montar ya su laboratorio clínico, tras estar estudiando Bionalaisis clínico. Esta joven emprendedora está en cuarto año de su carrera y se siente más que realizada por cumplir con el deseo de ayudar a las personas y contribuir al ámbito de la salud. 
Génesis cuenta con el apoyo de su hermano y de su mamá, quien es asistente dental y no ha dudado en ser participe en esta nueva etapa que está a punto de comenzar. Ella solicita un préstamo para compra equipos de laboratorio como microcospio, centrifuga, agitador de tubos, contador de células, entre otros. Con esto podrá cumplir con su sueño de establecer su propio laboratorio clínico. En sus planes está trabajar por su cuenta sin dejar a un lado sus estudios.
texts.en:
When talking about young entrepreneurs, Génesis is a model for the rest to follow, since at 21 years old, she wants to establish her own clinical laboratory, while studying clinical bioanalysis. This young entrepreneur is in the fourth year of her program and feels more than ready to realize this desire to help people and contribute to the health field. 

Génesis has the support of her brother and her mother, who is a dental assistant and has not hesitated in participating in this new stage which she is about to begin. She asks for a loan to purchase lab equipment such as a microscope, centrifuge, test tube shaker, cell counter, and more. With this, she will be able to realize her dream of establishing her own clinical lab. In her plans are working for herself without neglecting her studies.

loans.use: to purchase a microscope, centrifuge, test tube shaker, cell counter, and more.

loans.name: Rosa Marisol

texts.es:
Rosa, comparte su vida con su compañero de vida y un hijo, en su hogar solamente viven tres personas; su actividad económica es la elaboración de jarcia como: lazos, hamacas, matates, etc.,  el negocio lo tiene desde hace 10 años, lo aprendió en su niñez cuando ayudaba a su madre a realizar dicho trabajo, por lo general trabaja con un horario de ocho de la mañana a cinco de la tarde, su mayor ventaja es que cuenta con muchos clientes establecidos.
Comprará pita de nylon y de seda en variedad de colores y grosores para poder elaborar sus productos, el propósito de la inversión es fortalecer su negocio para mejorar su vida familiar, la esperanza de Rosa es que aumente la rentabilidad y las ventas de su negocio.
Rosa aspira a tener un negocio más popular y tener junto a su familia un estilo de vida más confortable.
texts.en:
Rosa shares her life with her life partner and one child. Only three people live in her home. Her occupation is making handicrafts from agave fiber such as ropes, hammocks, bags, etc. She has had the business for 10 years. She learned it as a child when she would help her mother with the same work. Generally, her schedule is from 8:00 in the morning to 5:00 in the afternoon. Her greatest advantage is that she has a lot of regular customers. 

She will buy nylon and silk agave fibers in a variety of colors and thicknesses to be able to make her products. The purpose of this investment is to strengthen her business to improve her family life. Rosa’s hope is that the profit and sales of her business increase. 

Rosa aspires to have a more popular business and to have a more comfortable lifestyle with her family.

loans.use: to buy nylon and silk agave fibers in a variety of colors and thicknesses to be able to make her products.

loans.name: Uriel

texts.en:
Uriel has always been an entrepreneur with a passion to start his own business. As an immigrant from Mexico, Uriel has experienced a variety of challenges, including learning how to speak English. In the two years that he has been in this country, he has come a long way while working at restaurants and janitorial companies and has saved money in order to launch his own business.

In 2015, Uriel’s dreams of business ownership came true. Uriel recently started a commercial cleaning business that specializes in restroom sanitation and odor control. His company will provide deep sanitation to restrooms for businesses, sanitizing toilets, urinals and sinks. In addition, Uriel feels that he’s an excellent leader and owner who can provide an excellent service.

“My family and I decided to come to the USA with one purpose in mind: success.” Uriel’s dedication to providing for his family has always driven him to work hard. He was also inspired by his parents, who despite having very little education, provided all of their children with the best education they could.

Uriel will use his Kiva loan to start up his business and to purchase inventory and supplies. He is excited to develop his entrepreneurial capacity and is ready to face all kinds of challenges.

“I believe in my capacity to grow in this blessed country, help people with my service, and achieve the life that my family wants.”

loans.use: to start up his business and to purchase inventory and supplies.

loans.name: Mt Usambara Group

texts.en:
Nassoro, who is in her mid 40's is married with one kid who is still small.  She has been selling chips for seven years.  She works from 04pm to after mid-night daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Nassoro's 7th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loans to increase on the chips stock and has paid back all her loans successfully.  She used the profit to take care of her kid, to repay loan, built her own house and covered household expenses.  He will use this loan to buy Irish potatoes, cooking oil and charcoal for cooking.  She dreams of improving life.

Nassoro will share this loan with her loan group  Mt Usambara which has three members, who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy Irish potatoes, cooking oil and charcoal for cooking.

loans.name: Raldo Ernesto

texts.es: El joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 25 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo, trabaja como empleado en una empresa privada y con lo que obtiene de su trabajo ha logrado salir adelante, el joven vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, el quiere mejorar su vivienda construyendo un cuarto en el lugar que muestra la fotografía, pero ya que no posee el capital suficiente esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de los materiales de construcción que necesita y asi tener una mejor vivienda cómoda y segura.
texts.en: The young man whose face has been pixelated because he is 25 years old and lives in a high risk area works as an employee in a private business and, with what he earns from his job, he has managed to get ahead. The young man lives in his own house with his family. He wants to improve the house, building a room in the place shown in the photograph, but he doesn't have sufficient capital, so he is asking for a loan to purchase construction materials that he needs and, so, to have a better house, more comfortable and secure.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials.

loans.name: Juan Mauricio

texts.es: Juan de 55 años de edad es un hombre trabajador que se dedica desde hace 7 años a la albañilería, actividad que le ha permitido salir adelante. Juan vive en casa de su propiedad desde hace 12 años la cual logro construir en un terreno que compro con mucho esfuerzo, por lo que se siente feliz y orgulloso. Juan desea prepararse mejor para prestar un servicio más profesional, por lo que ha decidido invertir en herramientas, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: taladro, pulidora, almágana,  martillo, palas, etc.
texts.en:
Juan, 55 years old, is a working man who has been in the field of construction for the past 7 years, an occupation which has allowed him to move forward. Juan has lived in his own house for 12 years. He managed to construct the house on a plot of land that he bought with great effort, which is why he feels happy and proud. 

Juan wishes to prepare himself better to provide a more professional service, which is why he has decided to invest in tools. As such, he is asking FUSAI for a loan to invest in a drill, a sander, a sledgehammer, a hammer, shovels, etc.

loans.use: to invest in: a drill, a sander, a sledgehammer, a hammer, shovels, etc.

loans.name: Nuhu

texts.en: Nuhu is a Babban Gona maize farmer from Dallami village. Nuhu joined Babban Gona to increase his wealth. Through Babban Gona’s input loan, Nuhu will have access to the best farm inputs in the market such as fertilizers, herbicides and improved seeds that will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize/ hectare, double the Nigerian national average of 14 bags of maize.  This will see him increase his household income considerably. Thanks to Babban Gona's support, Nuhu now has the opportunity to increase his yields and income and use his extra earnings to build a house.

loans.use: To purchase improved farm inputs that will increase his maize yields

loans.name: Aliya

texts.en:
Aliya is a responsible mother of two children. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband has been providing transport facilities by driving a taxi for one year. He is responsible to fulfill the needs of the entire family.

Her husband needs to do maintenance on his taxi because the current condition of his taxi is not good. It requires more maintenance charges on a daily basis. Due to insufficient financial means, her husband is unable to do the maintenance of his taxi. Therefore, Aliya has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

With the help of this loan, Aliya's husband can afford the maintenance cost easily and provide better transport facilities to earn a profitable income. Aliya also plans to make savings with the profit amount of her husband's income to meet her family's needs in the future.

Aliya is very grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to repair her husband's taxi.

loans.name: Adriana

texts.en:
Adriana lives in Baucau, Timor-Leste with her family. She opened a shop in 2007 with her own money and is generating a good income through her sales.

Adriana is applying for a 1500 USD loan through Kiva's field partner Tuba Rai Metin to buy a refrigerator and stock for her shop such as beer, Fanta, Coca-Cola, Sprite, Sagiko, water, cooking oil, noodles, cigarettes, coffee, sugar, salt and slippers. She has been thinking of expanding her shop after years in business.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator and stock for her shop

loans.name: Segundo Ramón

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Jaime Roldos se reúne cada 15 días en el cantón Jaramijo este lugar es conocido por sus hermosas playas, la mayoría de los habitantes son muy trabajadores y dedicados a las faenas del mar.
En este lugar vive don Segundo, tiene 48 años de edad, hace varios años su mujer falleció  y de esta relación tienen tres hijos mayores de edad, dos de ellos viven en su casa.
El señor Segundo es un hombre muy trabajador que le gusta ir mejorando su vida, el tiene dos embarcaciones en las cuales envía a su personal a pescar, con el trabajan seis personas tres por cada embarcación, los mismos que salen por dos o tres días y luego regresan a la playa donde don Segundo vende la producción a comerciantes que llegan hasta el lugar,  son más de 25 años que lleva en esta actividad la cual le ha permitido salir adelante.
Este crédito es para comprar redes, piolas, anzuelos, carnadas, combustibles y ciertos arreglos en las embarcaciones. Lleva 5 ciclos en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos le sirven mucho. Sus sueños son ir mejorando su flota pesquera.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Jaime Roldos” meets every 15 days in the canton of Jaramijo, a place that is well-known for its beautiful beaches. Most of the residents are hardworking people who have jobs in the fishing industry.

Don Segundo lives in this place. He is 48 years old and his wife died several years ago. Segundo has three grown children, two of whom still live at home with him.

Sr. Segundo is a hardworking man who likes to improve his life. He has two boats that he uses for sending out his workers to catch fish. Segundo has six employees, three for each boat. The boats are out at sea for two or three days before returning to the beach where Don Segundo sells his catch to the merchants who arrive at the same place. He has been in this business for more than 25 years and it has allowed him to get ahead.

His loan will be used to buy nets, fishing line, hooks, bait, as well as pay for specific repairs to the boats. Segundo has participated in five loan cycles with his Communal Bank and enjoys being a member because the loans have been very useful to him. His dreams include improving his fishing fleet.

loans.use: to buy nets, fishing line, hooks, bait, and to pay for boat repairs.

loans.name: Ahmad Alhaji

texts.en: Ahmad Alhaji is a Babban Gona farmer from Sabon Gari Village. Ahmad Alhaji joined Babban Gona to become a better farmer. Through Babban Gona’s input loan, Ahmad Alhaji will have access to top-of-the-range farm inputs such as fertilizers, herbicides, and improved seeds. This loan will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize per hectare, double the 14 bags per hectare earned by the average Nigerian smallholder maize farmer. With the opportunity to earn high yields and increase his net income, Ahmad Alhaji would like to use his extra earnings to acquire more land to put innto Babban Gona program.

loans.use: To purchase improved farm inputs that will increase his maize yields

loans.name: Jorge

texts.en:
Jorge is a trucking expert, working as an owner/operator of his trucking business for over 15 years. He loves being on the road, and through his work he has been able to see many parts of his home state of New Jersey, along with neighboring states along the east coast.

He receives goods of all kinds from the Newark port and distributes them throughout New Jersey, New York, and other eastern states. All of this driving does lead to wear and tear, so Jorge is requesting this loan to help him make necessary repairs to his truck to keep him on the road and to be able to deliver essential goods for his customers.

loans.use: to fund repairs for his trucking business.

loans.name: Mehram

texts.en:
Mehram is a 62 year-old-woman, she lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her 6 children. Her husband has been working in the public sector organization for many years, and her husband is responsible for fulfilling the needs of the family. Mehram is also providing sewing services and earning an income to contribute with her husband to manage the household. 
She needs different kinds of goods for example, needles, thread, pieces of clothing, and machine oil etc for her business purpose, but due to insufficient financial means she is unable to purchase these accessories. Therefore, she has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. This loan will enable her to purchase these above accessories and also help her to increase monthly sales and profit by providing better sewing services.
Mehram is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to increase her tailoring business

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
The Chelsea Set, a salon in Maplewood, NJ, has been an institution in the town for decades, with its original owner operator opening its doors in 1979. When the owner, Libby, decided to retire last year, she passed the business on to talented stylist and former employee Alma. Alma, having been hired by Libby at the Chelsea Set straight out of beauty school, says taking ownership of the salon "closes the circle" for her. 

She is now 22 years into her career, having spent her first 16 working under Libby, and when Libby decided to pass the torch, Alma was the first person on her mind. In taking ownership, Alma brought an entirely new feel to the salon, now called Staynd Color. She has brought in more staff, (and more clients along with them) and has a growing reputation around the community for her mastery of the "balayage" technique for highlights - a brushstroke which produces a more natural look that doesn't leave obvious roots, even up to 6 months after the client's last hair appointment.

Alma will use this loan to bolster her working capital and continue to add her new flair to the 36-year-old salon she now calls her own.

loans.use: to provide working capital for her growing hair salon.

loans.name: Yakubu Dan Yautai

texts.en: Yakubu Dan Yautai   is a Babban Gona farmer from Sarki Village. He joined Babban Gona so that he could realise better yields on his farm. Since joining Babban Gona, Yakubu Dan Yautai   no longer has to worry about having inadequate income to repair his house. Through Babban Gona’s input loan he will have access to top of the range farm inputs such as fertilisers, herbicides and improved seeds that will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize/ hectare, double the national average in Nigeria.  This will see him increase his income considerably.  This season Yakubu Dan Yautai has ambitious plans to harvest  50  bags of maize. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Yakubu Dan Yautai  now has the opportunity to renovate his house.

loans.use: To purchase improved farm inputs that will increase his maize yields, so he can renovate his house

loans.name: Yahaya Bachanes

texts.en: Yahaya Bachanes  is a Babban Gona maize farmer from  Sarki Village. Yahaya Bachanes  joined Babban Gona to create a better life for his children. Through Babban Gona’s input loan, Yahaya Bachanes will have access to the best farm inputs in the market such as fertilisers, herbicides and improved seeds that will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize/ hectare, double the Nigerian national average of 14 bags. This will see him increase his household income considerably. Thanks to Babban Gona's support, Yahaya Bachanes now has the opportunity to increase his yields and income and use his additional earnings to build a better home for his family.

loans.use: To purchase improved farm inputs that will increase maize yields

loans.name: Nazia

texts.en:
Nazia is a responsible mother of two children. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband has been providing transport facilities by driving a taxi for 8 years. Her husband is responsible for fulfilling the needs of their entire family. Her husband needs to do maintenance on his taxi because the current condition of his taxi is not good; it requires more maintenance on a daily basis. Due to insufficient financial means, her husband is unable to do maintenance on his taxi. Therefore, Nazia has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan.
With the help of this loan, Nazia's husband can afford the maintenance cost easily and provide better transport facilities to earn profitable income. Nazia  also plans to make savings with the profit of her husband's income to meet her family's needs in the future.
Nazia is very grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to repair her husband's taxi.

loans.name: Anthony

texts.en: After over a decade in the salon industry, Tony has decided to take his career to the next level and purchase a hair salon of his own. Tony is a versatile, accomplished stylist with an impressive portfolio of editorial work that includes styling photo shoots for fashion publications, fashion shows for top designers, and celebrity styling assignments. Inspired by the creative aspects of the industry, Tony is also a master educator who spends a great deal of his time outside of the salon traveling the country teaching and inspiring professional stylists with the latest cutting and color techniques. Tony is Sassoon-trained, certified as a Framesi and Wella colorist, a TIGI Art team member, and an original educator for Japanese Bio Ionic straightening system. Tony prides himself as an all-around artist, but he specializes in special occasion styling, bridal styles, evening styles, wig cutting and styling. Tony is a sports enthusiast and spends his time out of the salon with his family, playing baseball, and coaching elite youth soccer and baseball teams.

loans.use: to purchase a beauty salon.

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
After meeting her fitness goals through developing a knowledge of healthy eating and juicing, Jennifer decided to turn her passion for food and health into a career. In 2013 she opened the 4 Seasons Cafe, where she serves natural juices, smoothies, detox waters and health food, along with a selection of burgers, salads, and other lunch food items to cater to the medical and college campuses near her store.

Her customers appreciate her wealth of knowledge on choosing the right foods and drinks to diet safely and healthily. She is requesting these funds to remodel the kitchen so she can be prepared for the incoming summer lunch rushes as her store grows in popularity.

loans.use: to remodel the kitchen in her cafe.

loans.name: Ana

texts.en:
After years of learning the ins and outs of the industry through hands-on experience as masseuses, Ana and her business partner Blanca (pictured together above) set out to create and run their own salon and spa. Their business focuses on providing top-of-the-line services including massages, spa treatments, and hair services to the community of North Bergen, New Jersey.

Their new establishment is seeing such success that they are looking to move to a larger space that can accommodate the high demand. This loan will help them to find and furnish a new salon big enough for their rapidly growing client base.

loans.use: to purchase equipment for her massage business.

loans.name: Rafael

texts.en:
Rafael has been working full-time at a distribution warehouse, but he wanted to look outside of that industry when he was searching for a part-time job to help make ends meet. He found a job working on the weekends in a graphics shop, and it did not take long for him to discover he had a natural knack for the work they were doing there.

After a few months in the shop, he noticed an unfortunate trend: the shop was receiving so many orders that they were facing the choice of either slowing down the turnaround time, lowering the quality, or turning customers away entirely. There just were not enough printers in the shop to meet the demand.

Rafael saw a solution to the store's problem, and an opportunity to break into the industry. He developed a proposal to the owner of the shop: he could start his own small business that would take the surplus clients off of their plate. That way, they would not have to compromise on order quality or speed. The owner, very pleased with the work Rafael had done for him so far, thought it was a great idea and agreed to develop a partnership between his shop and Rafael's new printing store. This loan will help Rafael to purchase printers so he can get his business up and running and serving clients.

loans.use: to purchase printers to start his own professional printing business.

loans.name: Razia

texts.en:
Razia is a 60-year-old woman who resides in Lahore, Pakistan. She looks after her family, which consists of two sons and six daughters as well.

Her husband has been running a restaurant for many years. He provides and serves good and fresh food meals to the people who work near his restaurant, which is situated in the main market. A great many shop keepers come into his restaurant to eat delicious food.

He needs some fresh food items to develop his business. In this regard, Razia contacted Kiva field partner BRAC Pakistan for a loan. BRAC issued the loan to Razia for the development of her husband's restaurant business.

Razia is very thankful to Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy food items for her husband' restaurant, for increasing the menu on a daily basis.

loans.name: Abida

texts.en:
Abida is a 51-year-old lady who resides in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is an active borrower with BRAC Pakistan. She is the mother of four daughters and one son.

Her husband has been running his own cattle farming business for the past 25 years. He is responsible for fulfilling the needs of his entire family and for managing the household.

Abida's husband wants to purchase animals for his business purpose, but due to financial constraints he is unable to purchase these cattle. Therefore, Abida has requested a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. This loan will enable her husband to buy these cattle to fulfill the needs of his business. This will also be good for him to earn a maximally profitable income derived from his business.

Abida is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan for this financial assistance.

loans.use: to enable her husband to increase his cattle business

loans.name: Riffat

texts.en:
Riffat is a 41-year-old woman, residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is a mother of 3 children. Her husband has been running a general store for the past ten years; her husband is responsible for fulfilling the needs of his entire family. Riffat's husband wants to purchase different kinds of commodities e.g rice, sugar, tea bags, milk, and other consumer items for his business purpose. Due to financial constraints, her husband is not in a suitable position to buy all these above products for reselling purposes. Therefore, Riffat has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. This loan will enable her husband to buy all these commodities and also help him to earn maximum profitable income to manage his household and business. 
Riffat is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to help her husband increase his general store business.

loans.name: Delfina

texts.en:
Delfina is a married woman with five children. She operates a retail business where she sells flour, sugar, sweets and other items. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her primary customers are locals. She will use the KES 25,000 loan to buy more flour, sugar, sweets and other items to sell. 

This is Delfina's third loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. She successfully repaid her previous loan. Her business goal is to have a wholesale business within five years.

loans.use: to buy more flour, sugar, sweets and other items to sell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy threads, silk, fancy sequins, and pearls of various colors for her embroidery work.

loans.name: Muhayo

texts.ru: 21 летняя красивая девушка Мухайё. Она из района Шахринав. Мухайё не замужем и не имеет детей. Она проживает вместе отцом и матерью. Мухайё молодая, привлекательная и шустрая швея. Она 2 года занимается шитьем женской одежды на заказ. Мухайё много лет шила на старом швейной машинке, и она уже устарела. Мухайё просит кредит для купли новой швейной машинки, чтобы ускорить процесс работы и привлечь себе больше клиентов. Она нуждается на Вашу поддержку. Мухайё верит в Вас и на Вашу поддержку.
texts.en:
Muhayo is a beautiful 21-year-old woman from the Shahrinav region. Muhayo is not married and does not have children. She lives with her father and mother. Muhayo is a young, attractive, and bright seamstress. She has been sewing women's clothes to order for 2 years, and has been sewing for many years on an old sewing machine, but it is already worn out. 

Muhayo is requesting a loan to buy a new sewing machine, which will speed up her work process and bring her more clients. She needs your support. Muhayo trusts in you and your support.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine.

loans.name: Geni Alejandrina

texts.es:
Cada 15 días se reúne el Grupo De Crédito Alegría Del Futuro en Lodana que  es un hermoso valle en Portoviejo, lo fuerte de la zona es la agricultura, existen sembríos de maíz y  arroz. Además se desarrolla la ganadería y en gastronomía tiene variedad de platos típicos, también sus habitantes se dedican a la venta de frutas.
En este lugar vive la señora Geni, tiene 44 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene 3 hijos de 28, 20 y 10 años, los dos son mayores son independientes y el mejor estudia en la escuela. Su esposo es agricultor.
Doña Geni realiza los créditos para que su marido los invierta en su trabajo, él tiene una propiedad donde el siembra todo el año, siembra en verano e invierno diferentes tipos de cultivos  de ciclo corto (maíz, maní, etc.).  El sale en lamadrugada y regresa después de las 17h30 de lunes a viernes y los sábados hasta las 14h00.  Le va muy bien y sus productos siempre los vende a buen precio.
