Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar semillas certificadas, herbicidas, urea, etc. Lleva ocho años en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por la organización y las charlas educativas. Su sueño es que su hija sea profesional.
texts.en:
The “Future Happiness” Credit Group meets each 15 days in Lodana, a beautiful valley in Portoviejo, which is an important agricultural zone replete with fields of corn and rice. Also, there is cattle raising and in gastronomy, there are a variety of typical local dishes. The inhabitants are also dedicated to selling fruit.

Geni lives here. She is 44 years old, married, and from this union has sprung three children, ages 28, 20, and 10. The two eldest are independent, while the youngest still studies in school. Geni's husband is a farmer.

Geni requests her loans so that they can invest in farming. Her husband has a property which he keeps planted all year long. He plants different crops on the short cycle summers and winters (corn, peanuts, etc.). He leaves the house early in the morning and returns after 5:30 pm, Monday through Friday, then works on Saturdays until  2:00 pm. Things are going very well for them and their produce always sells at a good price.

This loan will be used to purchase seeds, certifications, herbicides, urea, etc. Geni has belonged to her Credit Group for eight years and she likes it for its organization and its educational talks. Her dream is that her daughter may become a professional.

loans.use: buy seeds, certifications, herbicides, urea, etc., for planting crops of corn and peanuts, etc., year round.

loans.name: Frinda

texts.en:
Frinda is a married woman with three children. She operates a retail business where she sells vegetables. She has been involved in this business for five years.

Her primary customers are locals. She says that her biggest business challenge is low working capital. She will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy more carrots, onions, and tomatoes to sell.

This is Frinda's second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. She successfully repaid her previous loan. Her business goal is to be a distributor of groceries within five years. She hopes, in the future, to have a stable business and to educate her children.

loans.use: buy more carrots, onions, and tomatoes to sell

loans.name: Wilson

texts.en:
Wilson is a single man. He describes himself as being determined. 

He operates a transport business where he transports customers, using his motorcycle. He has been involved in this business for three years. His business is located in a busy area and his primary customers are locals. 

Wilson will use the KES 80,000 loan to buy another motorcycle. His business goal is to own two public service vehicles within five years. This is his third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. His previous loan was successfully repaid.

loans.use: to buy another motorcycle.

loans.name: Aileen

texts.en:
Aileen is 45 years old, married, and has two children, one of whom in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines. Aileen has been in this business for 20 years.

She requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell like soap, shampoo, eggs, chips, etc.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell like soap, shampoo, eggs, chips, etc.

loans.name: Juan Ricardo

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Señoras Exitosas se reúne cada 15 días en el barrio Medardo Mora en la ciudad de Manta,  ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año, por su gastronomía y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual con muchos atractivos turísticos.
En este lugar vive don Juan, tiene 65 años de edad, está casado y de esta relación tienen cinco hijos todos mayores de edad, uno de ellos aun viven en su casa. Su esposa es comerciante.
El señor Juan es un hombre que le ha gustado trabajar para darles a su familia lo necesario para vivir, el junto a su esposa se dedican al comercio, ellos tienen una tienda de víveres en su casa donde venden productos de primera necesidad, granos, detergentes, carnes, legumbres, además de productos de bazar, papelería y ciertas medicinas,  trabajan todos los días desde las 6h00 hasta las 19h00, son muchos los clientes que tiene y que ha logrado en los más de 30 años que lleva con su negocio el cual les deja muy buenas satisfacciones.
Este crédito lo va a invertir en comprar víveres para surtir su tienda.  Esta desde el inicio  en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos son de mucha ayuda. Sus sueños son seguir adelante y tener salud para seguir trabajando.
texts.en:
The communal bank Señoras Exitosas meets biweekly in the Medardo Mora neighborhood of the city of Manta, a town known for its beautiful beaches, which gets lots of visitors all year round. It is also known for its food, its incomparable beauty, and its many tourist attractions.

Juan is one of its residents. He is 65 years old, married, and has five adult children from his marriage, one of whom still lives at home. He has always enjoyed working in order to support his family. He and his wife are retailers. They have a grocery store set up in their home where they sell basic products like grains, meat, vegetables, and detergent, as well as other items like paper products and certain medicines. They work every day from 6:00 am to 7:00 pm. They have lots of customers, since they have been in business for over thirty years. Juan finds his work very rewarding.

He will invest this loan in purchasing groceries to stock his store. He has been with his communal bank since its inception, and he enjoys being a member because the loans help him a lot. He hopes to keep moving forward and stay healthy so that he can keep working.

loans.use: to buy groceries.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en: Ruth is a married woman. She has two children. She operates a farm where she grows mangoes and tomatoes. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located in an area with potential and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be drought. She will use the 30,000 KES loan to buy fertilizer. Her business goal is to be a supplier within five years. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer

loans.name: Mwongela

texts.en: Mwongela is a married man. He has one child. He operates a transport business where he transports customers using his motorcycle. He has been involved in this business for two years. His business is located in an area with potential and his primary customers are locals. He will use the 50,000 KES loan to buy another motorcycle. His business goal is to buy a taxi within five years. This is his fourth loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. His previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy another motorcycle

loans.name: María

texts.es:
Maria es una mujer de 34 años de edad, es casada tiene una linda familia de tres hijos de las edades entre 3 y 10 años, esta familia vive en una comunidad de Suchitepéquez.
Maria para sacar adelante a su familia se dedica  a la venta de maxan y flores exóticas, esta actividad lo tiene ella desde hace siete años, Maria con el afán de seguir superándose solicita un préstamo para poder comprar sus materiales de construcción como cemento, cal, arena  y construir su cocina, pues el lamentablemente no cuenta con el capital suficiente para poder adquirir sus materiales.
El gran sueño de Maria es poder terminar la construcción de su cocina para que su familia tenga un lugar donde preparar el alimento.
texts.en:
Maria is a 34 years old woman. She is married, has a beautiful family of three children ages 3 to 10 years, This family lives in a community of Suchitepequez.
 Maria to raise her family, earns a living with the sale of Maxan (leaves for wrapping tamales) and exotic flowers, which she has done for 7 years. Maria with the aim of progressing further, requests a loan to buy construction materials like cement, lime, sand to build her kitchen. Unfortunately, she does not have enough money to buy her building materials.
 Maria's great dream is to finish building her kitchen so her family has a place to prepare food.

loans.use: To buy building Materials like cement, lime and sand.

loans.name: Jebie

texts.en:
Jebie is a married woman with four children, two of whom are currently in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Jebie is 47 years old. 

Jebie has a fishing business in the Philippines. Jebie requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional fishing net and other materials for her business. Jebie has been in this business for 10 years. She would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional fishing net and other materials for her business

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily is a married woman. She has two children. She operates a retail business where she sells basins, cups, plates, and other items. Her business is located in a good area, and her primary customers are the general public.

She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds. She will use the KES 30,000 loan to buy more stock of basins, cups, and plates.

She hopes that in the future, she will be prosperous. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of basins, cups, and plates.

loans.name: Farah

texts.en:
Farah is a 44-year-old woman residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is a mother of one child. Her husband has been running a general store for the past year. Her husband is solely responsible for fulfilling the needs of his entire family. 

Farah's husband wants to purchase different kinds of commodities, such as rice, sugar, tea bags, milk, and other consumable items for his business. Due to financial constraints, her husband is not in a suitable position to buy all these products for reselling. Therefore, Farah has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner, BRAC Pakistan. This loan will enable her husband to buy all these commodities and will also be helpful for him to earn maximum income to manage his household and business. Farah is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to increase her husband's general store business

loans.name: Ligaya

texts.en:
Ligaya is a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Ligaya is 52 years old, and has one child still in school.

Ligaya has an abaca slipper-making business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy materials for her business.

Ligaya has been in this business for 11 years. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy materials for her business

loans.name: Liza

texts.en:
Liza is a married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Liza is 31 years old and has one child still in school.

Liza has a buy-and-sell chicken meat business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 26,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional chicken meat to sell in the market.

Liza has been in this business for seven years. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional chicken meat to sell in the market.

loans.name: Benedicto

texts.es:
Benedicto es un hombre de 42 años de edad, es casado tiene una hija de 18 años, esta humilde familia vive en una comunidad de Suchitepéquez.
Benedicto para obtener sus ingresos y sacar adelante a su familia trabaja como maestro desde hace diecisiete años, él ahora solicita un préstamo para poder comprar materiales de construcción para remodelar el sanitario que no se encuentra en buenas condiciones le comprar cemento, cal, arena.
Benedicto tiene las esperanzas de conseguir el crédito para mejorar su sanitario para el bien de su familia.
texts.en:
Benedicto is a 42 year-old married man with one 18 year-old daughter. This humble family lives in the community of Suchitepéquez. In order to earn income and raise his family, Benedicto has worked as a teacher for 17 years. 

He is now asking for the loan in order to be able to purchase construction materials such as cement, lime and sand to remodel his bathroom, which is not in good condition. 

Benedicto hopes to get the loan in order to improve the bathroom for the good of his family.

loans.use: to purchase cement, lime and sand materials.

loans.name: Kalsoom

texts.en:
Kalsoom is a 54-year-old woman. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is a responsible mother of five children. Her husband is a rickshaw driver by profession. For the past many days, his rickshaw has not been working properly, because of which her husband is unable to generate any amount of income.

Her husband wants to repair it as soon as possible. However, due to the lack of money, he finds it difficult to cover the cost of repairing the rickshaw. Therefore, Kalsoom has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to help her husband to cover the cost of repairing the rickshaw. This will help him to continue his business.

Kalsoom is so much thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to repair her husband's rickshaw.

loans.name: Ana Isabel

texts.es:
Cada 15 días se reúne el Grupo De Crédito Alegría Del Futuro en Lodana que  es un hermoso valle en Portoviejo, lo fuerte de la zona es la agricultura, existen sembríos de maíz y  arroz. Además se desarrolla la ganadería y en gastronomía tiene variedad de platos típicos, también sus habitantes se dedican a la venta de frutas.
En este lugar vive la señora Isabel, tiene 49  años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene 4 hijos de 24, 22, 18 y 16 años, el menor estudia en el colegio. Su esposo es maestro albañil. Viven en casa propia.
Doña Isabel se dedica a la venta de productos de Yanbal (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Trabaja todos los días de la semana cuatro horas al día, ella deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada ocho días. Tiene 18  años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien, lo que más vende son los perfumes y cosméticos.
Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas y cosméticos ya que tiene algunos pedidos. Está en el  Grupo De Crédito ocho años y le gustan las charlas educativas y los créditos adicionales como créditos emergentes. Su sueño es que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
The communal bank Alegría Del Futuro meets biweekly in Lodana, which is a beautiful valley in Portoviejo. This area is rich in agriculture, and there are many fields of corn and rice, as well as livestock. The local food includes many traditional dishes, and residents also sell fruit.

Isabel lives in this area. She is 49 years old, married, and has four children from her marriage, who are ages 24, 22, 18, and 16. The youngest is still in school. Her husband is a master builder and they own the house where they live.

Isabel works selling Yanbal products (beauty supplies, cosmetics, fragrances, and accessories for women). She works seven days a week, four hours a day. She delivers her products on credit and bills her customers weekly. She has been in this business for eighteen years and things are going very well for her. Her most popular items are the fragrances and cosmetics.

She will use this loan to buy creams and cosmetics, since she has some pending orders. She has been a member of her communal bank for eight years and she enjoys the educational sessions and borrowing opportunities. Her dream is for her children to have a career.

loans.use: to buy fragrances, creams, and cosmetics.

loans.name: Naranjo Group

texts.es:
Una comunidad oaxaqueña es famosa por tener una planta hidroeléctrica que permite el abastecimiento de energía eléctrica a una gran extensión del territorio. Además cuenta con un gran atractivo: la presa en cuyos límites se encuentran diferentes restaurantes donde la especialidad son los platillos a base de mojarra. La región pertenece a la cultura mazahua, aunque actualmente solo los adultos mayores de 40 años conservan la lengua madre; escucharlos charlar incita a aprenderla.
   El grupo Naranjo está integrado por ocho personas honestas, trabajaras y que persiguen un fin común: la estabilidad de sus familias. Ellos son: Ivette que maneja una repostería; Javier, una papelería; Evelyn, Gilberta y Jorge, una tienda de abarrotes cada uno. Por su lado José vende raspados de hielo; Betsabe, ropa y Alejandra, zapatos.
   José es conocido por ser una persona muy amigable; desde hace 15 años formó una familia con Claudia convirtiéndose en padres de un pequeño hijo. Con el firme propósito de brindar lo mejor a los suyos, se dedicó a trabajar en varias actividades como en la siembra y corte de caña de azúcar o a la pesca y venta de mojarra. Sin embargo, para pasar más tiempo con su familia, decidió iniciar con la venta de raspados de hielo
   Sobre una mesa coloca una gran barra de hielo, después utiliza un cepillo con el que raspa la barra para obtener una fina escarcha, el último paso es verter un delicioso jarabe de sabores frutales. Ocupa, además, vasos, bolsas, popotes, picante líquido y en polvo con el fin de satisfacer los gustos de sus clientes. Gracias a las ganancias obtenidas pudo comprar un triciclo que acondicionó para poder recorrer las calles de la ciudad ofreciendo una gran variedad de raspados, todos ellos con su toque personal. “Me gusta andar por las calles, platicar con mis clientes, satisfacer sus gustos y sobre todo obtener ganancias con las cuales ha cambiado favorablemente la calidad de vida de mi familia”.
   El préstamo otorgado lo invertirá en hielo, saborizantes, frutas, agua, chile, limón, leche, servilletas, vasos y popotes. Su sueño es establecer una peletería para ofrecer helados, fresas con crema, agua de frutas naturales y sus ricos raspados, aprovechando que las elevadas temperaturas de la región siempre favorecen la venta.

*La fotografía fue tomada en la casa de Evelyn, José es quien viste playera a rayas, short azul y una gorra color hueso.
texts.en:
This community in Oaxaca is famous for its hydroelectric plant, which provides energy to a significant part of the area. Moreover, it has different restaurants where the specialty are dishes based on "mojarra" (type of sea bream). The region is part of the "mazahua" culture, although people over 40 years old maintain their mother tongue. Listening to them makes you want to learn it. 

The Naranjo group is made of 8 honest and hard-working people who have a common goal: the stability of their families. These are its members: Ivette, who runs a patisserie; Javier, who runs a stationary shop; Evelyn, Gilberta and Jorge, who have a grocery store each; José, who sells slush; Betsabe, who sells clothes; and Alejandra, who sells shoes. 

José is known for being a friendly man. He started a family with Claudia 15 years ago and have a young son together. He has worked in different activities, such as sowing, cutting of sugar cane, fishing and sale of ¨mojarra", in order to provide his family with the best. However, he decided to start a business of slush to spend more time with his family. He puts a big ice bar on the table and uses a brush to graze the bar and obtain fine frost. He then pours a delicious syrup of fruity flavors. He also sells glasses, bags, straws and a spicy product (liquid and powder) to meet his clients' preferences. Thanks to his earnings, he has been able to buy a tricycle, which he uses to move around the city offering several types of slush, always with a personal touch. "I like to be on the streets, to talk to my clients, to meet their expectations and to obtain revenues to change the quality of life of my family for the better". 

He will use the loan to buy ice, flavoring, fruits, water, chili, lemon, milk, napkins, glasses and straws. His dream is to start a business where he would sell ice cream, strawberries with cream, natural fruit water and slush, making the most of the high temperatures of the region, that are favorable to sales. 

*The picture was taken in Evelyn's house. José is wearing a stripped t-shirt, blue shorts and a white hat.

loans.use: to buy ice, flavoring, fruits, water, chili, lemon, milk, napkins, glasses and straws.

loans.name: El Bosque Group

texts.es:
La comunidad donde habitan las integrantes del grupo El Bosque se caracteriza por el cultivo de plantas y la crianza de animales. El lugar aún alberga la cultura mazahua, algunas de las integrantes aún conservan su lengua materna y su stradiciones.
   Doña Lilia es muy trabajadora, su esfuerzo es fuente de inspiración para otras mujeres de la comunidad, ella formó una  familia con Moisés y juntos tuvieron tres hijos que actualmente ya son independientes. 
   Ella ha aprovechado otras oportunidades de préstamo con VisionFund por lo que está sumamente agradecida ya que logró mejorar sus negocios. Lilia comenzó a vender dulces al exterior de su casa, después de dos años abrió una tienda de abarrotes y con las ganancias obtenidas también pudo comprar un molino de nixtamal. "Gracias al préstamo y a Dios he crecido poco a poco" comenta Doña Lilia quien desde hace cuatro años agregó a sus actividades la elaboración de costuras. 
   Esta vez está solicitando el crédito para comprar más tela de diferentes tipos e hilos, pues desea ver este negocio tan exitoso como los demás. Actualmente tiene un taller de costura donde trabaja cómodamente, su tienda de abarrotes, su molino de nixtamal y su vivienda ya cuenta con dos niveles y con todos los servicios; esto le llena de emoción pues recuerda que anteriormente su vivienda era un solo cuarto con láminas por techo.
   Los demás integrantes del grupo son Crescencio quien invertirá en abarrotes, María Catalina, Maricela, María Isabel, María Areli, Silvia invertirán en borregos y Rosa Aurelia en conserva de frutas.

*La fotografía fue tomada en las escaleras del quiosco municipal, Doña Lilia es quien porta el sombreo*
texts.en:
The members of the El Bosque group live in a community known for plant cultivation and animal husbandry. The Mazahua culture is still preserved in this region, and some group members speak the language as their mother tongue and maintain local traditions.

Lilia is very hard-working, and her strength inspires other women in the community. She and her spouse Moisés have three grown-up children, now independent. She has taken advantage of the loans offered by VisionFund on other occasions, and is very grateful, as they have allowed her to expand her business activities. Lilia began by selling sweets outside her home, then two years later she opened a grocery store, and used the earnings from this to purchase a nixtamal (tortilla dough) mill. "Thanks to the loan and to God, I have grown little by little" says Lilia, who also began a sewing business two years ago.

This time she is requesting a loan to buy different kinds of materials and threads, as she would like to see her sewing business become as successful as her other businesses. She currently has a workshop where she can comfortably sew, her grocery store, the nixtamal mill, and her two-storey home now has all necessary services. This makes her very happy, because she remembers when her home was just a single room with a tin roof. 

The other members of the group are Crescencio, who will invest in groceries, María Catalina, Maricela, María Isabel, María Areli, Silvia, who will invest in lambs, and Rosa Aurelia, who will buy preserved fruit. 

*The photograph was taken on the steps of the municipal kiosk. Lilia is wearing a hat.*

loans.use: to buy different materials and threads.

loans.name: Ly

texts.en:
Ly is a 45-year-old, widowed grocer with a dependent child in her care. She resides in a village in the Takeo Province in Cambodia. 

She has been doing the business for over six years. Ly can make approximately USD 10 per day. 

Ly would like to request a loan because she needs finances to buy more groceries to sell. With this loan, she will be able to buy more groceries and improve her business. 

In the future, she is going to expand her business, save money to build a new, proper house, and support her child to go through high school.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Rukhsana

texts.en:
Rukhsana is a 35-year-old woman. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is a responsible mother of three children. 

Her husband is a rickshaw driver by profession. For the past many days, his rickshaw has not been working properly and, therefore, her husband is unable to generate any amount of income. Her husband wants to repair it as soon as possible. However, due to the lack of money, her husband finds it difficult to cover the cost of repairing his rickshaw. 

Therefore, Rukhsana has requested a loan from Kiva's partner, BRAC Pakistan, to help her husband to cover the cost of repairing his rickshaw. This will help him to continue his business. Rukhsana is so thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to repair her husband's rickshaw.

loans.name: Cristita

texts.en:
Cristita is 55 years old and has five children. Cristita is married and has one child still in school.

Cristita is in the agricultural business, raising ducks in the Philippines. Cristita requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins and other supplies to raise her ducks.

Cristita has been in this business for 5 years now, and has borrowed 5 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins and other supplies to raise her ducks

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a new variety of embroidery material for her husband's embroidery shop.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is a Kiva borrower with 3 children and he operates a transport business where he transports customers using his motorcycle. He has been involved in this business for 5 years. His business is located in a busy area and his primary customers are of all kinds. He describes his biggest business challenge to be poor roads. 

He will use the Kes 50,000 loan to repair his motorcycle. His business goal is to buy a taxi within 5 years. This is his fourth loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to repair his motorcycle, so as to be able to continue to transport passengers

loans.name: Maureen

texts.en:
Maureen is a single woman. She describes herself to be good. She operates a business where she sells cooking gas. She has been involved in this business for seven years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are the general public. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds. 

She will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy more gas cylinders. She hopes that in the future, she will be financially stable. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more gas cylinders.

loans.name: Ingrid Elizabeth

texts.es:
Cada 15 días se reúne el Grupo De Crédito Alegría Del Futuro en Lodana que  es un hermoso valle en Portoviejo, lo fuerte de la zona es la agricultura, existen sembríos de maíz y  arroz. Además se desarrolla la ganadería y en gastronomía tiene variedad de platos típicos, también sus habitantes se dedican a la venta de frutas.
En este lugar vive la señora Ingrid, tiene 28  años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene 2 hijos, uno de 7 años que estudia en la escuela y un bebé de un mes de nacido. Su esposo es agricultor. Viven en casa propia.
Doña Ingrid realiza los créditos para que su marido los invierta en su trabajo, él tiene una propiedad donde siembra durante todo el año, trabaja de Lunes a Sábados, siembra en verano e invierno diferentes tipos de cultivos  de ciclo corto, tiene dos jornaleros que trabajan con él. Le va muy bien y sus productos siempre los vende a buen precio.
Este crédito lo va a emplear en pagar a los trabajadores y comprar semillas certificadas, herbicidas y urea. Lleva cinco años en el Grupo De Crédito y le gustan las charlas educativas y los créditos emergentes. Su sueño es poder estudiar en la Universidad.
texts.en:
Every 15 days, the "Grupo De Crédito Alegría Del Futuro" [Joy Of Future Credit Group] meets in Lodana, which is a beautiful valley in Portoviejo. The strong point in the area is ​​agriculture. There are fields of corn and rice. In addition, livestock is developed, and its gastronomy has a variety of typical dishes. Also, its inhabitants work in fruit sales.

In this place lives Ingrid. She is 28 years old, is married, and has 2 children from this relationship: a 7-year-old who studies at school and a one-month-old baby. Her husband is a farmer. They live in a house of their own.

Ingrid requests the loans so that her husband invests them in his work; he has a property where he plants throughout the year. He works from Monday to Saturday. He plants, in summer and winter, different types of short-cycle crops. He has two day laborers working with him. He is doing very well and always sells his products at a good price. He is going to use this loan to pay the workers and buy certified seeds, herbicides, and urea. 

Ingrid has been in the Credit Group for five years and likes educational talks and emergency loans. Her dream is to be able to study in college.

loans.use: 's husband to pay workers and buy certified seeds, herbicides, and urea.

loans.name: Emelita

texts.en:
Emelita is 52 years old, married and has six children.

Emelita is in the agricultural business, raising pig in the Philippines. Emelita requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pig.

Emelita has been in this business for 10 years now, and has borrowed 5 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pig

loans.name: Rouguy's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe créé depuis 2007,rassemble en son sein des membres qui habitent la même commune et ont comme activité le commerce.

kORKA qui se trouve à droite de la photo et levant le bras,est la représentante du groupe,elle est âgée de 23 ans,elle est mariée et mére d'un garçon.

Son activité est le commerce de vêtements de prét à porter.

Elle compte acheter avec le crédit des vêtements d'une valeur de 50000f.

Son objectif est de renforcer son fonds de commerce, participer aux charges familiales et renforcer son épargne.
texts.en:
This group, established in 2007, brings together members who live in the same municipality and run small businesses.

Korka, raising her hand at right in the photo, is the group's leader. She is 23 years old, married, and the mother of one boy. Her business is selling ready-to-wear clothing. Korka plans to purchase clothing worth 50,000 CFA francs with the loan. Her goal is to strengthen her business, contribute to the family expenses, and increase her savings.

loans.use: To purchase ready-to-wear clothing.

loans.name: Mehrangez

texts.en:
Mehrangez is a cheerful woman. She was born in a southern part of Tajikistan in 1995. She is living in a small town and is married. She is a student at university and was studying with excellence, but she got married and was responsible to keep the household and also continue her studies. She is well known among friends and course mates. 

She is asking for financial support from Kiva and IMON to pay her higher education costs. She awaits Kiva lenders’ kindness.

loans.use: to pay her higher education costs.

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Wilma is 53 years old and married with three children. She works very hard to provide for them. Wilma runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional groceries to sell like noodles, spices, canned goods, milk, coffee, drinks, etc.

Wilma has been in this business for 10 years.  She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional groceries to sell like noodles, spices, canned goods, milk, coffee, drinks, etc.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is a married woman, with 4 children and she operates a dairy farm. She has been involved in this business for 3 years. Her primary customers are  all kinds. She describes her biggest business challenge to be drought. 

She will use the Kes 40,000 loan to buy more cows. She hopes that in the future, she will be a huge supplier of milk. This is her fourth loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more cows to increase milk supplies in her neigbourhood

loans.name: Enriquita

texts.en:
Enriquita is 64 years old and married with nine children. Enriquita works very hard to provide for her family.

Enriquita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drinks etc.

Enriquita has been in this business for 9 years. 

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drinks etc

loans.name: Epegenia

texts.en:
Epegenia is 70 years old, married and has eighth children.

Epegenia is in the agricultural business, farming rice in the Philippines. Epegenia requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers for her rice crop and other farm supplies.

Epegenia has been in this business for 2 years now, and has borrowed 6 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her rice crop and other farm supplies

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel is 40 years old and has six children. She is married and has three children who are presently in school. She is in the agricultural business of pig fattening in the Philippines. 

Maricel has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her pig. She has been doing this for two years now, and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain it. She would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her pig.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is 40 years old. She is married and has three children who are still in school.

Marites is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. She requested a 20,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins and other supplies to raise her pig.

Marites has been in this business for five years now and has borrowed eight times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins and other supplies to raise her pig

loans.name: Elynita

texts.en:
Elynita is 50 years old, married, and has six children, two of whom are still in school. She is in the agricultural business, fattening pigs in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Elynita has been in this business for 10 years now, and has borrowed 4 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it. She would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en:
Milagros is 54 years old, married and has one child.

Milagros is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Milagros requested a 23,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pig.

Milagros has been in this business for seven years now and has borrowed six times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pig

loans.name: Zeenat

texts.en:
Zeenat is a 39-year-old, active borrower of BRAC Pakistan. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is a mother of one son and three daughters, and her husband has been doing a scrap recycling business and manages to the household.

Zeenat's husband needs to buy scrap material in bulk to recycle it, but due to some financial constraints he is not in suitable position to buy the scrape in bulk. Therefore, Zeenat has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. This loan amount will enable her husband to purchase the scrap material in bulk, so that he can easily adopt the recycling procedure and earn a profitable income derived from his business.

Zeenat is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan for this financial assistance.

loans.use: to help her husband to increase his recycling material business.

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda is a 45-year-old married woman with five children, two of whom are still in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Rosalinda has a pineapple fiber-weaving business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy pineapple leaves and other materials for fiber-weaving business.

Rosalinda has been in this business for 23 years. She would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy pineapple leaves and other materials for her fiber-weaving business.

loans.name: Nany

texts.en:
Nany is 53 years old and married with eight children, one of whom is still in school. Nany works very hard to provide for them, running a general store in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drinks, etc.

Nany has been in this business for 20 years. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drinks, etc.

loans.name: Simeona

texts.en:
Simeona is a 38-year-old married woman with six children, four of whom are currently in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur who has a rice retailing business in the Philippines. 

Simeona has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more sacks of rice to sell. She has been in this business for 5 years. She would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Teresita works hard to support her family. She has a business buying and selling spare motorcycle parts in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a car wash. 

Teresita is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to purchase more products like tires, engine oil and other spare parts to sell. She has been sustaining her business activities through her past 7 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more products like tires, engine oil and other spare parts to sell.

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline is 42 years old, married, and has one child, who is in school. She is in the agricultural business, fattening pigs in the Philippines. Evangeline has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Evangeline has been in this business for 3 years now, and has borrowed 1 time in the past from NWTF to sustain it. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Miguel

texts.es: Miguel  es un señor de 65 años de edad, tiene 4 hijos pero todos ellos ya viven independientemente ya que son mayores de edad, Miguel vive en el campo  y comenta  que en este lugar  los ingresos económicos los obtienen principalmente de la crianza de animales y de la agricultura, la esposa de Miguel se dedica a cuidar sus animales. Miguel se dedica al jornal de trabajos del campo y el dinero lo solicita para invertirlos  para compra pollos, Miguel tiene su aspiración que en medio de su pobreza logre mejorar su negocio y  pueda salir adelante junto a su esposa y apoyar a sus hijos y a sus nietos.
texts.en:
Miguel is a man of 65 years of age; he has 4 children but all of them live on their own, as they are all adults now. Miguel lives in the fields, and says that the income he gets there comes mainly from the raising of animals, as well as from agriculture. Miguel's wife works by taking care of the animals, and Miguel works as a day laborer in the fields.

He is requesting the loan so that he can invest in the purchase of chickens. Miguel, despite his poverty, aspires to improve his business to get ahead and, with his wife by his side, be able to help their children and grandchildren.

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of chickens.
